original: rgod pa'i sgo nas yang dag par rab tu mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: rgod pa'i sgo nas yang dag par rab tu mi 'dzin to //

analyzed: sdud pa ni rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi sgo nas nang du zhum pa'o //

original: g-yeng ba ni sdug pa'i mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang ba'i sgo nas yul rnams la rnam par 'phro ba'o //üîΩzhum ba med pa dang mthun pa bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: g-yeng ba ni sdug pa'i mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang ba'i sgo nas yul rnams la rnam par 'phro ba'o // zhum ba med pa dang mthun pa bsgom pa ni /

original: so sor rtog pa'i mtshan ma la brten nas chos la rnam par lta ba'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i mtshan ma la brten nas chos la rnam par lta ba'o //
translated: The cultivation that is favorable to non-slackness is internal non-scattering through the sign of discernment, which is the observation of the Dharma.

analyzed: g-yeng ba med pa dang mthun pa ni sgra la sogs pa'i rdzas la mi gtsang ba so sor rtog pa'o //

analyzed: de gnyi ga'i gnas dang mthun pa ni snang ba'i 'du shes so //

original: de yang bdag gi 'dun pa ha cang zhum par mi 'gyur ba dang ha cang rab tu bzung ba yang ma yin pa dang nang du bsdus pa yang ma yin pa dang / phyi rol tu g-yeng ba ma yin pa dang / phyi ma dang snga ma'i 'du shes dang /
analyzed: de yang bdag gi 'dun pa ha cang zhum par mi 'gyur ba dang ha cang rab tu bzung ba yang ma yin pa dang nang du bsdus pa yang ma yin pa dang / phyi rol tu g-yeng ba ma yin pa dang / phyi ma dang snga ma'i 'du shes dang /

original: steng dang 'og gi 'du shes su bya'o snyam pa dang / de ltar rnam par phye ba'i sems kun nas dkris pa med pas snang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bsgom par bya'i /
analyzed: steng dang 'og gi 'du shes su bya'o snyam pa dang / de ltar rnam par phye ba'i sems kun nas dkris pa med pas snang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bsgom par bya'i /
translated: Thus, since the mind is not bound by such analysis, one should cultivate a mind endowed with illumination.

analyzed: bdag gi sems 'dun pa can gyi tshul du ni mi 'gyur bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /

translated: Having thus well trained in samƒÅdhi,

analyzed: chos mngon par shes par bya ba gang dang gang mngon du bya bar 'dod pa de dang / de la sems mngon par gtod pa /

analyzed: de rang rang gi gnas kyi chos rnams la mngon du 'gyur ba'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: ji ltar 'dod bzhin rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i yon tan bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi dmigs pa gang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams so //

analyzed: bden pa bzhi mngon par rtogs pa sbyor ba'i bsdus pas de'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

original: ngo bo nyid gang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang /
translated: What is their nature?

original: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab po //
analyzed: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab po //

analyzed: grog gang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //

original: brtson 'grus ba rtsom sa pa ni /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ba rtsom sa pa ni /

analyzed: bden pa rnams la nye bar gnas pa'i dran pa mi brjed pa'i tshul gyis bsgom par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bden pa rnams la nye bar gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa'i tshul gyis bsgom par 'gyur ro //
translated: One cultivates the samadhi that abides in the truths by the method of a one-pointed mind.

original: bden pa rnams la mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes rab ni ;
analyzed: bden pa rnams la mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes rab ni ;
translated: The wisdom that is equipoised in the truths

original: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i tshul gyis bsgom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i tshul gyis bsgom par 'gyur ro //

original: 'bras bu gang bden pa myur du mngon par rtogs par byed pa dang / de'i dbang gis ring por mi thogs par mthong ba'i lam skye ba dang / dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang chos kyi mchog rnams bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang bden pa myur du mngon par rtogs par byed pa dang / de'i dbang gis ring por mi thogs par mthong ba'i lam skye ba dang / dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang chos kyi mchog rnams bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The result is that one quickly realizes the truths and, by the power of that, the path of seeing is born without delay, and the heat, peak, forbearance, and supreme mundane qualities are accomplished.

analyzed: de nyid kyi dus na nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la brten pa'i sems kyi rgyud do //

analyzed: dbang po rnams la ji lta bar stobs rnams la yang de bzhin no //

original: 'di ni bye brag yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bye brag yin te /

analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs nges par bsrabs pas mi brdzi ba'i phyir stobs rnams so //

analyzed: stobs rnams kyi dmigs pa la sogs pa ni dbang po rnams dang mthun no //

original: 'bras bu la ni bye brag yod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu la ni bye brag yod do //

original: 'di ltar 'di dag ni 'bras bu de ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag ni 'bras bu de ni /
translated: The fruits of the faculties are the powers,

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /

analyzed: ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsrabs pas lhag par brtan pa yin ste /

original: de'i phyir 'di dag gi dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid la sogs pa mthun du zin kyang mi brdzi ba'i don gyi bye brag gi byang chub kyi phyogs gzhan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag gi dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid la sogs pa mthun du zin kyang mi brdzi ba'i don gyi bye brag gi byang chub kyi phyogs gzhan nyid do //
translated: Therefore, although their objective supports, natures, etc. are the same, the factors of enlightenment are different in meaning because they are not overcome.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyi dmigs pa gang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyi dmigs pa gang /

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag gi yang dag pa nyid ji lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag gi yang dag pa nyid ji lta ba'o //
translated: It is the reality of the four noble truths just as it is.

original: don dam pa rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don dam pa rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by the objective support of the purification of the ultimate.

original: ngo bo nyid gang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang /
translated: What is their nature?

original: dran pa dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms so //

translated: concentration, andüîΩequanimity.

original: de la dran pa ni gnas kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: de la dran pa ni gnas kyi yan lag go //
translated: Among these, mindfulness is the limb of establishment,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni dge ba'i chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni dge ba'i chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: chos rnam par 'byed pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi yan lag go //

analyzed: byang chub kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: brtson 'grus ni nges par 'byung ba'i yan lag go //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni nges par 'byung ba'i yan lag go //

original: des bgrod pa ji srid par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //

original: dga' ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: dga' ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //

original: des sems kyi rgyud tshim par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des sems kyi rgyud tshim par byed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag ste /

original: gang gis kyang kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba dang / gang du yang kun @227a * //
analyzed: gang gis kyang kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba dang / gang du yang kun @227a * //

original: nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa gang yang med pa'o //
analyzed: nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa gang yang med pa'o //
translated: There is no defilement by anything, nor is there defilement anywhere, nor is there any defilement at all.

analyzed: de la shin tu sbyangs pas ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Of these, there is no defilement by serenity,

original: des gnas ngan len 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des gnas ngan len 'jig pa'i phyir ro //

original: ting nge 'dzin la ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur te /

original: de la gnas pa gnas gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gnas pa gnas gyur pa'i phyir ro //

original: btang snyoms ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ste /

analyzed: grogs gang de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //

original: bsgom pa gang /

analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dben pa la gnas pa /

translated: These four phrases ‚Äúbased on seclusion,‚Äù etc., indicate the cultivation of the limbs of enlightenment that have the four noble truths as their object.üîΩThus, the observation of suffering as suffering

analyzed: de las dpen pa tshol bas sdug bsngal la dmigs pa ni dben pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: srid pa'i mtshan nyid ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba ste /

analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam ni /

translated: because it completely holds the reality that is experienced.

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni gzhan go bar byed pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni gzhan go bar byed pa'i yan lag go //
translated: Right thought is the limb of causing others to understand,

original: des ji ltar rtog pas rnam par bzhag nas ngag kun du slong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ji ltar rtog pas rnam par bzhag nas ngag kun du slong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because, having established the teaching through thought, one causes speech to be generated.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba ni gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba ni gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: Right speech, right action, and right livelihood are the limbs of causing others to have faith,

original: lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because view, morality, and livelihood are purified.

original: de dag gis rtog pa dang mthun pa'i lta ba la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i go rims bzhin du gzhan dag gis gtan la phebs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis rtog pa dang mthun pa'i lta ba la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i go rims bzhin du gzhan dag gis gtan la phebs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because others ascertain the purity of view, etc. in accordance with their thought.

original: de la yang dag pa'i ngag gis ni rtogs pa dang / 'dri ba dang / lung ston pa 'brel ba'i gtam gtan la 'bebs pas /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i ngag gis ni rtogs pa dang / 'dri ba dang / lung ston pa 'brel ba'i gtam gtan la 'bebs pas /
translated: By means of right speech, one causes others to have faith in one‚Äôs view, because one ascertains the teaching in a manner that is connected with what is understood, with questions, and with predictions.

original: de'i lta ba rnam par dag par rnam par shes so //
analyzed: de'i lta ba rnam par dag par rnam par shes so //
translated: Thus, one‚Äôs view is recognized as pure.

original: yang dag pa'i las kyi mthas ni 'gro ba dang ldog pa la sogs pa spyod pa phun sum tshogs pas tshul khrims rnam par dag pa rnam par shes so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las kyi mthas ni 'gro ba dang ldog pa la sogs pa spyod pa phun sum tshogs pas tshul khrims rnam par dag pa rnam par shes so //
translated: By right action, one knows the purity of morality through the perfection of conduct, such as going and returning.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho bas ni ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du chos gos la sogs pa tshol ba yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba rnam par dag par shes so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho bas ni ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du chos gos la sogs pa tshol ba yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba rnam par dag par shes so //
translated: By right livelihood, one knows the purity of right livelihood through seeking Dharma robes and so on in accordance with one's station.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol bas ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i yan lag go //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol bas ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i yan lag go //
translated: Right effort is the branch that purifies the obscurations of the afflictions.

original: des kun du sbyong ba ma lus pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des kun du sbyong ba ma lus pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it completely eliminates all that is to be purified.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i yan lag go //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i yan lag go //
translated: Right mindfulness is the branch that purifies the obscurations of the secondary afflictions.

original: des yang dag pa'i zhi gnas la sogs pa'i mtshan ma ma brjed pas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa byed ba la sogs pa'i skabs med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: des yang dag pa'i zhi gnas la sogs pa'i mtshan ma ma brjed pas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa byed ba la sogs pa'i skabs med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because by it, the signs of right shamatha and so on are not forgotten, and there is no opportunity for the secondary afflictions of laziness and so on.

original: / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni yon tan khyad par can la sgrib pa rnam par sbyong pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni yon tan khyad par can la sgrib pa rnam par sbyong pa'i yan lag go //
translated: Right concentration is the member that purifies the obscurations to the special qualities.

original: des mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because by it one accomplishes the qualities such as the superknowledges.üîΩWhat is its companion?

original: grogs gang / de dang mtshungs bar ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //üîΩbsgom pa ni byang chub @228a * //
analyzed: grogs gang / de dang mtshungs bar ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so // bsgom pa ni byang chub @228a * //
translated: It is the mind and mental activities associated with it.

original: kyi yan lag bzhin no //
analyzed: kyi yan lag bzhin no //
translated: Cultivation is like the members of enlightenment.üîΩIt is like the members of enlightenment.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:üîΩOne cultivates right view based on solitude, etc.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dben pa la gnas par bsgom zhes rgya cher tshig de rnams kyi don ji lta bar gong du brjod pa de ltar 'dir khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dben pa la gnas par bsgom zhes rgya cher tshig de rnams kyi don ji lta bar gong du brjod pa de ltar 'dir khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of these words should be understood as explained above.

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang /
translated: What is its result?

original: yongs su gcod par byed pa dang / gzhan go bar byed pa dang / gzhan yid ches par byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa dang / yon tan khyad par can la sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su gcod par byed pa dang / gzhan go bar byed pa dang / gzhan yid ches par byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa dang / yon tan khyad par can la sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: 1) the elimination of the obscurations of the afflictions, 2) the elimination of the obscurations of the secondary afflictions, and 3) the elimination of the obscurations to the special qualities.

original: lam bzhi gang /
analyzed: lam bzhi gang /
translated: What are the four paths?

original: mngon par shes pa bu la dka' ba dang / mngon par shes pa myur la dka' ba dang / mngon par shes pa phul la sla ba dang / mngon par shes pa myur la sla ba ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa bu la dka' ba dang / mngon par shes pa myur la dka' ba dang / mngon par shes pa phul la sla ba dang / mngon par shes pa myur la sla ba ste /
translated: 1) the difficult path with slow superknowledge, 2) the difficult path with quick superknowledge, 3) the easy path with slow superknowledge, and 4) the easy path with quick superknowledge.

original: dang po ni dbang po rtul po dngos gzhi'i bsam gtan ma thob po'i'o //
analyzed: dang po ni dbang po rtul po dngos gzhi'i bsam gtan ma thob po'i'o //
translated: The first is for those of dull faculties who have not attained the actual concentration.

original: gnyis pa ni dbang po rnon po dngos gzhi'i bsam gtan ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dbang po rnon po dngos gzhi'i bsam gtan ma thob pa'o //
translated: The second is for those of sharp faculties who have not attained the actual concentration.

original: gsum pa ni dbang po rtul po dngos gzhi'i bsam gtan thob pa'i'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni dbang po rtul po dngos gzhi'i bsam gtan thob pa'i'o //
translated: The third is for those of dull faculties who have attained the actual concentration.

original: bzhi pa ni dbang po rnon po dngos gzhi'i bsam gtan thob pa'i'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni dbang po rnon po dngos gzhi'i bsam gtan thob pa'i'o //
translated: The fourth is for those of sharp faculties who have attained the actual concentration.

original: de la dka' ba'i lam ni mi lcogs pa med pa dang / gzugs med pa la brten pa ste /üîΩgo rims bzhin du zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong zhan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsla ba ni bsam gtan la brten pa ste /
analyzed: de la dka' ba'i lam ni mi lcogs pa med pa dang / gzugs med pa la brten pa ste / go rims bzhin du zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong zhan pa'i phyir ro // sla ba ni bsam gtan la brten pa ste /
translated: The difficult path is the path of the unshakable ones and the path of the formless realm.

original: zung du 'brel bar 'jug pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmngon par shes pa bul ba ni /
analyzed: zung du 'brel bar 'jug pa'i phyir ro // mngon par shes pa bul ba ni /
translated: The easy path is the path of the once-returners and the path of the steadfast.

original: dka' ba dang sla ba'i gnas 'di gnyis pa ste /üîΩdbang po rtul po rnams kyi'o //üîΩmngon par shes pa myur ba ni /
analyzed: dka' ba dang sla ba'i gnas 'di gnyis pa ste / dbang po rtul po rnams kyi'o // mngon par shes pa myur ba ni /
translated: The slow superknowledge is the path of the unshakable ones and the path of the formless realm.

original: 'di nyid la brten te dbang po rnon po rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid la brten te dbang po rnon po rnams kyi'o //
translated: The quick superknowledge is the path of the once-returners and the path of the steadfast.

original: chos kyi gnas bzhi gang /
analyzed: chos kyi gnas bzhi gang /
translated: What are the four states of dharmas?

original: brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: They are the absence of covetousness, the absence of malice, right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: de la brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa ni /
analyzed: de la brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa ni /
translated: Among them, the absence of covetousness and the absence of malice

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa rnam par sbyong ngo //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa rnam par sbyong ngo //
translated: purify the training in superior morality.

original: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba'i sgo nas bslab pa'i gnas mi nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba'i sgo nas bslab pa'i gnas mi nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not violate the precepts through attachment and aversion.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa ni lhag pa'i sems so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa ni lhag pa'i sems so //
translated: Right mindfulness is the basis of the training in superior thought.

original: dmigs pa ma brjed na sems mnyam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa ma brjed na sems mnyam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind becomes concentrated when the object is not forgotten.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni lhag ba'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni lhag ba'i shes rab bo //
translated: Right concentration is the basis of the training in superior discernment.

original: sems mnyam bar gzhag pa las yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems mnyam bar gzhag pa las yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one knows things as they really are when the mind is concentrated.

original: zhi gnas gang /
analyzed: zhi gnas gang /
translated: What is calm abiding?

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩnang nyid la sems 'jog pa dang / rgyun du 'jog pa dang / blan te 'jog pa dang / nye bar 'jog pa dang / 'dul bar byed pa dang / zhi bar byed pa dang / rnam @228b par zhi bar byed pa dang / rtse gcig tu byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / nang nyid la sems 'jog pa dang / rgyun du 'jog pa dang / blan te 'jog pa dang / nye bar 'jog pa dang / 'dul bar byed pa dang / zhi bar byed pa dang / rnam @228b par zhi bar byed pa dang / rtse gcig tu byed pa dang /
translated: It is:

original: mnyam par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par 'jog pa'o //
translated: the fixing of the mind on an object, the continuous fixing of the mind on an object, the repeated fixing of the mind on an object, the close fixing of the mind on an object, the disciplining of the mind, the pacification of the mind, the complete pacification of the mind, the one-pointedness of the mind, and the concentratedness of the mind.

original: zhi gnas ni sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas ni sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: Calm abiding is the fixing of the mind on an object in nine stages.

original: de la phyi rol gyi dmigs pa rnams las bsdus nas de nang du mi g-yeng bar gang dang po nyid du sems nye bar 'dogs pa ni 'jog pa'o //üîΩde ltar sems g-yo ba rags pa thog ma de nyid du nye bar btags pa de dmigs pa de nyid la rgyun gyi tshul dang / phra bar byed pas mngon par sdud pa ni rgyun du 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: de la phyi rol gyi dmigs pa rnams las bsdus nas de nang du mi g-yeng bar gang dang po nyid du sems nye bar 'dogs pa ni 'jog pa'o // de ltar sems g-yo ba rags pa thog ma de nyid du nye bar btags pa de dmigs pa de nyid la rgyun gyi tshul dang / phra bar byed pas mngon par sdud pa ni rgyun du 'jog pa'o //
translated: Among the external objects, the mind is first of all fixed on the object to which it is to be applied, without distraction.üîΩThe mind is fixed continuously on that object, in a subtle way, after the gross distraction has been removed.

original: dran pa brjed nas phyi rol tu g-yeng bar gyur pa de dran pas bkug pa ni blan te 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa brjed nas phyi rol tu g-yeng bar gyur pa de dran pas bkug pa ni blan te 'jog pa'o //
translated: The mind is fixed again after it has been drawn back by mindfulness, having been distracted externally through the loss of mindfulness.

original: sems phyi rol du mi 'phro bar bya ba'i phyir thog ma nyid du dran pa nye bar gnas pa ni nye bar 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: sems phyi rol du mi 'phro bar bya ba'i phyir thog ma nyid du dran pa nye bar gnas pa ni nye bar 'jog pa'o //
translated: The mind is fixed near to the object in order to prevent its distraction externally.

original: sngar ltar rnam par g-yeng ba'i rgyu gzugs la sogs pa la nye bar dmigs kyi 'du shes kyi dbang du byas nas thog ma nyid du sems rab tu 'phror mi ster ba ni 'dul bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sngar ltar rnam par g-yeng ba'i rgyu gzugs la sogs pa la nye bar dmigs kyi 'du shes kyi dbang du byas nas thog ma nyid du sems rab tu 'phror mi ster ba ni 'dul bar byed pa'o //
translated: The mind is controlled by means of the notion of the object, so that it does not scatter externally, as it did previously.

original: sems 'khrug par byed pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par rtog pa rnams la nyes dmigs su bltabs 'phror mi ster ba ni zhi bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems 'khrug par byed pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par rtog pa rnams la nyes dmigs su bltabs 'phror mi ster ba ni zhi bar byed pa'o //
translated: The pacification of the mental afflictions is the pacification of the mental afflictions that are the secondary mental afflictions that disturb the mind.

original: dran pa brjed nas rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa kun du 'byung bas na de dang du mi len pa ni rnam par zhi bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa brjed nas rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa kun du 'byung bas na de dang du mi len pa ni rnam par zhi bar byed pa'o //
translated: The complete pacification of the mental afflictions is the avoidance of the occurrence of discursive thoughts, etc., because they arise from the loss of mindfulness.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa skabs med cing bar ma chad par ting nge 'dzin la rgyun du blan te 'jog pa ni rtse gcig pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa skabs med cing bar ma chad par ting nge 'dzin la rgyun du blan te 'jog pa ni rtse gcig pa byed pa'o //
translated: The one-pointedness of the mind is the continuous placement of the mind on an object of meditation without interruption and without the need for effort.

original: shin tu goms pa'i rim gyis mngon par 'du byed pa med cing lhun gyis grub par sems kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyun g-yeng ba med par byung ba ni mnyam par byung ba ni mnyam par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu goms pa'i rim gyis mngon par 'du byed pa med cing lhun gyis grub par sems kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyun g-yeng ba med par byung ba ni mnyam par byung ba ni mnyam par 'jog pa'o //
translated: The meditative development of equanimity is the continuous occurrence of the mind in samƒÅdhi without distraction, effortlessly and spontaneously, through the stages of complete familiarity.

original: lhag mthong gang /
analyzed: lhag mthong gang /
translated: What is insight?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is

original: chos rnams la rnam par 'byed pa dang / rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / yongs su rtog par byed pa dang / yongs su dpyod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams la rnam par 'byed pa dang / rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / yongs su rtog par byed pa dang / yongs su dpyod par byed pa ste /
translated: It is the discernment of dharmas, the thorough discernment, the full investigation, and the full analysis of dharmas.

original: de la spyod pa rnam par spyod pa la dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: de la spyod pa rnam par spyod pa la dmigs pa'am /
translated: Here, the discernment of dharmas is the discernment of the object of the practice,

original: mkhas pa la dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: mkhas pa la dmigs pa'am /
translated: the discernment of the object of skill,

original: nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyor ba yang rung ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyor ba yang rung ste /
translated: and the discernment of the object of the purification of afflictions.

original: ji snyed yong pas rnam par 'byed pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod bas rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji snyed yong pas rnam par 'byed pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod bas rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: The discernment of dharmas is the discernment of dharmas in terms of their multiplicity and the discernment of dharmas in terms of their reality.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid la byed pa shes rab dang bcas pas mtshan mar byed pa'i yongs su rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid la byed pa shes rab dang bcas pas mtshan mar byed pa'i yongs su rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The thorough discernment of dharmas is the full investigation of dharmas by the conceptual mental activity that is associated with wisdom and that takes signs as its object.

original: kun du rtog par byed pa ni yongs su dpyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun du rtog par byed pa ni yongs su dpyod par byed pa'o //
translated: The full analysis of dharmas is the full analysis of dharmas by the conceptual mental activity that is associated with wisdom and that takes signs as its object.

original: gnas ngan len dang / mtshan ma'i gnyen po dang phyin ci log las 'byin pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa la sems 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas ngan len dang / mtshan ma'i gnyen po dang phyin ci log las 'byin pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa la sems 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the antidote to the negative reflex actions, to signs, to the inversions, and to the placement of the mind in the absence of inversions.

original: yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la brten nas lam bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la brten nas lam bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: Also, there are four paths based on serenity and insight.

original: la la ni zhi gnas thob pa yin gyi lhag mthong ni ma thob pa ste /üîΩde ni zhi gnas @229a * //
analyzed: la la ni zhi gnas thob pa yin gyi lhag mthong ni ma thob pa ste / de ni zhi gnas @229a * //
translated: Some attain serenity but not insight.

original: la brten nas lhag mthong la brtson par byed do //
analyzed: la brten nas lhag mthong la brtson par byed do //
translated: They strive for insight based on serenity.

original: la la ni lhag mthong thob pa yin gyi zhi gnas ni ma thob ste /
analyzed: la la ni lhag mthong thob pa yin gyi zhi gnas ni ma thob ste /
translated: Some attain insight but not serenity.

original: de lhag mthong la brten nas ni gnas la brtson par byed do //üîΩla la ni zhi gnas kyang thob pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de lhag mthong la brten nas ni gnas la brtson par byed do // la la ni zhi gnas kyang thob pa ma yin la /
translated: They strive for serenity based on insight.

original: lhag mthong yang thob pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lhag mthong yang thob pa ma yin te /
translated: Some attain neither serenity nor insight.

original: de chos la rgod pa mngon par tshar gcad pa'i sems kyis gnyi ga la brtson par byed do //
analyzed: de chos la rgod pa mngon par tshar gcad pa'i sems kyis gnyi ga la brtson par byed do //
translated: They strive for both based on a mind that has overcome the distraction of mental activity.

original: la ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yang thob pa yin te /
analyzed: la ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yang thob pa yin te /
translated: Some attain both serenity and insight.

original: de ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthon 'dres par 'gyur nas mnyam par zung du 'jug go //
analyzed: de ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthon 'dres par 'gyur nas mnyam par zung du 'jug go //
translated: They attain union by mixing serenity and insight.

original: lam bzhi bstan pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: lam bzhi bstan pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: This is from the perspective of the four paths.

original: de la dang po ni zhi gnas thob pa'i phyir 'dug bzhin du sems 'jog pa'i bar dang / lhag mthong ma thob pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin de la brten nas phyis de bzhin du 'dug te /
analyzed: de la dang po ni zhi gnas thob pa'i phyir 'dug bzhin du sems 'jog pa'i bar dang / lhag mthong ma thob pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin de la brten nas phyis de bzhin du 'dug te /
translated: The first is when one has attained serenity but not insight, and so, on the basis of that concentration, one later sits down just as before and

original: chos de dag la rnam par 'byed pa nas yongs su dpyod par byed pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: chos de dag la rnam par 'byed pa nas yongs su dpyod par byed pa'i bar du'o //
translated: analyzes those phenomena, up to investigating them.

original: gnyis pa ni de las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni de las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
translated: The second is when one has attained insight but not serenity.

original: gsum pa ni gnyi ga ma thob pa ste gnyi ga la brtson par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni gnyi ga ma thob pa ste gnyi ga la brtson par byed pa'o //
translated: The third is when one has attained neither, and so one strives for both.

original: ji ltar byas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas she na /
translated: How does one do this?

original: thos pa 'dzin pa'i sgo nas lhag mthong la brtson par byed do //
analyzed: thos pa 'dzin pa'i sgo nas lhag mthong la brtson par byed do //
translated: One strives for insight by means of retaining what one has heard.

original: nges sngon du 'gro bas ni zhi gnas la brtson par byed do //
analyzed: nges sngon du 'gro bas ni zhi gnas la brtson par byed do //
translated: One strives for serenity by means of prior concentration.

original: bzhi pa la ni gnyi ga thob pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni gnyi ga thob pa'o //
translated: In the fourth, one has attained both.

original: dbang po gsum po gang /
analyzed: dbang po gsum po gang /
translated: What are the three faculties?

original: mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: They are the faculty of understanding what has not been understood, the faculty of understanding, and the faculty of the possession of understanding.

original: mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po gang /
analyzed: mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po gang /
translated: The faculty of understanding what has not been understood is the faculty that exercisesüîΩdominion over the path of preparation and the fifteen moments of the path of

original: sbyor ba'i lam dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig bco lnga la gang dbang byed pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig bco lnga la gang dbang byed pa'o //
translated: seeing.

original: 'di'i sbyor ba'i lam nges par byed pa'i cha dang mthun par bsdus pa dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig bco lnga po dag la dbang ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i sbyor ba'i lam nges par byed pa'i cha dang mthun par bsdus pa dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig bco lnga po dag la dbang ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: The faculty of understanding what has not been understood is the faculty that exercises dominion over the path of preparation that is included in the stage of heat and the fifteen moments of the path of seeing.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is as follows:

original: yid kyi dbang po dang / dad pa la sogs pa lnga dang / mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa gnas kyi bye brag gis ji ltar mthun mthun du bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po dang / dad pa la sogs pa lnga dang / mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa gnas kyi bye brag gis ji ltar mthun mthun du bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: The faculty of mind, the five beginning with faith, and any one of the faculties of pleasure, mental pleasure, mental pain, or indifference, according to the particular stage such as the stage of the ‚Äúuninterrupted path‚Äù and so on.

original: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ni sbyor ba'i dus ma nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i rjes su rnam par thar pa mchog 'dod pas bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ni sbyor ba'i dus ma nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i rjes su rnam par thar pa mchog 'dod pas bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: The faculty of mental dissatisfaction is included in the stage of warmth and so on, which are conducive to penetrative insight, but it is not definitely present at the time of preparation.

original: de dag ni srid par dbang po rnams ba bcu'o //
analyzed: de dag ni srid par dbang po rnams ba bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten faculties in samsara.

original: de kho na sngon ma shes pa kun shes par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pas mi shes ba kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na sngon ma shes pa kun shes par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pas mi shes ba kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The faculty producing complete knowledge is the faculty of complete knowledge itself, because it is the cause of the faculty of complete knowledge.

original: kun shes pa'i dbang po gang /
analyzed: kun shes pa'i dbang po gang /
translated: What is the faculty of complete knowledge?

original: @229b mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig bcu drug po la brten nas /
analyzed: @229b mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig bcu drug po la brten nas /
translated: It is the faculty that dominates all the paths of learning, based on the sixteenth moment of mind on the path of seeing.üîΩWhat is the faculty of final and perfect knowledge?

original: slob pa'i lam thams cad la gang dbang byed pa'o //
analyzed: slob pa'i lam thams cad la gang dbang byed pa'o //
translated: It is the faculty that dominates all the paths of no-more-learning, based on the path of no-more-learning.

original: dbang po rnam pa bcu po de dag nyid mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig bcu drug pa nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba'i bar du slob pa'i lam de la kun zhes pa'i dbang po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dbang po rnam pa bcu po de dag nyid mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig bcu drug pa nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba'i bar du slob pa'i lam de la kun zhes pa'i dbang po zhes bya ste /
translated: These ten faculties are called the faculty of complete knowledge on the path of learning, from the sixteenth moment of mind on the path of seeing up to the concentration called ‚Äúlike a vajra.‚Äù

original: sngon ma mthong ba'i shes par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon ma mthong ba'i shes par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no object to be known that has not already been known.

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po gang /
analyzed: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po gang /
translated: What is the faculty of final and perfect knowledge?

original: mi slob pa'i lam gang la dbang byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam gang la dbang byed pa'o //
translated: It is the faculty that exercises controlling power with regard to the path of the adept.

original: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ma gtogs par dbang po rnam pa dgus de dag nyid mi slob pa'i lam la kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //üîΩkun shes pa dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ma gtogs par dbang po rnam pa dgus de dag nyid mi slob pa'i lam la kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o // kun shes pa dang ldan pa ni /
translated: The faculty of final and perfect knowledge is made up of nine controlling faculties, with the exception of the faculty of mental sorrow.üîΩThe adept is one who has attained the state of the perfected being.

original: dgra bcom pa'i dbang po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i dbang po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The faculty of final and perfect knowledge is the controlling faculty of the perfected being.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi skabs su 'di yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi skabs su 'di yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: This point should be discussed in the section on the path of cultivation.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i lam bsgom pa na 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams pa bsgom par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i lam bsgom pa na 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams pa bsgom par 'gyur te /
translated: When one cultivates the path of the first meditation, one cultivates the wholesome roots that are associated with the realm of desire.

original: de dag la dbang 'byor pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la dbang 'byor pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one acquires mastery over them.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i lam mngon du gyur te bsgom pa na mngon du gyur pa'i las gzhan pa'i 'og ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bsgom par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i lam mngon du gyur te bsgom pa na mngon du gyur pa'i las gzhan pa'i 'og ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bsgom par 'gyur te /
translated: When the path of the first absorption manifests and is cultivated, the roots of virtue of other manifest karmas of lower level are cultivated.

original: de rnams la sems kyis dbang thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams la sems kyis dbang thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one obtains mastery over them.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa la 'dod na spyod pa rnams la ji lta ba de bzhin du sa gong ma pa'i lam thams cad bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa la 'dod na spyod pa rnams la ji lta ba de bzhin du sa gong ma pa'i lam thams cad bsgom pa ni /
translated: Just as those of the desire realm are cultivated when the path of the first absorption manifests and is cultivated, so too all higher level paths

original: sa 'og ma pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bsgom par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bsgom par 'gyur te /
translated: cultivate the roots of virtue of lower levels.

original: de la dbang 'byor pa thob pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde ltar gsungs pa ni gong ma'i lam mngon du gyur te /
analyzed: de la dbang 'byor pa thob pa'i phyir ro // de ltar gsungs pa ni gong ma'i lam mngon du gyur te /
translated: Because one obtains mastery over them.

original: bsgom pa na /
analyzed: bsgom pa na /
translated: This statement means that when the higher path manifests and is cultivated,

original: mngon du ma gyur pa de las gzhan pa la 'og ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bsgom par 'gyur te de rnams la dbang thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon du ma gyur pa de las gzhan pa la 'og ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bsgom par 'gyur te de rnams la dbang thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the roots of virtue of lower levels that do not manifest are cultivated because one obtains mastery over them.

original: dbang thob pa ni mchog tu mngon du gyur pa la dbang byed par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang thob pa ni mchog tu mngon du gyur pa la dbang byed par rig par bya'o //
translated: Obtaining mastery should be understood as controlling supreme manifestation.

original: mthar phyin pa'i lam gang /
analyzed: mthar phyin pa'i lam gang /
translated: What is the path of culmination?

original: gnas ngan len thams cad rgyun bcad pa dang / bral ba'i thob pa rnams thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas ngan len thams cad rgyun bcad pa dang / bral ba'i thob pa rnams thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the path on which one severs the continuity of all negative tendencies and obtains the attainment of freedom.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la brten nas de ma thag tu gnas ma 'dus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la brten nas de ma thag tu gnas ma 'dus par 'gyur te /
translated: Immediately after the vajra like samadhi, the uncontaminated state is attained.

original: zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising.

original: mi slob ba'i tshos bcu yang yin te /
analyzed: mi slob ba'i tshos bcu yang yin te /
translated: It is also the ten qualities of no learning.

original: mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba nas /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba nas /
translated: They are the correct view of no learning,

original: mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar dang / mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar dang / mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: up to the correct samadhi of no learning, the correct liberation of no learning, and the correct knowledge of no learning.

original: gnas ngan len thams cad dang / mngon par brjod pa'i gnas @230a * //
analyzed: gnas ngan len thams cad dang / mngon par brjod pa'i gnas @230a * //
translated: It is the state of having eliminated all negative tendencies and the state of having eliminated all propensities for verbal expression.

original: ngan len kun du 'gro ba dang / tshor ba'i gnas ngan len dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len dang / las kyi gnas ngan len dang / rnam par smin pa'i gnas ngan len dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len dang /
analyzed: ngan len kun du 'gro ba dang / tshor ba'i gnas ngan len dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len dang / las kyi gnas ngan len dang / rnam par smin pa'i gnas ngan len dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len dang /
translated: the universal negative reflex, the negative reflex of feeling, the negative reflex of the afflictions, the negative reflex of karma, the negative reflex of ripening, the negative reflex of the obscuration of the afflictions,

original: las kyi sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len dang / rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len dang / sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len dang // rtog pa'i gnas ngan len dang / zas kyi gnas ngan len dang / 'khrig pa'i gnas ngan len dang / rmi lam gyi gnas ngan len dang /
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len dang / rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len dang / sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len dang // rtog pa'i gnas ngan len dang / zas kyi gnas ngan len dang / 'khrig pa'i gnas ngan len dang / rmi lam gyi gnas ngan len dang /
translated: the negative reflex of the obscuration of karma, the negative reflex of the obscuration of ripening, the negative reflex of obscuration, the negative reflex of thought, the negative reflex of food, the negative reflex of sex, the negative reflex of dreams,

original: nad kyi gnas ngan len dang / rga ba'i gnas ngan len dang / 'chi ba'i gnas ngan len dang / yongs su ngal ba'i gnas ngan len dang / gnas ngan len brtan pa dang / gnas ngan len chen po dang / gnas ngan len 'bring po dang /
analyzed: nad kyi gnas ngan len dang / rga ba'i gnas ngan len dang / 'chi ba'i gnas ngan len dang / yongs su ngal ba'i gnas ngan len dang / gnas ngan len brtan pa dang / gnas ngan len chen po dang / gnas ngan len 'bring po dang /
translated: the negative reflex of illness, the negative reflex of aging, the negative reflex of death, the negative reflex of complete exhaustion, the stable negative reflex, the great negative reflex, the middling negative reflex,

original: gnas ngan len chung ngu dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: gnas ngan len chung ngu dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len to //
translated: The negative reflex is small, the negative reflex of the afflictive obstructions, the negative reflex of the obstructions to meditative absorption, and the negative reflex of the obstructions to omniscience.

original: gnas ngan len de rnams ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi yin te /
analyzed: gnas ngan len de rnams ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi yin te /
translated: Those negative reflexes are twenty-four.

original: de la mngon par brjod pa'i gnas ngan len kun du 'gro ba ni /
analyzed: de la mngon par brjod pa'i gnas ngan len kun du 'gro ba ni /
translated: Among them, the negative reflex of verbalization is universal.

original: mig la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi ming la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi ming la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa la gnas pa /
translated: It is the habitual propensity to take up the consciousness that is the basis of the habitual propensities for attachment to the names of all phenomena such as eyes and so forth.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas rjes su zhugs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas rjes su zhugs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It has been operating since beginningless time.

original: de la mig la sogs pa'i chos ming la mngon par zhen pa dang bcas pa rnam pa yang dang yang 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa'i chos ming la mngon par zhen pa dang bcas pa rnam pa yang dang yang 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the phenomena such as eyes and so forth repeatedly arise with attachment to names,

original: gang de ni spros pa'i bag chags zhes rtogs so //
analyzed: gang de ni spros pa'i bag chags zhes rtogs so //
translated: it is understood to be the habitual propensity for conceptual proliferation.

original: tshor ba'i gnas ngan len ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i tshor ba rnams kyi bag chags so //
analyzed: tshor ba'i gnas ngan len ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i tshor ba rnams kyi bag chags so //
translated: The negative reflex is the instinct for the feelings which are subject to the influence of the contaminants.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi bag la nyal lo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi bag la nyal lo //
translated: The negative reflex of the defilements is the latent tendency of the defilements.

original: las kyi gnas ngan len ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi bag chags so //
analyzed: las kyi gnas ngan len ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi bag chags so //
translated: The negative reflex of action is the instinct for action which is subject to the influence of the contaminants.

original: rnam par smin pa'i gnas ngan len ni rnam par smin pa las su mi rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i gnas ngan len ni rnam par smin pa las su mi rung ba nyid do //
translated: The negative reflex of retribution is the unserviceability of retribution.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len ni nyon mongs pa mi zad cing rgyun ring ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len ni nyon mongs pa mi zad cing rgyun ring ba'o //
translated: The negative reflex of the obscuration of the defilements is the non-eradication and the long continuity of the defilements.

original: las kyi sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len ni lam gyi bar chad byed pa mtshams med pa la sogs pa'i las kyi sgrib pa nyid do //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len ni lam gyi bar chad byed pa mtshams med pa la sogs pa'i las kyi sgrib pa nyid do //
translated: The negative reflex of the obscuration of action is the obscuration of action such as the actions of immediate consequence which interrupt the path.

original: rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len ni /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len ni /
translated: The negative reflex of the obscuration of retribution is

original: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa dang mi mthun pa sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i lus thob pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa dang mi mthun pa sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i lus thob pa'o //
translated: the acquisition of a body in the hells, etc. which is adverse to the realization of the truth.

original: sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len ni dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba'i bar chad @230b byed pa 'dod pa la 'dun pa la sogs pas zil gyis gnon pa nyid do //
analyzed: sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len ni dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba'i bar chad @230b byed pa 'dod pa la 'dun pa la sogs pas zil gyis gnon pa nyid do //
translated: The negative reflex of obscuration is the fact that the desire for sense-pleasures, etc. overpower the person who is engaged in the wholesome side and create obstacles for him.

original: rtog pa'i gnas ngan len ni rab tu byung ba'i bshegs byed par 'dod pa rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa zil gyis gnon pa nyid do //üîΩzas kyi gnas ngan len ni /
analyzed: rtog pa'i gnas ngan len ni rab tu byung ba'i bshegs byed par 'dod pa rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa zil gyis gnon pa nyid do // zas kyi gnas ngan len ni /
translated: The negative reflex of discursive thought is the fact that the desire for the enjoyment of the life of a householder overpowers the person who has gone forth into the homeless state.

original: zas ha cang nyung ba dang / mang du zos pa sbyor ba'i 'os sum gyur pa nyid do //üîΩ'khrig pa'i gnas ngan len ni /
analyzed: zas ha cang nyung ba dang / mang du zos pa sbyor ba'i 'os sum gyur pa nyid do // 'khrig pa'i gnas ngan len ni /
translated: The negative reflex of food is the fact that the person who eats too little or too much food is not fit for application.

original: gnyis kyis gnyis sprad pa las gyur pa'i lus dang / sems la gnod ba nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis kyis gnyis sprad pa las gyur pa'i lus dang / sems la gnod ba nyid do //
translated: The negative reflex of sexual intercourse is the fact that the person who engages in sexual intercourse is harmed in body and mind.

original: rmi lam gyi gnas ngan len ni gnyid las gyur pa'i lus sems po nyid do //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi gnas ngan len ni gnyid las gyur pa'i lus sems po nyid do //
translated: The negative reflex of dreams is the fact that the person who is asleep is harmed in body and mind.

original: nad kyi gnas ngan len ni khams ma snyoms pa las gyur pa'i nyams rab tu mi bde ba nyid do //
analyzed: nad kyi gnas ngan len ni khams ma snyoms pa las gyur pa'i nyams rab tu mi bde ba nyid do //
translated: The negative reflex of sickness is the fact that the person who is not in good health is harmed in body and mind.

original: rga ba'i gnas ngan len ni /
analyzed: rga ba'i gnas ngan len ni /
translated: The negative reflex of old age is the fact that the person who is old is harmed in body and mind.

original: 'byung ba gyur pas dbang med pa nyid do //üîΩ'chi ba'i gnas ngan len ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba gyur pas dbang med pa nyid do // 'chi ba'i gnas ngan len ni /
translated: It is powerless because it is subject to the elements.

original: 'chi ba na 'ang dbang po thams cad 'khrug pa nyid ngo //
analyzed: 'chi ba na 'ang dbang po thams cad 'khrug pa nyid ngo //
translated: The negative reflex of death is that at death all the faculties are disturbed.

original: yongs su ngal ba'i gnas ngan len ni ha cang 'gro ba la sogs pas lus dub pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su ngal ba'i gnas ngan len ni ha cang 'gro ba la sogs pas lus dub pa'o //
translated: The negative reflex of complete fatigue is the exhaustion of the body through excessive activity and so on.

original: gnas ngan len brten pa ni mngon par brjod pa'i gnas ngan len la sogs pa 'di dang / ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar te /
analyzed: gnas ngan len brten pa ni mngon par brjod pa'i gnas ngan len la sogs pa 'di dang / ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar te /
translated: The negative reflex of support is the negative reflex of verbal expression, etc.

original: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can ni //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can ni //
translated: The negative reflex of non-liberation is the negative reflex of the three realms.

original: gzhan gnas ngan len chen po dang / 'bring dang chung ngu'i go rims bzhin 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gnas ngan len chen po dang / 'bring dang chung ngu'i go rims bzhin 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams su rig par bya'o //
translated: The negative reflex of the unliberated is the great, middling, and small negative reflexes of the unliberated, which should be understood as being in the realms of desire, form, and formlessness, respectively.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: The negative reflex of the obscuration of the afflictions is the resistance to the enlightenment of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan lan ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu mngon par bsgrub pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan lan ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu mngon par bsgrub pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: The negative reflex is the obscuration to meditative concentration.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: The negative reflex of the knowable is the obscuration to omniscience.

original: de lta gnas ngan len 'di dag thams cad ji ltar gnas mthun mthun du rgyun bcad pa ni mthar phyin pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: de lta gnas ngan len 'di dag thams cad ji ltar gnas mthun mthun du rgyun bcad pa ni mthar phyin pa'i lam ste /
translated: The path of completion is the cutting off of the continuity of all these negative reflexes in accordance with their respective antidotes.

original: ji skad du sems rnam par grol pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba yongs su rdzogs na lus kyi gnas ngan len rnams rgyun bcad de /
analyzed: ji skad du sems rnam par grol pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba yongs su rdzogs na lus kyi gnas ngan len rnams rgyun bcad de /
translated: As is said: When the liberation of mind is complete and the liberation of wisdom is complete, the negative reflexes of the body are cut off.

original: dran pa dang ldan pa'i rgyus 'di ltar de'i sgo dang po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pa'i rgyus 'di ltar de'i sgo dang po 'di lta ste /
translated: Through the power of mindfulness, the first door is thus opened.

original: mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la shin tu dul ba dang / shin tu sbas pa dang / shin tu bsrungs pa dang / shin tu bsdams pa dang / shin tu bsgoms pa yin te /üîΩyin gyi rnam par shes par bya ba'i bar @231a * //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la shin tu dul ba dang / shin tu sbas pa dang / shin tu bsrungs pa dang / shin tu bsdams pa dang / shin tu bsgoms pa yin te / yin gyi rnam par shes par bya ba'i bar @231a * //
translated: He is well-controlled, well-guarded, well-protected, well-restrained, well-cultivated with regard to the visible forms which are the object of eye-consciousness.

original: gyi chos la 'dod do //
analyzed: gyi chos la 'dod do //
translated: up to: with regard to the factors which are the object of mental consciousness.üîΩHe is detached from the visible forms, etc.

original: phrad pa'i thob pa rnams gang /
analyzed: phrad pa'i thob pa rnams gang /
translated: What is the acquisition of contact?

original: gnas ngan len bsags pa la phrad pa'i thob pa zhas gdags so //
analyzed: gnas ngan len bsags pa la phrad pa'i thob pa zhas gdags so //
translated: It is the accumulation of the residues of the bad proclivities.

original: bral ba'i thob pa rnams gang /
analyzed: bral ba'i thob pa rnams gang /
translated: What is the acquisition of separation?

original: gnas ngan len zad pa la bral ba'i thob pa zhes gdags so //
analyzed: gnas ngan len zad pa la bral ba'i thob pa zhes gdags so //
translated: It is the exhaustion of the residues of the bad proclivities.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gang /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gang /
translated: What is the diamond-like concentration?

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi mtha' spang ba'i lam du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi mtha' spang ba'i lam du rig par bya'o //
translated: It is the concentration situated at the end of the path of mental cultivation.

original: de yang bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is twofold:

original: sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa dang / bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa dang / bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: that which is included in the path of mental cultivation and that which is included in the immediate path.

original: sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa ni /
translated: That which is included in the path of mental cultivation is twofold:

original: gang phan chad sgrib pa thams cad kyis mi phyed cing /
analyzed: gang phan chad sgrib pa thams cad kyis mi phyed cing /
translated: It is the diamond-like concentration, because it is not split by any obscurations,

original: sgrib pa thams cad ri shig pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad ri shig pa'o //
translated: and because it shatters all obscurations.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa ni /
translated: It is included in the uninterrupted path,

original: gang gis 'og tu zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang gis 'og tu zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: because it is the cause of the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of non-arising that occur after it.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin de yang bar med pa /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin de yang bar med pa /
translated: That diamond-like concentration is uninterrupted,

original: brtan pa / sra ba ro gcig pas khyab pa'o //üîΩji ltar na /
analyzed: brtan pa / sra ba ro gcig pas khyab pa'o // ji ltar na /
translated: firm, solid, and pervades with a single taste.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin te bar chad med ce na /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin te bar chad med ce na /
translated: How is it the diamond-like concentration that is uninterrupted?

original: de 'byung ba las 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi bar chad kyis 'phen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'byung ba las 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi bar chad kyis 'phen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not interrupted by the mundane path that occurs after it.

original: brtan pa ni /
analyzed: brtan pa ni /
translated: It is firm

original: sgrib pa thams cad kyis mi phigs pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad ni 'joms pa'i snying po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad kyis mi phigs pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad ni 'joms pa'i snying po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not split by any obscurations, and because it is the essence that destroys all obscurations.

original: ro gcig pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ro gcig pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is of a single taste because it is non-conceptual.

original: khyab pa ni shes bya thams cad kyi phyi'i mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab pa ni shes bya thams cad kyi phyi'i mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The pervasion is because of the observation of the suchness of the external characteristics of all objects of knowledge.

original: de rnams kyi don dang 'dra bar bya ba'i don du de la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dper na ri brags chen po ma grub pa /
analyzed: de rnams kyi don dang 'dra bar bya ba'i don du de la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dper na ri brags chen po ma grub pa /
translated: With the intention of making their meaning similar, the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúFor example, a great unformed mountain

original: ser ga med pa /üîΩkhong stong ma yin pa gcig tu 'dus pa //
analyzed: ser ga med pa / khong stong ma yin pa gcig tu 'dus pa //
translated: without fissures,üîΩnot hollow, completely solid,

original: shin tu mkhregs pa de ni shar phyogs kyi rlung gi shugs kyis kyang mi bsgul zhing mi g-yos so //
analyzed: shin tu mkhregs pa de ni shar phyogs kyi rlung gi shugs kyis kyang mi bsgul zhing mi g-yos so //
