original: shar phyogs ji lta bar phyogs bcu thams cad kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shar phyogs ji lta bar phyogs bcu thams cad kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Just as it is in the east, so it is in all ten directions.‚Äù

original: de ma thag tu gnas ma lus par gyur pa gang /
analyzed: de ma thag tu gnas ma lus par gyur pa gang /
translated: What is the immediate transformation of all bases?

original: de rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩgang mi slob pa'i lam thob pa'i sems kyi gnas gyur pa dang / lam gyi gnas gyur pa dang / gnas ngan len gyi gnas gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de rnam pa gsum ste / gang mi slob pa'i lam thob pa'i sems kyi gnas gyur pa dang / lam gyi gnas gyur pa dang / gnas ngan len gyi gnas gyur pa'o //
translated: It is threefold:

original: de la mi slob pa'i lam thob pa'i sems kyi gnas gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de la mi slob pa'i lam thob pa'i sems kyi gnas gyur pa ni /
translated: the transformation of the basis of mind that obtains the path of no-more-learning, the transformation of the basis of the path, and the transformation of the basis of negative tendencies.üîΩThe transformation of the basis of mind that obtains the path of no-more-learning is as follows.

original: chos nyid kyi sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ma lus pa dang bral bar gyur pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ma lus pa dang bral bar gyur pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the natural luminosity of the mind as reality, free from all the adventitious afflictions.

original: de nyid de bzhin nyid gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de nyid de bzhin nyid gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúit becomes suchness.‚Äù

original: lam gyi gnas gyur pa ni /
analyzed: lam gyi gnas gyur pa ni /
translated: The transformation of the basis of the path

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam la mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam la mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na /
translated: is when, at the time of the realization of the mundane path,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid du gyur pa ste /
translated: it becomes supramundane.

original: bya ba'i lhag ma yod pa'i phyir slob pa @231b zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i lhag ma yod pa'i phyir slob pa @231b zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: And it is also called ‚Äúthe learner‚Äù because it has a remainder of action to perform.

original: gang gi tshe khams gsum pa la 'dod chags dang bral bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus par bsal ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe khams gsum pa la 'dod chags dang bral bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus par bsal ba de'i tshe /
translated: When one is free from attachment to the three realms, all the opposing side is eliminated, and at that time,

original: lam gyi ngo bo nyid kyi gnas de'i gyur ba yongs su rdzogs par rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyi ngo bo nyid kyi gnas de'i gyur ba yongs su rdzogs par rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: the transformation of that basis, the nature of the path, is fully established.

original: gnas ngan len gyi gnas gyur ba ni /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi gnas gyur ba ni /
translated: The transformation of the basis of negative reflex actionsüîΩis when, at the time of the realization of the supramundane path,

original: kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa nyon mongs ba thams cad kyi bag chags kyi bag la nyal dang 'bral bar gyur par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa nyon mongs ba thams cad kyi bag chags kyi bag la nyal dang 'bral bar gyur par rig par bya'o //
translated: The consciousness that appropriates everything should be understood as being free from the dormant tendencies of the latent impressions of all the afflictions.

original: zad pa shes pa gang /üîΩrgyu zad nas shes pa gang yin pa'am /
analyzed: zad pa shes pa gang / rgyu zad nas shes pa gang yin pa'am /
translated: What is the knowledge of destruction?üîΩIt is the knowledge that the causes have been destroyed,

original: zad pa la dmigs pa'o //üîΩzad par gyur nas shes pa'am //
analyzed: zad pa la dmigs pa'o // zad par gyur nas shes pa'am //
translated: or it is the knowledge that has destruction for its object.üîΩIt is the knowledge that, having been destroyed,

original: yul du la shes pa gang yin pa de ni zad pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: yul du la shes pa gang yin pa de ni zad pa shes pa'o //
translated: or it is the knowledge that has that for its object.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is meant:üîΩThe knowledge that, having abandoned the origin of suffering without remainder,

original: kun 'byung ba ma lus par spangs nas shes pa gang yin pa dang / de'i gnas skabs na rgyu 'gog pa la dmigs pa ni zad pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba ma lus par spangs nas shes pa gang yin pa dang / de'i gnas skabs na rgyu 'gog pa la dmigs pa ni zad pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and at that time, the knowledge that has the cessation of the causes for its object is called the knowledge of destruction.

original: mir skye bar shes pa gang /üîΩ'bras bu spangs nas shes pa gang yin pa'am /
analyzed: mir skye bar shes pa gang / 'bras bu spangs nas shes pa gang yin pa'am /
translated: What is the knowledge of non-arising?üîΩIt is the knowledge that the effect has been abandoned,

original: 'bras bu mi skye ba la dmigs pa'o //üîΩde bzhin du mi skye bar gyur nas shes pa'am /
analyzed: 'bras bu mi skye ba la dmigs pa'o // de bzhin du mi skye bar gyur nas shes pa'am /
translated: or it is the knowledge that has the non-arising of the effect for its object.üîΩIt is the knowledge that, having not arisen,

original: yul de la shes pa gang yin pa de ni mi skye ba shes pa ste /
analyzed: yul de la shes pa gang yin pa de ni mi skye ba shes pa ste /
translated: or it is the knowledge that has that for its object.

original: phyi ma la sdug bsngal thams cad gtan du mi skye ba'i chos nyid du gyur nas shes pa gang yin pa de ni bden pa gzhan la dmigs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma la sdug bsngal thams cad gtan du mi skye ba'i chos nyid du gyur nas shes pa gang yin pa de ni bden pa gzhan la dmigs pa yang yin no //
translated: The knowledge that in the future all suffering will not arise by way of its intrinsic reality is also the observation of another truth.

original: yang na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la mi skye bar dmigs pa de ni mi skye ba shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la mi skye bar dmigs pa de ni mi skye ba shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or, the observation of the truth of suffering as not arising is the meaning of the knowledge of non-arising.

original: mi slob pa'i chos bcu ni /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i chos bcu ni /
translated: The ten dharmas of no-more-learning

original: mi slob pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po'i dbang du byas par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po'i dbang du byas par shes par bya'o //
translated: are to be understood as being based on the aggregate of morality, the aggregate of meditative stabilization, the aggregate of wisdom, the aggregate of liberation, and the aggregate of the vision of the wisdom of liberation of one who is not a learner.

original: de la mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba rnams ni mi slob pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: de la mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba rnams ni mi slob pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po'o //
translated: Among them, the morality aggregate of one who is not a learner is right speech, right action, and right livelihood.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po'o //
translated: Right mindfulness and right concentration are the concentration aggregate.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang rtog pa dang rtsol ba rnams ni shes rab kyi phung po'i //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang rtog pa dang rtsol ba rnams ni shes rab kyi phung po'i //
translated: Right view, right thought, and right effort are the wisdom aggregate.

original: yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba ni rnam par grol ba'i phung po'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba ni rnam par grol ba'i phung po'o //
translated: Right liberation is the liberation aggregate.

original: yang dag pa'i shes rab ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes rab ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po'o //
translated: Right knowledge is the knowledge aggregate of one who has seen the truth of liberation.

original: yang lam gyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhir shes par bya ste /
analyzed: yang lam gyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhir shes par bya ste /
translated: The truth of the path should be understood as having four characteristics:

original: lam gyi mtshan nyid dang / rigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid dang / nges par 'byin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: lam gyi mtshan nyid dang / rigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid dang / nges par 'byin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of the path, the characteristic of reason, the characteristic of practice, and the characteristic of definite release.

original: ci'i phyir lam gyi mtshan nyid ces bya //üîΩde kho na'i don yongs su tshol ba'i @232a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir lam gyi mtshan nyid ces bya // de kho na'i don yongs su tshol ba'i @232a * //
translated: Why is it called the characteristic of the path?üîΩBecause it is the path of the search for the meaning of reality.

original: phyir ro // de la 'dis ni de kho na'i don yongs su tshol ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: phyir ro // de la 'dis ni de kho na'i don yongs su tshol ba'i lam mo //
translated: In this context, it is the path of the search for the meaning of reality.

original: ci'i phyir rigs pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rigs pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: Why is it called the characteristic of reason?

original: nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the antidote to the defilements.

original: rigs pa ma yin par gyur ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen por gyur bas rigs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin par gyur ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen por gyur bas rigs pa'o //
translated: It is reasonable because it is the antidote to the defilements which are unreasonable.

original: ci'i phyir bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: Why is it the definition of establishment?

original: sems phyin ci log par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems phyin ci log par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it establishes the mind in the absence of erroneous inversion.

original: de kho na khong du chud pa'i nyes pas mi rtag pa la sogs par phyin ci log tu gyur ba'i sems de phyin ci log med par de kho na khong du chud pa la 'jog pas bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na khong du chud pa'i nyes pas mi rtag pa la sogs par phyin ci log tu gyur ba'i sems de phyin ci log med par de kho na khong du chud pa la 'jog pas bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The mind which is erroneously inverted in relation to impermanence etc. is established in the absence of erroneous inversion through the realization of reality.

original: ci'i phyir nges par 'byin pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nges par 'byin pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: Why is it the definition of definite emergence?

original: rtag pa'i gnas su 'gro ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa'i gnas su 'gro ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the state of going to the permanent abode.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i gnas rtag par gzhan du 'gro bas nges par 'byin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i gnas rtag par gzhan du 'gro bas nges par 'byin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is described as definite emergence because it is the state of going to the permanent abode of definite emergence.

original: bden pa rnams la rnam pa bcu drug ni 'jig rten pa yang yod /
analyzed: bden pa rnams la rnam pa bcu drug ni 'jig rten pa yang yod /
translated: The aspects of the truths are of sixteen kinds,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yod /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yod /
translated: both mundane and supramundane.

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between mundane and supramundane?

original: shes bya la legs par ma zhugs pa dang / sa par zhugs pa dang / sgrib pa dang bcas pa dang / sgrib pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir 'di ni bye brag go //
analyzed: shes bya la legs par ma zhugs pa dang / sa par zhugs pa dang / sgrib pa dang bcas pa dang / sgrib pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir 'di ni bye brag go //
translated: The difference is due to the fact that the mundane is not well-established in regard to the knowable, is established in the stages, is associated with obscurations, is not free from obscurations, is associated with conceptual differentiation, and is not free from conceptual differentiation.

original: de la 'jig rten pa rnams ni shes bya la legs par ma zhugs pa dang / sgrib pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa rnams ni shes bya la legs par ma zhugs pa dang / sgrib pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: In this regard, the mundane is not well-established in regard to the knowable, is associated with obscurations, and is associated with conceptual differentiation.

original: de bzhin nyid ma rtogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal yod pa dang / mngon par brjod pa'i sgo nas spros pa'i phyir te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ma rtogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal yod pa dang / mngon par brjod pa'i sgo nas spros pa'i phyir te go rims bzhin no //
translated: It is not well-established in regard to the knowable because reality is not realized, it is associated with obscurations because the latent impressions of moral defilement are not eliminated, and it is associated with conceptual differentiation because it is discursive through verbal description.

original: bzlog pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: The supramundane is the opposite of that.

original: legs par zhugs pa dang / sgrib pa med par gyur na rnam par mi rtog pas 'jig rten pa rnams las khyad par du gyur to //
analyzed: legs par zhugs pa dang / sgrib pa med par gyur na rnam par mi rtog pas 'jig rten pa rnams las khyad par du gyur to //
translated: It is well-established in regard to the knowable, is free from obscurations, and is free from conceptual differentiation because it is the opposite of that.

original: de dag rnam par mi rtog pa na ji ltar shes bya la legs par zhugs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de dag rnam par mi rtog pa na ji ltar shes bya la legs par zhugs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If they are non-conceptual, how can they engage their objects well?

original: ji ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam pa las 'jug pa na mi rtag pa'i don mthong gi / mi rtag pa nyid ces bya bar mthong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam pa las 'jug pa na mi rtag pa'i don mthong gi / mi rtag pa nyid ces bya bar mthong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: When they engage their objects in the aspect of transcending the world, they see the meaning of impermanence, but they do not see what is called ‚Äúimpermanence.‚Äù

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi don la ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi don la ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as with the meaning of impermanence,

original: rnam pa lhag ma rnams la yang ji lta bar sbyar bar rig par bya'o //

analyzed: de la bshad pa'i dus la gzhan gyi rnam par rig pa ni gnas te /

analyzed: goms pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis phyis rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: chos dmigs pa'i rab tu dbye ba gang /

analyzed: 'dir chos kyi dmigs pa'i rab tu dbye ba khyab pa la sogs @235b pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Here, the classification of the object of mental attention with regard to the dharmas is fourfold: all-inclusive, etc.

original: de la khyab pa'i dmigs pa gang /
analyzed: de la khyab pa'i dmigs pa gang /
translated: What is the object of mental attention that is all-inclusive?

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / dngos po'i mtha' dang / dgos yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / dngos po'i mtha' dang / dgos yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: It is the mental attention to the image with discrimination, the image without discrimination, the limit of the real, and the absolute accomplishment of the task.

original: 'dir rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi ni khyab pa'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi ni khyab pa'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: Here, the four objects of mental attention beginning with the image with discrimination are the all-inclusive object of mental attention.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gang /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gang /
translated: The reflection that is associated with discursive thought

original: mos pa yid la byed pas gang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa yid la byed pas gang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la dmigs pa'o //
translated: is the object of calm abiding and insight that is accompanied by the attention that is directed by faith.

original: de la mos pa yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: de la mos pa yid la byed pa ni /
translated: The attention that is directed by faith

original: gang gcig tu 'jig rten pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gcig tu 'jig rten pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
translated: is the attention that is exclusively mundane.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gang /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gang /
translated: The reflection that is free from discursive thought

original: de kho na yid la byed pa gang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na yid la byed pa gang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la dmigs pa'o //
translated: is the object of calm abiding and insight that is accompanied by the attention that is directed to reality.

original: de kho na yid la byed pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa dang de'i rjes las thob pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na yid la byed pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa dang de'i rjes las thob pa'o //
translated: The attention that is directed to reality is both supramundane and acquired subsequently to the supramundane.

original: dngos po'i mtha' gang /
analyzed: dngos po'i mtha' gang /
translated: The limit of existence

original: gang chos rnams kyi ji snyed yod pa dang ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa'o //üîΩji snyed yod pa ni /
analyzed: gang chos rnams kyi ji snyed yod pa dang ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa'o // ji snyed yod pa ni /
translated: is the existence of things just as it is and the existence of things in their variety.üîΩThe existence of things in their varietyüîΩis the totality of all the things that exist.üîΩThe existence of things just as they are

original: de la chos rnams kyi ji snyed yod pa ni chos thams cad kyi dngos po 'di dag kun du thad do //
analyzed: de la chos rnams kyi ji snyed yod pa ni chos thams cad kyi dngos po 'di dag kun du thad do //
translated: is the suchness of all things.

original: nyes gang shes bya rnam par bzhag pa ste 'di ltar phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: nyes gang shes bya rnam par bzhag pa ste 'di ltar phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams so //
translated: The classification of what is to be known is the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.üîΩThe way things exist is the four noble truths, the sixteen aspects, suchness, and so on.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa ni 'phags pa bden pa bzhi dang / rnam pa bcu drug dang / de bzhin nyid dang / de ltar 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa dang / 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa dang /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa ni 'phags pa bden pa bzhi dang / rnam pa bcu drug dang / de bzhin nyid dang / de ltar 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa dang / 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa dang /
translated: All conditioned things are impermanent, all conditioned things are suffering, all phenomena are selfless,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba dang / stong ba nyid dang / smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba dang / stong ba nyid dang / smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: nirvana is peace, emptiness, wishlessness, and signlessness.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa ni /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa ni /
translated: The way things exist is

original: rnam pa 'di dag tu shes par bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag tu shes par bya ba ste /
translated: to be known in these aspects.

original: 'di la bden pa'i sgo nas phung po dang khams dang skye mched de dag nyid ji ltar mthun mthun du sdug bsngal ba nyid du shes par bya ba nas lam gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: 'di la bden pa'i sgo nas phung po dang khams dang skye mched de dag nyid ji ltar mthun mthun du sdug bsngal ba nyid du shes par bya ba nas lam gyi bar du'o //
translated: In this regard, those very aggregates, elements, and sense bases are to be known as suffering, up to the path, in accordance with the truths.

original: rnam pa'i sgo nas bden par re re la'ang rnam pa bzhi bzhir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa'i sgo nas bden par re re la'ang rnam pa bzhi bzhir rig par bya'o //
translated: In terms of aspect, each truth should be known to have four aspects.

original: bye brag med par ni thams cad kyang de bzhin nyid rnam par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bye brag med par ni thams cad kyang de bzhin nyid rnam par shes par bya'o //
translated: In terms of non-distinction, all should be known as suchness.

original: chos kyi sdom gyi skabs kyis ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa nyid du shes par bya ba nas mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba nyid kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sdom gyi skabs kyis ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa nyid du shes par bya ba nas mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba nyid kyi bar du'o //
translated: In terms of the section on the Dharma summary, all formations should be known as impermanent, up to nirvana as peace.

original: rnam par thar pa'i rnam pa'i skabs kyis ni stong pa nyid nas mtshan ma med pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i rnam pa'i skabs kyis ni stong pa nyid nas mtshan ma med pa'i bar du'o //
translated: In terms of the section on the aspects of liberation, emptiness should be known up to signlessness.

original: dgos pa yongs su sgrub pa gang /
analyzed: dgos pa yongs su sgrub pa gang /
translated: What is the accomplishment of purpose?

original: gnas gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gnas gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the transformation.

original: gnas gyur ba'i dmigs pa ni phyin ci ma log par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas gyur ba'i dmigs pa ni phyin ci ma log par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of the transformation is the appearance without error.

original: ji lta ba @236a * //üîΩbzhin du yod pa rnam pa bcu drug bstan pa las /
analyzed: ji lta ba @236a * // bzhin du yod pa rnam pa bcu drug bstan pa las /
translated: What is the reality of suchness?üîΩIt is the sixteen aspects of existence as they are.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa rnam pa bcu drug bstan pa dang / rnam par thar pa rnam pa gsum bstan pa de dag ni gcig gis gcig sdud do //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa rnam pa bcu drug bstan pa dang / rnam par thar pa rnam pa gsum bstan pa de dag ni gcig gis gcig sdud do //
translated: The teaching of the sixteen aspects of existence as they are, and the teaching of the three kinds of liberation, include each other.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: rnam pa bcu drug la stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa du /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug la stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa du /
translated: In how many aspects do the aspects of emptiness, etc.üîΩexist?

original: gnyis so // stong pa'i rnam pa gnyis ni /
analyzed: gnyis so // stong pa'i rnam pa gnyis ni /
translated: In two. The two aspects of emptiness are:

original: stong pa'i rnam pa dang / bdag po'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa'i rnam pa dang / bdag po'i rnam pa'o //
translated: the aspect of emptiness and the aspect of the absence of a self of dharmas.

original: smon pa med pa'i rnam pa du /
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i rnam pa du /
translated: In how many aspects do the aspects of wishlessness exist?üîΩIn six. The six aspects of wishlessness are:

original: drug go // mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang / sdug bsngal pa'i rnam pa dang / rgyu dang / kun du 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: drug go // mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang / sdug bsngal pa'i rnam pa dang / rgyu dang / kun du 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa ste /
translated: the aspects of impermanence, of suffering, of cause, of origin, of arising, and of condition.

original: de dag gis khams gsum pa la smon pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmtshan ma med pa'i rnam pa du /
analyzed: de dag gis khams gsum pa la smon pa med pa'i phyir ro // mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pa du /
translated: Because of the absence of desire for the three realms through those aspects.üîΩIn how many aspects do the aspects of signlessness exist?

original: brgyad do // lhag ma brgyad ni mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: brgyad do // lhag ma brgyad ni mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: In eight. The eight aspects of signlessness are:üîΩthe aspects of cessation, of path, of peace, of excellence, of separation, of desirelessness, of emptiness, and of the absence of a self of dharmas.

original: 'gog pa dang lam la mtshan mar byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam la mtshan mar byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is unable to make signs of cessation and path.

original: spyod pa rnam par spyod pa'i dmigs pa gang /üîΩ'dod chags la spyod pa rnams kyis ni mi sdug pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa rnam par spyod pa'i dmigs pa gang / 'dod chags la spyod pa rnams kyis ni mi sdug pa'o //
translated: What is the object of the practice of the practice?üîΩFor those who practice desire, it is ugliness.

original: zhe sdang la spyod pa rnams kyis ni byams pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang la spyod pa rnams kyis ni byams pa'o //
translated: For those who practice hatred, it is love.

original: gti mug la spyod pa rnams kyis ni rkyen 'di las byung ba'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gti mug la spyod pa rnams kyis ni rkyen 'di las byung ba'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o //
translated: Those who are dominated by delusion should meditate on the dependent origination that arises from these conditions.

original: nga rgyal la spyod pa rnams kyis ni khams kyi rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal la spyod pa rnams kyis ni khams kyi rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: Those who are dominated by pride should meditate on the classification of the elements.

original: rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa rnams kyis ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa rnams kyis ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: Those who are dominated by discursive thought should meditate on the mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation.

original: ci'i phyir 'dod chags la spyod pa la sogs pa mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa rnam par sbyong ba la dmigs shen /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dod chags la spyod pa la sogs pa mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa rnam par sbyong ba la dmigs shen /
translated: Why do those who are dominated by attachment and so on focus on the purification of the practice of repulsiveness and so on?

original: des 'dod chags la sogs pa shas che ba nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des 'dod chags la sogs pa shas che ba nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that greatly pacifies attachment and so on.

original: mkhas pa'i dmigs pa gang /
analyzed: mkhas pa'i dmigs pa gang /
translated: What is the object of the wise?

original: phung po la mkhas pa dang / khams la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: phung po la mkhas pa dang / khams la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The object of the wise is skill in the aggregates, skill in the elements, skill in the sense bases, skill in dependent origination, and skill in what is possible and impossible.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa ji ltar blta bar bya /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa ji ltar blta bar bya /
translated: How should skill in what is possible and impossible be viewed?

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand the expertise in dependent origination.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa'i bye brag ci /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa'i bye brag ci /
translated: What is the difference between expertise in dependent origination and expertise in the possible and the impossible?

original: chos rnams la chos rnams mngon par 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos rnams la chos rnams mngon par 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because phenomena manifest from phenomena.

original: rgyu med pa dang / mi mthun pa'i rgyu yongs su spangs pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pa dang / mi mthun pa'i rgyu yongs su spangs pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Expertise in dependent origination is the avoidance of causelessness and adverse causes.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni 'du byed la sogs pa'i chos rnams mngon du 'byin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni 'du byed la sogs pa'i chos rnams mngon du 'byin te /
translated: The phenomena of ignorance and so on manifest the phenomena of formations and so on.

original: 'di ltar rgyu med pa las byung ba ma yin zhing dbang phyug la @236b sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i rgyu la sogs pa yang ma yin par shes pa gang yin pa de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu med pa las byung ba ma yin zhing dbang phyug la @236b sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i rgyu la sogs pa yang ma yin par shes pa gang yin pa de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The understanding that they do not arise from a noncause or from an adverse cause such as a divine creator is expertise in dependent origination.

original: rgyu dang mthun par 'bras bu 'byung pa yongs su bzung ba'i phyir gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang mthun par 'bras bu 'byung pa yongs su bzung ba'i phyir gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The skill in the possible and the impossible is the knowledge of the arising of effects in accordance with their causes, because it is said: The effect arises in accordance with the cause.

original: chos tsam gyi rgyu las byung ba yin du zin kyang mthun pa'i rgyu las mthun pa'i 'bras bu nyid 'byung ste 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chos tsam gyi rgyu las byung ba yin du zin kyang mthun pa'i rgyu las mthun pa'i 'bras bu nyid 'byung ste 'di lta ste /
translated: Even though an effect arises from a mere cause, a concordant effect arises from a concordant cause.üîΩFor example, the effect of good conduct is virtuous and the effect of bad conduct is non-virtuous.

original: legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa dge ba dang / nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa mi dge ba zhes bya ba la sogs par shes pa gang yin pa 'di ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa dge ba dang / nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa mi dge ba zhes bya ba la sogs par shes pa gang yin pa 'di ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of this is to be known as the skill in the possible and the impossible.

original: nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa gang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa gang /
translated: What is the object of purification of the defilements?

original: sa 'og ma rnams kyis ni rags pa nyid do //
analyzed: sa 'og ma rnams kyis ni rags pa nyid do //
translated: The lower stages are coarseness.

original: sa gong ma rnams kyis ni zhi ba nyid do //
analyzed: sa gong ma rnams kyis ni zhi ba nyid do //
translated: The higher stages are calmness.

original: de bzhin nyid dang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'o //
translated: Suchness and the four noble truths.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi skabs su sa 'og ma dang gong ma rnams kyang rags pa dang zhi ba nyid de /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi skabs su sa 'og ma dang gong ma rnams kyang rags pa dang zhi ba nyid de /
translated: In the context of the mundane path, the lower and higher stages are coarse and peaceful, respectively.

original: des kun nas dkris pa rnam par gnon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des kun nas dkris pa rnam par gnon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they completely suppress the entanglements.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi gnas su ni bsdu na de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi gnas su ni bsdu na de bzhin nyid do //
translated: In the context of the supramundane path, in brief, it is reality.

original: spros nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste des bag la nyal legs par bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spros nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste des bag la nyal legs par bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When elaborated, it is the four noble truths, because they completely destroy the latent afflictions.

original: mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos dpyad pa dang 'brel pas rigs pa bzhi brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos dpyad pa dang 'brel pas rigs pa bzhi brjod par bya ste /
translated: The four principles should be stated in connection with the analysis of the Dharma of the sutras and so on,

original: de dag gis dpyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis dpyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they analyze them.

original: de'i phyir brjod pa chos la brtson pa chos la rnam par dpyod pa na rigs pa du zhig gis rnam par dpyod /
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod pa chos la brtson pa chos la rnam par dpyod pa na rigs pa du zhig gis rnam par dpyod /
translated: Therefore, when one who is devoted to the Dharma analyzes the Dharma, by how many principles does one analyze?

original: bzhis dpyod de /
analyzed: bzhis dpyod de /
translated: One analyzes by four.

original: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad par sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad par sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa'o //
translated: The principle of dependence, the principle of efficacy, the principle of logical possibility and the principle of reality.

original: ltos pa'i rigs pa gang /
analyzed: ltos pa'i rigs pa gang /
translated: What is the principle of dependence?

original: gang 'du byed rnams 'byung ba na rkyen la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'du byed rnams 'byung ba na rkyen la ltos pa'o //
translated: When formations arise, they depend on conditions.üîΩFor example, when a sprout arises, it depends on the seed, the season, the water, and the field.

original: 'di lta ste myu gu 'byung ba na sa bon dang / dus dang / chu dang / zhing rnam par ltos pa dang / rnam par shes pa ni dbang po dang / don dang yid la byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste myu gu 'byung ba na sa bon dang / dus dang / chu dang / zhing rnam par ltos pa dang / rnam par shes pa ni dbang po dang / don dang yid la byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: When consciousness arises, it depends on the sense faculty, the object, and the mental attention.

original: bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa gang /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa gang /
translated: What is the principle of the performance of function?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i chos rnams so so rang gi bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i chos rnams so so rang gi bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: It is the performance of each of their own functions by the factors of existence which have their own individual characteristics.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: mig la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i gnas kyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i gnas kyi dngos po'o //
translated: the eye, etc. are the basis for the visual consciousness, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni dmigs pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni dmigs pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: Form, etc. are the objects of apprehension.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa so sor rnam par rig par bya'o //üîΩgser mgar la sogs pa lag @237a * //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa so sor rnam par rig par bya'o // gser mgar la sogs pa lag @237a * //
translated: The visual consciousness, etc. are the individual discernments of form, etc.

original: bzo rnams ni gser bum la sogs pa byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzo rnams ni gser bum la sogs pa byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The goldsmith, etc. are the makers of the golden vessel, etc.

original: 'thad pa bsgrub pa'i rigs pa gang /
analyzed: 'thad pa bsgrub pa'i rigs pa gang /
translated: What is the principle of logical possibility?

original: gang sgrub pa'i don tshad ma dang mi 'gal bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang sgrub pa'i don tshad ma dang mi 'gal bar bstan pa'o //
translated: The demonstration of the object to be accomplished without contradiction by validating cognitions.

original: 'thad pa bsgrub pa'i rigs pa ni bsgrub pa'i don ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gyis bsdus pa mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma dang mi 'gal bar dam bca' ba la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'thad pa bsgrub pa'i rigs pa ni bsgrub pa'i don ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gyis bsdus pa mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma dang mi 'gal bar dam bca' ba la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The reasoning of efficacy is the demonstration of the thesis, etc., without contradiction by validating cognitions, such as perception, of the object to be accomplished, which is included in the nature and the attributes.

original: chos nyid kyi rigs pa gang /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rigs pa gang /
translated: What is the reasoning of reality?

original: gang thog ma med pa'i dus nas rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du gnas pa'i chos rnams la chos nyid du grags pa'o //
analyzed: gang thog ma med pa'i dus nas rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du gnas pa'i chos rnams la chos nyid du grags pa'o //
translated: It is the reality of things that have existed since beginningless time as universals and as particulars.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: mes 'tshig chus ni 'drul zhes bya ba la sogs par grags pa'i chos rnams kyi chos nyid do //
analyzed: mes 'tshig chus ni 'drul zhes bya ba la sogs par grags pa'i chos rnams kyi chos nyid do //
translated: The reality of things that are known as ‚Äúfire burns‚Äù and ‚Äúwater wets.‚Äù

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'byor ldan mig ni rtag pa nas bdag gi ba'i bar gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: 'byor ldan mig ni rtag pa nas bdag gi ba'i bar gyis stong ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThe eye is empty of the eye, and so on up to: it is empty of the self of the eye.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na 'di'i rang bzhin ni 'di'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na 'di'i rang bzhin ni 'di'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Why is that? ‚ÄúBecause its nature is such.‚Äù

original: chos la rigs pas dpyod pa la brtson pa'i kun du tshol ba gang /
analyzed: chos la rigs pas dpyod pa la brtson pa'i kun du tshol ba gang /
translated: What is the investigation that is the analysis of things by means of reasoning?

original: kun du tshol ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: kun du tshol ba bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of thorough search:

original: ming kun du tshol ba dang / dngos po kun du tshol ba dang / ngo bo nyid du 'dogs pa kun du tshol ba dang / bye brag tu 'dogs pa kun du tshol ba'o //
analyzed: ming kun du tshol ba dang / dngos po kun du tshol ba dang / ngo bo nyid du 'dogs pa kun du tshol ba dang / bye brag tu 'dogs pa kun du tshol ba'o //
translated: the thorough search for names, the thorough search for things, the thorough search for the nature of names, and the thorough search for the specific properties.

original: ming kun du tshol ba gang /
analyzed: ming kun du tshol ba gang /
translated: What is the thorough search for names?

original: gang gis ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / gsal byed kyi tshogs rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su grub pa med par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / gsal byed kyi tshogs rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su grub pa med par rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the understanding that the collection of names, the collection of phrases, and the collection of letters do not have an established intrinsic identity.

original: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa'i yod pa yin pa'i phyir 'di dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su grub pa med par dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa'i yod pa yin pa'i phyir 'di dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su grub pa med par dpyod pa'o //
translated: The thorough search for names is the investigation of the non-establishment of their intrinsic identity, because the collection of names, etc. do exist.

original: dngos po kun du tshol ba gang /
analyzed: dngos po kun du tshol ba gang /
translated: What is the thorough search for things?

original: gang de bzhin du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi mtshan nyid yongs su grub pa med par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang de bzhin du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi mtshan nyid yongs su grub pa med par rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the understanding that the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields do not have an established intrinsic identity.

original: ji ltar ming gi tshogs la sogs pa be brjod pa de bzhin du phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su grub ba med par rtogs pa ste yongs su rtogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar ming gi tshogs la sogs pa be brjod pa de bzhin du phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su grub ba med par rtogs pa ste yongs su rtogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Just as the collection of names, etc. are expressed, so also the aggregates, etc. are understood, i.e., fully understood, as having no real essence.

original: ngo bo nyid du 'dogs pa kun du tshol ba gang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du 'dogs pa kun du tshol ba gang /
translated: What is the investigation of the designation of an essence?

original: gang brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba'i 'brel ba la ngo bo nyid du 'dogs pa tsam gyi tha snyad kyi rgyu nyid du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gang brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba'i 'brel ba la ngo bo nyid du 'dogs pa tsam gyi tha snyad kyi rgyu nyid du rtog pa'o //
translated: It is the investigation of the cause of the conventional expression of an essence, in the connection between the expression and the object of expression.

original: brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba'i 'brel pa ni phan tshun rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba'i 'brel pa ni phan tshun rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: The connection between the expression and the object of expression is the cause of the mutual understanding.

original: 'di ltar tha snyad la byang ba ni brjod ba tsam thob pas de'i brjod par bya ba la dran pa'i sgo nas rtog pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar tha snyad la byang ba ni brjod ba tsam thob pas de'i brjod par bya ba la dran pa'i sgo nas rtog pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, when the one who is skilled in conventional expressions obtains the mere expression, the idea arises through memory of its object of expression.

original: brjod par bya ba dmigs na yang de'i brjod pa la rtog pa 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba dmigs na yang de'i brjod pa la rtog pa 'byung ba ste /
translated: And when the object of expression is perceived, the idea arises through the expression.

original: rnam pa de lta bur 'brel par grags pa la mig la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan @237b nyid du btags pa tsam du de brjod la /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bur 'brel par grags pa la mig la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan @237b nyid du btags pa tsam du de brjod la /
translated: In this way, the mere designation of the eye, etc., as intrinsic identity in the context of such a relation is called ‚Äúthe investigation of the designation of intrinsic reality.‚Äù

original: sha'i dum bu la sogs pa tha snyad kyi rgyur gyur pa gang kun du rtog pa de ni ngo bo nyid du 'dogs pa kun du tshol ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sha'i dum bu la sogs pa tha snyad kyi rgyur gyur pa gang kun du rtog pa de ni ngo bo nyid du 'dogs pa kun du tshol ba zhes brjod do //
translated: The investigation of the designation of distinction is the imagination that the cause of conventional usage is a piece of flesh, etc.

original: khyad par du 'dogs pa kun du tshol ba gang /üîΩgang brjod pa dang brjod par bya ba'i 'brel ba la khyad par du 'dogs pa tsam gyi tha snyad kyi rgyu nyid du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par du 'dogs pa kun du tshol ba gang / gang brjod pa dang brjod par bya ba'i 'brel ba la khyad par du 'dogs pa tsam gyi tha snyad kyi rgyu nyid du rtog pa'o //
translated: What is the investigation of the designation of distinction?üîΩIt is the imagination that the cause of conventional usage is the mere designation of distinction in the relation of expression and the expressed.

original: gang de bzhi du brjod pa dang brjod par bya ba'i 'brel pa rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bla na yod pa dang bla na med pa dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa dang / bstan pa yod pa dang /
analyzed: gang de bzhi du brjod pa dang brjod par bya ba'i 'brel pa rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bla na yod pa dang bla na med pa dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa dang / bstan pa yod pa dang /
translated: The investigation of the designation of distinction is the imagination that the cause of conventional usage is the mere designation of distinction in the relation of expression and the expressed.

original: bstan du med par khyad par gyi mtshan nyid du 'dogs pa tsam gyi tha snyad kyi rgyu nyid du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: bstan du med par khyad par gyi mtshan nyid du 'dogs pa tsam gyi tha snyad kyi rgyu nyid du rtog pa'o //
translated: It is the cause of the mere designation of the specific characteristics of the unmanifest.

original: chos kun du tshol ba la brtson pa'i yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gang /
analyzed: chos kun du tshol ba la brtson pa'i yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gang /
translated: What is perfect knowledge of the investigation of all dharmas?

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa bzhi ste /
translated: It is fourfold:

original: ming tshol bar rtog pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa dang / dngos po tshol bar rtog pa dang / ngo bo nyid du rtog pa tshol bar rtog pa dang / khyad par du 'dogs pa tshol bar rtog pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'o //
analyzed: ming tshol bar rtog pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa dang / dngos po tshol bar rtog pa dang / ngo bo nyid du rtog pa tshol bar rtog pa dang / khyad par du 'dogs pa tshol bar rtog pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'o //
translated: perfect knowledge of the investigation of the search for names, perfect knowledge of the investigation of the search for things, perfect knowledge of the investigation of the search for the essence of an entity, and perfect knowledge of the investigation of the search for the designation of a specific quality.

original: ming tshol bar rtog pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gang /
analyzed: ming tshol bar rtog pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gang /
translated: What is perfect knowledge of the investigation of the search for names?

original: ming mi dmigs par shes pa'o //
analyzed: ming mi dmigs par shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the non-perception of names.

original: dngos po tshol bar rtog pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gang /
analyzed: dngos po tshol bar rtog pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gang /
translated: What is perfect knowledge of the investigation of the search for things?

original: de bzhin du dngos po'i mtshan nyid mi dmigs par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po'i mtshan nyid mi dmigs par shes pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the characteristic of a thing is the knowledge of non-apprehension.

original: ngo bo nyid du 'dogs pa tshol bar rtog pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du 'dogs pa tshol bar rtog pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gang /
translated: What is the thorough knowledge of the investigation of the search for the designation of an intrinsic nature just as it is?

original: ngo bo nyid rdzas su mi dmigs par shes pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid rdzas su mi dmigs par shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the non-apprehension of an intrinsic substance.

original: khyad par du 'dogs pa tshol bar rtog pa yang dag pa'i lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gang /
analyzed: khyad par du 'dogs pa tshol bar rtog pa yang dag pa'i lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gang /
translated: What is the thorough knowledge of the investigation of the search for the designation of a particular just as it is?

original: bye brag rdzas su mi dmigs par shes pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag rdzas su mi dmigs par shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the non-apprehension of a particular substance.

original: yongs su tshol ba bzhi po de rnams ni ming la sogs pa la mi dmigs par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba bzhi po de rnams ni ming la sogs pa la mi dmigs par shes pa rnams so //
translated: These four investigations are the knowledges of the non-apprehension of name, etc.

original: chos la ting nge 'dzin du brtson pa'i rnal 'byor gyis gang de ni rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: chos la ting nge 'dzin du brtson pa'i rnal 'byor gyis gang de ni rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
translated: The meditative absorption of the Dharma should be seen as fivefold:

original: gzhi dang / bskyed pa dang / me long lta bu dang / snang ba dang / gnas so //
analyzed: gzhi dang / bskyed pa dang / me long lta bu dang / snang ba dang / gnas so //
translated: the basis, the generation, the mirror-like, the illumination, and the abode.

original: gzhi gang / tshogs bsags pa'i bden pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: gzhi gang / tshogs bsags pa'i bden pa las brtsams te /
translated: What is the basis? It is the accumulation of the equipment, beginning with the truths,

original: mang du thos pa nyid do //
analyzed: mang du thos pa nyid do //
translated: and the abundance of learning.

original: de la gzhi ni mang du thos pa ji ltar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi gnas su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de la gzhi ni mang du thos pa ji ltar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi gnas su gyur pa ste /
translated: The basis is the extensive learning that is the basis for serenity and insight,

original: de ni gzhi zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de ni gzhi zhes brjod do //
translated: and it is called the basis because it is the basis for the latter.

original: bskyed pa gang /üîΩde dmigs @238a * //
analyzed: bskyed pa gang / de dmigs @238a * //
translated: What is the generation?

original: pa tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: pa tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
translated: It is the proper mental attention to that object.

original: des mad du thos pa de la phyin ci ma log par don sems kyi tshul gyis sems 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des mad du thos pa de la phyin ci ma log par don sems kyi tshul gyis sems 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the mental attention to that extensive learning by way of the nondiscursive contemplation of the meaning.

original: me long lta bu gang /
analyzed: me long lta bu gang /
translated: What is the mirror?

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin mtshan ma dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin mtshan ma dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is concentration with its object.

original: mang du thos pa de nyid la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin mtshan ma dang bcas pa ste /üîΩshes bya'i dngos po dang mtshungs par gzugs brnyan lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mang du thos pa de nyid la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin mtshan ma dang bcas pa ste / shes bya'i dngos po dang mtshungs par gzugs brnyan lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is concentration with its object of extensive learning.üîΩIt is the reflection of the object of knowledge, as if in a mirror.

original: 'di'i me long lta bu nyid ni shes bya'i gzugs brnyan la yongs su rtogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i me long lta bu nyid ni shes bya'i gzugs brnyan la yongs su rtogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The mirror-like nature of this concentration should be understood as the reflection of the object of knowledge.

original: snang ba gang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa mi dmigs par shes pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba gang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa mi dmigs par shes pa'o //
translated: The appearance is the cognition that the object and subject are not perceived.

original: mngon sum du byung ba'i phyir ma thob pa'i lam gyis bsdus so //
analyzed: mngon sum du byung ba'i phyir ma thob pa'i lam gyis bsdus so //
translated: Since it is directly perceived, it is included in the path of non-acquisition.

original: 'di la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis //
analyzed: 'di la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis //
translated: With this in mind, the Blessed One said:

original: byang chub sems dpa' mnyam gzhag pa //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mnyam gzhag pa //
translated: The bodhisattva in meditative equipoise

original: yid kyi gzugs brnyan mthong bas na //
analyzed: yid kyi gzugs brnyan mthong bas na //
translated: sees the mental image

original: don gyi 'du shes ldog de nas //
analyzed: don gyi 'du shes ldog de nas //
translated: and then the perception of objects ceases.

original: rang gi 'du shes nges par gzung //
analyzed: rang gi 'du shes nges par gzung //
translated: Then he should grasp the perception of self.

original: de ltar nang gi sems gnas nas /
analyzed: de ltar nang gi sems gnas nas /
translated: Thus, having stabilized the inner mind,

original: gzung ba med par rtogs par byas //
analyzed: gzung ba med par rtogs par byas //
translated: he should realize the non-existence of the object.üîΩAfter that, he should realize

original: de yi 'og tu 'dzin med par //
analyzed: de yi 'og tu 'dzin med par //
translated: the non-existence of the subject.

original: de nas mi dmigs rig par bya //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas mi dmigs rig par bya // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Then he should realize non-apprehension.

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnal 'byor gyis 'di la brtson pa mi dmigs pa la reg ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnal 'byor gyis 'di la brtson pa mi dmigs pa la reg ce na /
translated: How do bodhisattvas who strive in this yoga through meditation touch non-apprehension?

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bskal pa grangs med pa tshar phyin nas de bzhin nyid rtogs pa dang mthun pa'i thob pa tshul bzhin yid la byed cing ting nge 'dzin sgrub ste /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bskal pa grangs med pa tshar phyin nas de bzhin nyid rtogs pa dang mthun pa'i thob pa tshul bzhin yid la byed cing ting nge 'dzin sgrub ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas who have accumulated the collections of merit and wisdom, having completed three countless eons, properly attend to the attainment that is consistent with the realization of thatness and accomplish concentration.

original: de de ltar mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis shes bya'i gzugs brnyan gang yin pa de la brten nas bsam gtan du byed do //
analyzed: de de ltar mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis shes bya'i gzugs brnyan gang yin pa de la brten nas bsam gtan du byed do //
translated: They practice concentration in dependence on the image of the object of knowledge that is the mind in meditative equipoise.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i sems las de gzhan ma yin par mthong bas gzugs brnyan de la yul gyi 'du shes bzlog ste /
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i sems las de gzhan ma yin par mthong bas gzugs brnyan de la yul gyi 'du shes bzlog ste /
translated: Since they see that it is not different from the mind in meditative equipoise, they stop the conception of the image as an object.

original: de'i rnam pa rang gi 'du shes tsam du 'dzin to //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa rang gi 'du shes tsam du 'dzin to //
translated: They apprehend it as merely the conception of its aspect.

original: de'i tshe rang gi sems tsam gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe rang gi sems tsam gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: At that time, because they abide in mere mind,

original: sems can du gnas par gyur nas bzung ba rnam pa thams cad du med par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sems can du gnas par gyur nas bzung ba rnam pa thams cad du med par rab tu shes so //
translated: they fully understand that all apprehended objects are completely nonexistent.

original: de'i 'og tu bzung ba med par 'dzin pa yang yongs su ma grub po zhes de yang med par rab tu rtogs so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bzung ba med par 'dzin pa yang yongs su ma grub po zhes de yang med par rab tu rtogs so //
translated: Then, without the object, the subject is also not established. Thus, he realizes that the subject also does not exist.

original: de'i 'og tu so so rang gi de gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du dmigs pa dang bral nas dmigs pa med par khong du chud do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu so so rang gi de gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du dmigs pa dang bral nas dmigs pa med par khong du chud do //
translated: Then, each one, free from the apprehension of the nature of both, understands the non-apprehension of objects.

original: de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: With regard to just that, the BhagavƒÅn said:

original: byang chub sems dpa' mnyam gzhag pa //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mnyam gzhag pa //
translated: The bodhisattva, in meditative equipoise,

original: yid kyi gzugs brnyan mthong bas na //
analyzed: yid kyi gzugs brnyan mthong bas na //
translated: sees the mental image.

original: don gyi 'du shes ldog de nas //
analyzed: don gyi 'du shes ldog de nas //
translated: Then, the conception of objects is reversed,

original: rang gi 'du shes nges par @238b gzung //
analyzed: rang gi 'du shes nges par @238b gzung //
translated: and he definitely apprehends his own conception.

original: de ltar nang gi sems gnas nas //
analyzed: de ltar nang gi sems gnas nas //
translated: Thus, having stabilized the inner mind,

original: bzung ba med par rtogs par bya //üîΩde yi 'og tu 'dzin med par //
analyzed: bzung ba med par rtogs par bya // de yi 'og tu 'dzin med par //
translated: he realizes the non-existence of the object.üîΩThen, without the object,

original: de nas mi dmigs rig par bya //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas mi dmigs rig par bya // zhes gsungs so //
translated: he understands the non-apprehension of the subject.

original: gnas gang gnas gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gnas gang gnas gyur pa'o //
translated: The basis is the mind and mental factors.

original: gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i gnas yongs su dag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i gnas yongs su dag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The transformation is the complete purity of the basis free from negative tendencies. This is what is meant by the complete purity of the basis.

original: rnal 'byor gyi sa 'di ni rgyu dang / 'bras bu bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi sa 'di ni rgyu dang / 'bras bu bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: This stage of yoga should be understood as the teaching of cause and effect.

original: de la bzhi la sogs pa bzhis ni rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: de la bzhi la sogs pa bzhis ni rgyu bstan to //
translated: Among these, the first four are the teaching of the cause.

original: tha ma gcig gis ni 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: tha ma gcig gis ni 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: The last one is the teaching of the effect.

original: ji ltar na chos la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na chos la mkhas pa yin /
translated: How is one skilled in the Dharma?

original: ji ltar na don la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na don la mkhas pa yin /
translated: How is one skilled in the meaning?

original: ji ltar na yi ge la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na yi ge la mkhas pa yin /
translated: How is one skilled in letters?

original: ji ltar na nges pa'i tshig la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na nges pa'i tshig la mkhas pa yin /
translated: How is one skilled in definitions?üîΩHow is one skilled in the intention of the beginning and end?

original: ji ltar na sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha'i dgongs pa la mkhas pa yin zhes bya ba'i dri ba lnga po 'di rnams mdo sde'i tshig gi rjes su 'brangs pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha'i dgongs pa la mkhas pa yin zhes bya ba'i dri ba lnga po 'di rnams mdo sde'i tshig gi rjes su 'brangs pas rig par bya'o //
translated: These five questions should be understood by following the words of the sutra.

original: ji skad du gnas brtan kun dga' bos tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: ji skad du gnas brtan kun dga' bos tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: As the elder Ananda said to the venerable Shariputra:

original: chos lnga dang ldan pa'i dge slong myur du 'dzin to //üîΩmang du 'dzin to //
analyzed: chos lnga dang ldan pa'i dge slong myur du 'dzin to // mang du 'dzin to //
translated: Venerable Shariputra, a monk with five qualities quickly grasps,üîΩgrasps much,

original: legs par 'dzin to //
analyzed: legs par 'dzin to //
translated: and grasps well.

original: gzung ba chud mi gzon to zhes mdo sder chos lnga po de rnams dang myur du 'dzin pa la sogs pa bzhi dang ci rigs su rig par bya'o //

original: ji ltar na chos la mkhas pa yin /

original: chos la mkhas pa ni myur du 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: chos la mkhas pa ni myur du 'dzin pa ste /

analyzed: mang du thos pa na tshig dang yi ge rnams tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: ji ltar na don la mkhas pa yin /

analyzed: chos mngon pa dang / 'dul ba mngon pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa'i phyir ro //

original: don la mkhas pa ni mang du 'dzin te /
analyzed: don la mkhas pa ni mang du 'dzin te /

original: chos mngon pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos mngon pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: nges pa'i tshig bzang po'i yi ge shes pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: bdag go // bdag ces yul mi'i des pa'i tshig la mngon par ma zhen par rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa shes pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: yi ge la mkhas pa dang / nges pa'i tshig la mkhas pa ni legs par 'dzin par 'gyur te /

analyzed: gzhung don dag phyin ci ma log par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: ji ltar na sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha'i dgongs ba la mkhas pa yin /
translated: How is he skilled in the intention concerning the past and the future?

original: sngon gyi mthar bzung ba dang / phyi ma'i mthar nges par 'byung bar bya ba shes pa @239a * //üîΩnyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi mthar bzung ba dang / phyi ma'i mthar nges par 'byung bar bya ba shes pa @239a * // nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mthar dgongs pa la mkhas pas ni //

original: ji ltar na chos la gnas pa nyid yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na chos la gnas pa nyid yin /

original: bsgom pa la ma brten par thos pa dang / sems pa'i sbyor ba 'ba' zhig gis kyang chos la gnas pa ma yin la /
analyzed: bsgom pa la ma brten par thos pa dang / sems pa'i sbyor ba 'ba' zhig gis kyang chos la gnas pa ma yin la /

analyzed: thos pa dang sems pa la ma brten par bsgom pa la sbyor pa 'ba' zhig gis kyang chos la gnas ba ma yin gyi /

analyzed: gnyi ga la brten te gnyi ga la gnas na chos la mkhas pa yin no //

original: btsun pa chos la gnas pa'i dge slong zhes bya ba'i mdo der ni /
analyzed: btsun pa chos la gnas pa'i dge slong zhes bya ba'i mdo der ni /

original: bsgom pa la zhugs pa ma yin te rnal 'byor la sogs pa bor ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir chos la gnas pa ma yin bar gzhag go //

translated: The one who is not engaged in meditation is the one who is skilled in the collections, skilled in the treatises, skilled in the meaning, skilled in the branches, and skilled in the vehicle.üîΩThe one who is engaged in listening and reflection is the one who is skilled in the collections, skilled in the treatises, skilled in the meaning, skilled in the branches, and skilled in the vehicle.üîΩThe one who is engaged in meditation is the one who is skilled in the collections, skilled in the treatises, skilled in the meaning, skilled in the branches, and skilled in the vehicle.

translated: The one who is not engaged in meditation is the one who is skilled in the collections, skilled in the treatises, skilled in the meaning, skilled in the branches, and skilled in the vehicle.üîΩThe one who is engaged in listening and reflection is the one who is skilled in the collections, skilled in the treatises, skilled in the meaning, skilled in the branches, and skilled in the vehicle.üîΩThe one who is engaged in meditation is the one who is skilled in the collections, skilled in the treatises, skilled in the meaning, skilled in the branches, and skilled in the vehicle.üîΩThe one who is not engaged in meditation is the one who is skilled in the collections, skilled in the treatises, skilled in the meaning, skilled in the branches, and skilled in the vehicle.

original: gang la la zhig thos pa dang sems pa la ma brten par bsgom pa 'ba' zhig la zhugs pa de yang chos la gnas pa ma yin pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gang la la zhig thos pa dang sems pa la ma brten par bsgom pa 'ba' zhig la zhugs pa de yang chos la gnas pa ma yin pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The one who is engaged in listening and reflection is the one who is skilled in the collections, skilled in the treatises, skilled in the meaning, skilled in the branches, and skilled in the vehicle.üîΩThe one who is engaged in meditation is the one who is skilled in the collections, skilled in the treatises, skilled in the meaning, skilled in the branches, and skilled in the vehicle.üîΩThe one who is not engaged in meditation is the one who is skilled in the collections, skilled in the treatises, skilled in the meaning, skilled in the branches, and skilled in

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis chos la gnas pa'i dge slong la brtsams te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis chos la gnas pa'i dge slong la brtsams te /

original: ci nas thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i shes pa la brten nas de gnyi ga la gnas pas chos la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci nas thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i shes pa la brten nas de gnyi ga la gnas pas chos la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'di ltar dge slong mdo dang / dbyangs kyi bsnyad pa dang / lung du bstan pa'i chos kun chub par byed pa zhes rgya cher gsungs nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge slong mdo dang / dbyangs kyi bsnyad pa dang / lung du bstan pa'i chos kun chub par byed pa zhes rgya cher gsungs nas /
translated: Thus, having said, ‚ÄúThe monk who is skilled in the Sutras, the melodious narrations, and the Expositions of the Dharma,‚Äù and so on,

analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnal 'byor mi 'dor ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: he then said, ‚ÄúHe does not abandon yoga,‚Äù and so on.

analyzed: rnal 'byor mi 'dor ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ting nge 'dzin la sbyor ba dang / chog par mi 'dzin pa dag gis bsgoms pa las byung bar bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúHe does not abandon yoga,‚Äù and so on, show that he is established in meditation, because he is engaged in samadhi and is not satisfied with it.

analyzed: sbyor ba ni rgyun du chud pa dang / gus par sbyor ba dang / ma log par sbyor bar blta bar @239b bya'o //

analyzed: chog par mi 'dzin pa ni ro mi myang ba dang / gong du zhi gnas la sbyor bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Not being satisfied is to be shown as not relishing and as applying oneself to higher serenity.

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That is twofold:

original: rgyun du chud pa dang / gus par sbyor bas bsdus pa ni rnal 'byor mi 'dor ba zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //üîΩma log par sbyor bar bsdus pas ni /

analyzed: chog par mi 'dzin pa ni nang du sems zhi gnas su byed pa mi 'dor ba zhes bya ba 'dis bstan te /

translated: Therein, the number of perfections is taught, their characteristics are taught, their sequence is taught, their verbal definitions are taught, their cultivation is taught, their divisions are taught, their summary is taught,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstan pa dang / yon tan gyi bsngags pa bstan pa dang / gcig la gcig nges pa'i phyir ro //üîΩci'i phyir mdo sde gzhan las shin tu rgyas pa byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i sde snod ces bya zhe na der pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi grangs bstan pa nas /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstan pa dang / yon tan gyi bsngags pa bstan pa dang / gcig la gcig nges pa'i phyir ro // ci'i phyir mdo sde gzhan las shin tu rgyas pa byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i sde snod ces bya zhe na der pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi grangs bstan pa nas /
translated: their resistances are taught, their praise is taught, and their mutual determination is taught.

original: gcig la gcig rnam par nges par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la gcig rnam par nges par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it called the ‚Äúextensive vehicle of the bodhisattva perfections basket‚Äù? Because therein the number of perfections is taught, up to and including their mutual determination.

original: de la grangs ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la grangs ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therein, the number is twofold:

original: bgrang ba'i grangs dang / de tsam gyi grangs so //
analyzed: bgrang ba'i grangs dang / de tsam gyi grangs so //

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug ces pa ni bgrang ba'i grangs so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug ces pa ni bgrang ba'i grangs so //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa gnyis gsum gsum gyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid de /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid de /
translated: The six perfections are the very essence of the path.

original: mi mang mi nyung pa ni de tsam gyi grangs so //
analyzed: mi mang mi nyung pa ni de tsam gyi grangs so //
translated: They are neither more nor less than that in number.

original: mngon bar mtho ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mngon bar mtho ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /

original: longs spyod chen po nyid dang / lus chen po nyid dang / phyogs chen po nyid do //
analyzed: longs spyod chen po nyid dang / lus chen po nyid dang / phyogs chen po nyid do //

analyzed: de la sbyin pa las longs spyod chen po 'thob pa'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni longs spyod chen po nyid do //

original: de la tshul khrims kyis ni bde 'gro'i lus phun sum tshogs ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims kyis ni bde 'gro'i lus phun sum tshogs ba thob pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni lus nyid do //

analyzed: bzod pas skye ba thams cad sngon du 'gro bar 'gyur ba thob pa'i phyir bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni phyogs chen po nyid do //

original: nges par legs pa'i lam yang rnam pa gsum te /
analyzed: nges par legs pa'i lam yang rnam pa gsum te /

original: nyon mongs pa zil gyis mnan @240a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zil gyis mnan @240a * //
translated: the method of applying oneself to virtue by suppressing the afflictions,üîΩthe method of maturing sentient beings, and the method of accomplishing the Buddha and the Dharma.

original: nas dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba'i thabs dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs dang / sangs rgyas dang chos yang dag par bsgrub pa'i thabs te 'di dag las gang yang rung ba cig med na byang chub sems dpa'i nges par legs pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nas dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba'i thabs dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs dang / sangs rgyas dang chos yang dag par bsgrub pa'i thabs te 'di dag las gang yang rung ba cig med na byang chub sems dpa'i nges par legs pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the bodhisattva's definite goodness does not occur if any one of these is missing,

original: de la sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs ni /
analyzed: de la sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs ni /

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /

analyzed: de la brten nas mngon par shes pa rnams kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: yang mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i thabs su pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid de /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa las bzlog ste /

analyzed: 'khor ba na mngon par mthong ba yongs su gzung bar bya'o //

analyzed: 'khor ba na gnas pa las bzlog ste der nyon mongs pa med par bya'o //

analyzed: de'i phyir gsum na mngon par mtho ba thob pa'i gnas so //

original: gsum ni de ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs te /
analyzed: gsum ni de ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs te /
translated: The three perfections are the means for attaining the transcendence of suffering.

original: snga ma'i tshul du go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o /üîΩkun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs la brtson 'grus kyis ni gnyen po bsgom mo //üîΩbsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa rnam par gnon to //
