translated: They should be understood in the same order as before.üîΩBy means of effort, one cultivates the antidote to the afflictions.üîΩBy means of meditative absorption, one suppresses the afflictions.

original: shes rab kyis ni bag la nyal legs par 'joms so //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni bag la nyal legs par 'joms so //
translated: By means of wisdom, one destroys the latent predispositions for the afflictions.

original: sems can rjes su 'dzin pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i phyir yang rnam grangs gzhan te /
analyzed: sems can rjes su 'dzin pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i phyir yang rnam grangs gzhan te /
translated: There is another explanation: in order to care for sentient beings and to remedy the afflictions.

original: de la sbyin pas ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la yo byad nye bar bsgrub pa'i phan 'dogs pa rjes su 'dzin to //
analyzed: de la sbyin pas ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la yo byad nye bar bsgrub pa'i phan 'dogs pa rjes su 'dzin to //
translated: Therein, by means of generosity, the bodhisattva cares for sentient beings by providing for their needs.

original: tshul khrims kyis ni phongs pa dang / gnod pa dang / rnam par 'tsho ba med pa'i tshul gyis rjes su 'dzin to //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni phongs pa dang / gnod pa dang / rnam par 'tsho ba med pa'i tshul gyis rjes su 'dzin to //
translated: By means of morality, he cares for them by not harming them, by not being a source of harm.

original: go rims bzhin du longs spyod dang / lus dang sems la gnod pa mi bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbzod pas ni /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du longs spyod dang / lus dang sems la gnod pa mi bsgrub pa'i phyir ro // bzod pas ni /
translated: Because, respectively, he does not harm their property, their bodies, or their minds.

original: phongs pa dang gnod pa la ji mi snyam pas rjes su 'dzin to //
analyzed: phongs pa dang gnod pa la ji mi snyam pas rjes su 'dzin to //
translated: By means of patience, he cares for them by not retaliating when they harm him.

original: gzhan dag gi longs spyod la sogs pa la 'dod pa la gnod pa la ji mi snyam pa'i phyir te de gsum gyis rjes su 'dzin to //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi longs spyod la sogs pa la 'dod pa la gnod pa la ji mi snyam pa'i phyir te de gsum gyis rjes su 'dzin to //
translated: Because he does not retaliate for harm done to his property, etc.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni nyon mongs pa rnam par mnan kyang dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni nyon mongs pa rnam par mnan kyang dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ro //
translated: By means of effort, he cares for them by applying himself to virtue, even though he has suppressed the afflictions.

original: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa rnam par gnon to //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa rnam par gnon to //
translated: By means of meditative concentration, one suppresses the afflictions.

original: shes rab kyis ni bag la nyal legs par 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni bag la nyal legs par 'joms par byed do //
translated: By means of wisdom, one destroys the latent forms of the afflictions.

original: 'di gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por rig par bya'o //
translated: These three should be understood as the antidotes to the mental afflictions.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /üîΩsbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang byang chub @240b sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la brten nas /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang byang chub @240b sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la brten nas /
translated: What is the definition of the bodhisattva‚Äôs vehicle that possesses the perfections?üîΩThe perfection of generosity is the act of giving away all one‚Äôs possessions with a mind that is preceded by compassion and that is based upon the bodhisattva‚Äôs own essential nature.

original: snying rje sngon du btang ba'i sems kyis bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i lus dang / dag dang yid kyi las te /üîΩde ltar byas na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nying rigs dang / smon lam dang / bsam pa dang / dngos po dang / ngo bo nyid kyis bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje sngon du btang ba'i sems kyis bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i lus dang / dag dang yid kyi las te / de ltar byas na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nying rigs dang / smon lam dang / bsam pa dang / dngos po dang / ngo bo nyid kyis bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is an act of body, speech, and mind.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: In this way, the definition of the perfection of generosity should be understood as being presented by means of its cause, its aspirational prayer, its attitude, its substance, and its essential nature.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid ni rigs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid ni rigs so //
translated: The cause of the perfection of generosity is a bodhisattva‚Äôs spiritual lineage.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni smon lam mo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni smon lam mo //
translated: The Thought of Enlightenment is the vow.

original: snying rje sngon du btang ba'i sems ni bsam pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje sngon du btang ba'i sems ni bsam pa'o //
translated: The mind preceded by compassion is the intention.

original: bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba ni dngos po'o //
analyzed: bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba ni dngos po'o //
translated: The giving of all one has is the thing.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las ni ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las ni ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The action of body, speech, and mind is the essence.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la yang rgya cher rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la yang rgya cher rig par bya'o //
translated: And so on up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang /
translated: What is the perfection of morality?

original: gang byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems la brtan nas snying rje sngon du btang ba'i sems kyis sdom pa dang bsdams pa thams cad yang dag par len pa dang / yongs su bsrung ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las so //
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems la brtan nas snying rje sngon du btang ba'i sems kyis sdom pa dang bsdams pa thams cad yang dag par len pa dang / yongs su bsrung ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las so //
translated: It is the action of body, speech, and mind of one who, abiding in the nature of a Bodhisattva, having stabilized the Thought of Enlightenment, having compassion as his guide, takes up and guards all the vows and restraints.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang /
translated: What is the perfection of patience?

original: gang byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems la brten nas snying rje sngon du btang ba'i sems kyis gnod pa byed pa thams cad dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa la lhag par gnas pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las so //
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems la brten nas snying rje sngon du btang ba'i sems kyis gnod pa byed pa thams cad dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa la lhag par gnas pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las so //
translated: It is the action of body, speech, and mind of the bodhisattva who is established in the reality of the bodhisattva and who, on the basis of the spirit of enlightenment, with a mind preceded by compassion, endures all harm and suffering.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang /
translated: What is the perfection of effort?

original: gang byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems la brten nas snying rje sngon du btang ba'i sems kyis dge ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par bsgrub pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las so //
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems la brten nas snying rje sngon du btang ba'i sems kyis dge ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par bsgrub pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las so //
translated: It is the action of body, speech, and mind of the bodhisattva who is established in the reality of the bodhisattva and who, on the basis of the spirit of enlightenment, with a mind preceded by compassion, accomplishes all virtuous activities.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang /
translated: What is the perfection of meditation?

original: gang byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems la brten nas snying rje sngon du btang ba'i sems kyis lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi rnam pa thams cad dbang 'byor pa la sems kyi gnas pa thams cad
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems la brten nas snying rje sngon du btang ba'i sems kyis lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi rnam pa thams cad dbang 'byor pa la sems kyi gnas pa thams cad
translated: It is the mental state of a bodhisattva who, on the basis of the bodhisattva‚Äôs way of life, and on the basis of the spirit of enlightenment, and with a mind preceded by compassion, has mastery over all the aspects of physical, verbal, and mental activity.

original: dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is accompanied by all the states of mental stability.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang /üîΩgang byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems la brten nas snying rje sngon du btang ba'i sems kyis lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi rnam pa thams cad dbang 'byor ba @241a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang / gang byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems la brten nas snying rje sngon du btang ba'i sems kyis lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi rnam pa thams cad dbang 'byor ba @241a * //
translated: What is the perfection of wisdom?

original: la rnam pa thams cad du chos rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: la rnam pa thams cad du chos rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: It is the discernment of all the aspects of the Dharma by a bodhisattva who, on the basis of the bodhisattva‚Äôs way of life, and on the basis of the spirit of enlightenment, and with a mind preceded by compassion, has mastery over all the aspects of physical, verbal, and mental activity.

original: yang sbyin pa ni mkhyen pa nyid las brtsams pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su 'dzin pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bya ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: yang sbyin pa ni mkhyen pa nyid las brtsams pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su 'dzin pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bya ba byed pa ste /
translated: Moreover, generosity is undertaken from the knowledge of all things, it becomes the knowledge of all things, it holds the knowledge of all things, and it performs the function of the knowledge of all things.

original: de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod do //
translated: This is called the perfection of generosity.

original: sbyin pa'i tshig bzhi po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du rtsom pa dang / bag chags dang / sku dang / rgyu mthun par yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i tshig bzhi po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du rtsom pa dang / bag chags dang / sku dang / rgyu mthun par yang rig par bya'o //
translated: These four terms generosity should be understood respectively as undertaking, instinct, body, and natural outcome.

original: de la rtsom pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las brtsams te /
analyzed: de la rtsom pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las brtsams te /
translated: Undertaking is the beginning of the knowledge of all things,

original: byung ba ma byung ba dar yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byung ba ma byung ba dar yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the dedication of the arising and nonarising of generosity.

original: sbyin pa de nyid rgyud la bag chags yongs su bsgos te de las phyi ma thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa de nyid rgyud la bag chags yongs su bsgos te de las phyi ma thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: That generosity itself is the instinct in the life stream, from which the knowledge of all things arises in the future.

original: gang gi tshe de nyid yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de'i tshe chos kyi sku yongs su bsgrub pa'i tshul gyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de nyid yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de'i tshe chos kyi sku yongs su bsgrub pa'i tshul gyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: When that is fully accomplished, then omniscience is fully grasped by the method of accomplishing the Dharma Body.üîΩAfter that, by the Enjoyment Body and the Apparition Body, the work of omniscience is done by the method of natural outcome.

original: de'i 'og tu longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i skus rgyu mthun pa'i sgo nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bya ba byed de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i skus rgyu mthun pa'i sgo nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bya ba byed de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be understood in the same way.

original: go rims bzhin 'og ma 'og ma la brten pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: go rims bzhin 'og ma 'og ma la brten pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the latter is based on the former, in order.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas ni nang dang phyi'i dngos po thams cad yongs su gtod par goms pas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas ni nang dang phyi'i dngos po thams cad yongs su gtod par goms pas /
translated: By the perfection of giving, the bodhisattva, through the practice of giving away all internal and external things,

original: lus dang srog la mi lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i longs spyod kyi phung po chen po yang spangs nas tshul khrims yang dag par 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: lus dang srog la mi lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i longs spyod kyi phung po chen po yang spangs nas tshul khrims yang dag par 'dzin par byed do //
translated: having abandoned even a great mass of wealth, takes up morality, without regard for body and life.

original: tshul khrims rjes su bsrungs pas ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims rjes su bsrungs pas ni /
translated: By the practice of morality, he obtains the perfection of patience.

original: gshe ba la yang bdag gis slar gshe bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis bzod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gshe ba la yang bdag gis slar gshe bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis bzod par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should practice patience by means of the following considerations: ‚ÄúEven if someone were to cut off my flesh with a knife, I would not wish to harm even him, let alone someone else who has harmed me.‚Äù

original: grang ba la sogs pa bzod pa ni de'i gzhi las sbyor ba mi nyams par brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin no //üîΩbrtson 'grus brtsams pa ni sbyor ba'i 'bras bu 'thob pas bsam gtan bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: grang ba la sogs pa bzod pa ni de'i gzhi las sbyor ba mi nyams par brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin no // brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni sbyor ba'i 'bras bu 'thob pas bsam gtan bsgrub pa'o //
translated: One should practice patience with cold, etc., by not giving up one‚Äôs practice of austerities.

original: bsam gtan phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: One should practice meditation by attaining concentration through the practice of effort, since the fruit of practice is attained through effort.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa thob bo //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa thob bo //
translated: One should practice wisdom by attaining the supramundane knowledge through the knowledge of reality, since one whose mind is concentrated attains the supramundane knowledge.

original: yang gong ma gong ma gzhi yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang gong ma gong ma gzhi yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The higher is the basis of the lower.

original: tshul khrims ni sbyin pa'i gzhi yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni sbyin pa'i gzhi yin no //
translated: Morality is the basis of generosity.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyang bsam gtan gyi gzhi yin pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyang bsam gtan gyi gzhi yin pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Similarly, up to: wisdom is the basis of meditation.

original: 'di ltar tshul khrims dang ldan pa ni sbyin pas phan gdags pa la tshul khrims kyis gnod par mi byed pa'i phyir sbyin pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshul khrims dang ldan pa ni sbyin pas phan gdags pa la tshul khrims kyis gnod par mi byed pa'i phyir sbyin pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one who is endowed with morality, by means of morality, does not harm the one who is to be benefited by the gift, and so the giving becomes pure.

original: de ltar @241b byang chub sems dpa' len ba bo de la rnam par 'tshe ba dang bral bar yo byad kyis bde bar 'byor bas tshul khrims kyi stobs kyis sbyin pa rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar @241b byang chub sems dpa' len ba bo de la rnam par 'tshe ba dang bral bar yo byad kyis bde bar 'byor bas tshul khrims kyi stobs kyis sbyin pa rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the giving of the bodhisattva who is the receiver becomes pure by the power of morality, through the absence of violence toward the one who is to receive, and through the abundance of happiness that comes from the necessities of life.

original: de lta bzod pa dang ldan pa ni gzhan gnod pa byed pa dag gis bslab pa'i gzhi mi 'dra bar tshul khrims rnam par dag po /
analyzed: de lta bzod pa dang ldan pa ni gzhan gnod pa byed pa dag gis bslab pa'i gzhi mi 'dra bar tshul khrims rnam par dag po /
translated: Thus, one who is endowed with patience, by means of patience, does not violate the precepts of morality through anger at the one who offends, and so the morality becomes pure.

original: // brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i spro ba'i stobs kyis sems can gyi ched du 'khor ba khas blangs pa ni sems can log par bsgrub pa'i sdug bsngal bde blag tu bzod pas bzod pa rnam par dag go //
analyzed: // brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i spro ba'i stobs kyis sems can gyi ched du 'khor ba khas blangs pa ni sems can log par bsgrub pa'i sdug bsngal bde blag tu bzod pas bzod pa rnam par dag go //
translated: The giving of one who is energetic becomes pure by the power of the strength of enthusiasm that comes from the practice of effort, because one easily endures the suffering that comes from the wrong practice of sentient beings, having accepted samsara for the sake of sentient beings.

original: bsam gtan pa ni bde ba dang bcas pa dang / yid bde ba dang bcas par dge ba'i chos thams cad la yang sbyor bas brtson 'grus rnam par dag go //
analyzed: bsam gtan pa ni bde ba dang bcas pa dang / yid bde ba dang bcas par dge ba'i chos thams cad la yang sbyor bas brtson 'grus rnam par dag go //
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattva is pure, since it is applied to all virtuous qualities with happiness and mental pleasure.

original: shes rab dang ldan pa'i chos rnam pa mang po'ang rnam par bltas nas /
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pa'i chos rnam pa mang po'ang rnam par bltas nas /
translated: The wisdom of the bodhisattva is pure, since it is applied to the many aspects of the teachings and to the discernment of inner peace.

original: nang rab tu zhi bar byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin rnam par 'phel bas bsam gtan rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: nang rab tu zhi bar byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin rnam par 'phel bas bsam gtan rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The meditation of the bodhisattva is pure, since it increases concentration and pacifies the mind.

original: shes rab med la bsam gtan med ces tshigs su bcad pa las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab med la bsam gtan med ces tshigs su bcad pa las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As it is said in verse: Without wisdom, there is no meditation.

original: yang ji ltar rigs pa'i rim gyis go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang ji ltar rigs pa'i rim gyis go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the order should be understood according to the order of coarseness, as is fitting.

original: sbyin pa ni thams cad kyi nang na rags te de'i phyir thog mar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni thams cad kyi nang na rags te de'i phyir thog mar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Giving is the coarsest of all, so it is presented first.

original: de'i 'og tu bzod pa la sogs pas tshul khrims rags so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bzod pa la sogs pas tshul khrims rags so //
translated: After that, morality is coarser than patience,

original: de bzhin du shes rab pas bsam gtan rags pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab pas bsam gtan rags pa'i bar du'o //
translated: and similarly, up to meditation being coarser than wisdom.

original: shes rab ni thabs kyi nang na phra ste /
analyzed: shes rab ni thabs kyi nang na phra ste /
translated: Wisdom is the most subtle of the means.

original: de'i phyir thams cad kyi tha mar bzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad kyi tha mar bzhag go //
translated: Therefore, it is placed last of all.

original: nges pa'i tshig ni ci'i phyir sbyin pa la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig ni ci'i phyir sbyin pa la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Etymology. Why is generosity called the perfection of giving?

original: sbyin pa chen po dang / skyon med pa dang / dri ma med pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa chen po dang / skyon med pa dang / dri ma med pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Great generosity, faultless generosity, and stainless generosity is called the perfection of giving.

original: de la sbyin pa chen po ni nang dang phyi'i dngos po rnam pa thams cad sbyin pa dang / dus yun ring du sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa chen po ni nang dang phyi'i dngos po rnam pa thams cad sbyin pa dang / dus yun ring du sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, great generosity is the giving of all kinds of internal and external things, and the giving of them for a long time.

original: skyon med pa ni gnod pas kun du tshol ba la sogs pa rnam par spangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skyon med pa ni gnod pas kun du tshol ba la sogs pa rnam par spangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Faultless generosity is the avoidance of seeking to harm others, etc.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las sbyin pa mi zad pa las brtsams te bstan pa /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las sbyin pa mi zad pa las brtsams te bstan pa /
translated: As the Aksayamatinirdesa Sutra teaches, beginning with the imperishability of generosity:

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa yang mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa yang mi zad pa ste /

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na tshad med pa'i phyir ro //

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa yongs su sbyong ba yang tshad med pa ste tshe dang spobs pa dang / bde ba dang / stobs dang / kha dog nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa yongs su sbyong ba yang tshad med pa ste tshe dang spobs pa dang / bde ba dang / stobs dang / kha dog nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir /

analyzed: zas 'dod pa rnams la zas sbyin pa'o //

original: nyon mongs pa'i sred pa bsal ba'i @242a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sred pa bsal ba'i @242a * //
translated: For the sake of eliminating the craving of afflictions,

original: phyir ; btung ba 'dod pa rnams la btung ba sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: phyir ; btung ba 'dod pa rnams la btung ba sbyin pa'o //

original: bde ba dang 'byor ba'i dngos po thams cad bsdu ba'i phyir bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la bzhon pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang 'byor ba'i dngos po thams cad bsdu ba'i phyir bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la bzhon pa sbyin pa'o //

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang / mdog gser gyi kha dog yongs su sbyang pa'i phyir gos 'dod pa rnams la gos sbyin pa'i //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang / mdog gser gyi kha dog yongs su sbyang pa'i phyir gos 'dod pa rnams la gos sbyin pa'i //
translated: For the sake of the modesty and decorum of the color of a golden complexion, for those who desire clothing, they give clothing.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i spyan yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir mar me 'dod pa rnams la mar me sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i spyan yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir mar me 'dod pa rnams la mar me sbyin pa'o //
translated: For the sake of the purification of the divine eye of the TathƒÅgata, for those who desire lamps, they give lamps.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i snyan yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i snyan yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: sil snyan 'dod pa rnams la sil snyan sbyin no //

original: tshul khrims dang thos pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi dris byug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang thos pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi dris byug pa'i phyir /

analyzed: spos dang byug pa 'dod pa rnams la spos dang byug pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: he gives perfumes and ointments to those who want perfumes and ointments.

original: gzungs dang spobs pa dang byang chub kyi yan lag gi me tog thob par bya ba'i phyir phreng ba 'dod pa rnams la phreng ba sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gzungs dang spobs pa dang byang chub kyi yan lag gi me tog thob par bya ba'i phyir phreng ba 'dod pa rnams la phreng ba sbyin pa'o //

analyzed: lus kyi dri yid du 'ong ba thob par bya ba'i phyir /

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan ro bro ba'i mchog yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro bro ba thams cad 'dod pa la ro bro ba thams cad sbyin no //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan ro bro ba'i mchog yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro bro ba thams cad 'dod pa la ro bro ba thams cad sbyin no //
translated: In order to perfect the supreme taste of the major marks of a great person, he gives all tastes to those who want all tastes.

original: sems can thams cad kyi gnas dang / skyabs dang mgon dang / dpung gnyen bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi gnas dang / skyabs dang mgon dang / dpung gnyen bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: gnas 'dod pa rnams la gnas sbyin pa'o //
translated: he gives shelter to those who want shelter.üîΩIn order to attain the bed of the Tathagata, which is the state of the gods and Brahma, and which is the complete abandonment of all obscurations,

original: sgrib pa thams cad rab tu spangs pa dang / lha dang tshangs pa'i gnas pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzims cha thob par bya ba'i phyir mal cha 'dod pa rnams la mal cha sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad rab tu spangs pa dang / lha dang tshangs pa'i gnas pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzims cha thob par bya ba'i phyir mal cha 'dod pa rnams la mal cha sbyin pa'o //
translated: he gives beds to those who want beds.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i sa thams cad byang chub kyi snying po'i rdo rje'i gdan thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i sa thams cad byang chub kyi snying po'i rdo rje'i gdan thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to attain the vajra seat of enlightenment in the center of the great trichiliocosm,

original: stan 'dod pa rnams la stan sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: stan 'dod pa rnams la stan sbyin pa'o //
translated: he gives seats to those who want seats.üîΩIn order to gather all the requisites for enlightenment,

original: byang chub kyi yo byang thams cad yongs su sbyor ba'i phyir yo byad 'dod pa rnams la yo byad sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yo byang thams cad yongs su sbyor ba'i phyir yo byad 'dod pa rnams la yo byad sbyin pa'o //
translated: he gives necessities to those who want necessities.

original: mi rga mi 'chi ba'i bdud rtsi'i bde ba yongs su bskang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi rga mi 'chi ba'i bdud rtsi'i bde ba yongs su bskang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to fulfill the bliss of the deathless nectar,

original: na ba sman 'dod pa thams cad la sman sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: na ba sman 'dod pa thams cad la sman sbyin pa'o //
translated: he gives medicine to the sick who want medicine.

original: rang dbang dang / rang nyams dang / rang byung gi ye shes yongs su bskang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang dbang dang / rang nyams dang / rang byung gi ye shes yongs su bskang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to fulfill the self-mastery, self-enjoyment, and self-arisen intuition of the bodhisattva,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bran po dang / bran mo yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o zhes rgya cher 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bran po dang / bran mo yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o zhes rgya cher 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: the bodhisattvas give away their male and female servants.

original: dri ma med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is stainless because it is free of stinginess and its instincts.

original: dam pa rnam pa 'di gsum gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: dam pa rnam pa 'di gsum gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: The perfection of giving is so called because of these three excellences.

original: dam @242b pa rnam pa gsum ni 'dris pa dang bcas pa'i ngo bo nyid dam pa dang / thabs dam pa dang / 'bras bu dam pa'o //
analyzed: dam @242b pa rnam pa gsum ni 'dris pa dang bcas pa'i ngo bo nyid dam pa dang / thabs dam pa dang / 'bras bu dam pa'o //
translated: The three excellences are the excellence of the nature of the familiar, the excellence of the means, and the excellence of the result.

original: 'dris pa ni yun ring po nas sbyin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dris pa ni yun ring po nas sbyin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The familiar is to be known as the long-cultivation of giving.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the perfections up to insight.

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa skyon med pa ni bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa la sogs pa rnam par spang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa skyon med pa ni bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa la sogs pa rnam par spang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Morality and so on are faultless because they eliminate the superimposition of self and so on.

original: ci rigs su blo gros mi zad pa las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci rigs su blo gros mi zad pa las blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be understood according to the Ak·π£ayamatis≈´tra, as appropriate.

original: yang dam pa rnam pa bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dam pa rnam pa bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it is called perfection because it possesses twelve kinds of supremacy.

original: dam pa rnam pa bcu gnyis pa rgya che ba dam pa ni 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mi 'dod pa dang / mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa rnam pa bcu gnyis pa rgya che ba dam pa ni 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mi 'dod pa dang / mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The supremacy of vastness is because it does not desire any mundane excellence and is supreme.

original: yun ring ba dam pa ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du yongs su bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun ring ba dam pa ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du yongs su bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The supremacy of duration is because it is cultivated for three incalculable aeons.

original: ched du bya ba dam pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩmi zad pa'i shes pa dam pa ni /
analyzed: ched du bya ba dam pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i phyir ro // mi zad pa'i shes pa dam pa ni /
translated: The supremacy of purpose is because it is for the sake of benefiting all sentient beings.

original: byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pas gtan du yongs su gtugs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pas gtan du yongs su gtugs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The supremacy of knowledge of inexhaustibility is because it is never exhausted by being dedicated to great enlightenment.üîΩThe supremacy of attainment is because it is the attainment of the two kinds of purity.

original: rgyun mi 'chad pa dam pa ni bdag dang gzhan pa nyid du mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa dam pa ni bdag dang gzhan pa nyid du mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The highest continuity is due to the conviction of self and other.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sbyin pa la sogs pas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩtshegs med pa dam pa ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sbyin pa la sogs pas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro // tshegs med pa dam pa ni /
translated: The highest completion is due to the completion of the transcendences such as generosity by all beings.

original: gzhan gyi sbyin pa la rjes su yi rang ba tsam gyis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sbyin pa la rjes su yi rang ba tsam gyis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The highest non-difficulty is due to the completion of the transcendences such as generosity by mere sympathetic joy in the generosity of others.

original: dbang 'byor pa dam pa ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pas sbyin pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang 'byor pa dam pa ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pas sbyin pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The highest mastery is due to the completion of the transcendences such as generosity by means of the concentration of the sky treasury and so on.

original: yongs su bzung ba dam pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba dam pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The highest possession is due to the possession of the transcendences such as generosity by means of the intuition of the absence of conceptual constructions.

original: rtsom pa dam pa ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa la bzod pa cher gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rtsom pa dam pa ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa la bzod pa cher gyur pa'o //
translated: The highest undertaking is on the stage of action out of faith, due to the increase of tolerance.

original: mthong bdam pa ni sa dang po la'o //
analyzed: mthong bdam pa ni sa dang po la'o //
translated: The highest vision is on the first stage.

original: rgyu mthun pa dam pa ni de ma yin pa gzhan brgyad po dag la'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa dam pa ni de ma yin pa gzhan brgyad po dag la'o //
translated: The highest of the natural outflow is the other eight perfections.

original: 'grub pa dam pa ni sa bcu pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la byang chub sems dpa' 'grub pa dang / sangs rgyas 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'grub pa dam pa ni sa bcu pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la byang chub sems dpa' 'grub pa dang / sangs rgyas 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The highest of the accomplishments is on the tenth stage and the stage of the tathagatas, because the bodhisattva is accomplished and the buddha is accomplished.

original: yang dam pa rnams kyis spyad par bya ba dang / bgrod pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: yang dam pa rnams kyis spyad par bya ba dang / bgrod pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Moreover, they are perfections because they are practiced and traversed by the holy ones.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis spyad pa dang / bgrod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis spyad pa dang / bgrod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that they are practiced and traversed by the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: yang shes bya'i pha rol tu phyin pa pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: yang shes bya'i pha rol tu phyin pa pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Moreover, they are perfections because they are the perfection of the knowable.

original: sangs rgyas nyid la gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid la gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that they are the perfection of the knowable in the state of buddhahood.

original: yang na gzhan dag bdag mchog tu gnod pa las sgrol bar byed pa'i phyir pha rol tu @243a * //üîΩphyin pa rnams te /
analyzed: yang na gzhan dag bdag mchog tu gnod pa las sgrol bar byed pa'i phyir pha rol tu @243a * // phyin pa rnams te /
translated: Or else, they are perfections because they liberate others from the supreme danger to themselves.

original: gzhan dang bdag sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtsho las bzla bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan dang bdag sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtsho las bzla bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that they liberate both others and themselves from the ocean of suffering.

original: 'di ni re zhig thun mong nges pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig thun mong nges pa'i tshig go //
translated: This is the common explanation of the terms.

original: so so'i nges pa'i tshig ni sbyin bdag gi dbul ba sel ba dang / len pa po rnams kyi gdung ba sel ba'i phyir sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i nges pa'i tshig ni sbyin bdag gi dbul ba sel ba dang / len pa po rnams kyi gdung ba sel ba'i phyir sbyin pa'o //
translated: The individual explanations are as follows: Generosity is so called because it removes the poverty of benefactors and the distress of supplicants.

original: dbang po zhi ba thob pa dang / 'gro ba bzang po thob pa dang / bsil ba'i gnas yin pas tshul khrims te go rims bzhin du dbang po rnams sdom par byed pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyur gyur pa dang / 'gyod pa med pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po zhi ba thob pa dang / 'gro ba bzang po thob pa dang / bsil ba'i gnas yin pas tshul khrims te go rims bzhin du dbang po rnams sdom par byed pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyur gyur pa dang / 'gyod pa med pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Morality is so called because it obtains the pacification of the senses, obtains a good destiny, and is the basis of coolness, since it is the cause of the restraint of the senses, the cause of going to good destinies, and the basis of non-remorse, etc., up to nirvana.

original: khro pa'i tsha ba sel ba dang rma 'byin pa'i sems 'ongs pa sel ba dang / zhi ba brjod pa'i phyir bzod ba'o //
analyzed: khro pa'i tsha ba sel ba dang rma 'byin pa'i sems 'ongs pa sel ba dang / zhi ba brjod pa'i phyir bzod ba'o //
translated: Patience is so called because it removes the heat of anger, removes the intention to injure, and is the expression of peace.

original: rma 'byin pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni gang gis gnod par byed pa rnams la lan du gnod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rma 'byin pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni gang gis gnod par byed pa rnams la lan du gnod par byed pa ste /
translated: The intention to injure is that by which one injures those who injure oneself.

original: de 'ongs pa 'dis bral bar byed pa ni sel bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de 'ongs pa 'dis bral bar byed pa ni sel bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúseparation‚Äù should be understood as ‚Äúremoval‚Äù.

original: rma 'byin pa 'di dag la shar gnyer ba yongs su rma 'byin pa can te de dag la mi 'jigs pa sgrogs pa ni bde ba brjod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rma 'byin pa 'di dag la shar gnyer ba yongs su rma 'byin pa can te de dag la mi 'jigs pa sgrogs pa ni bde ba brjod par rig par bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúfearlessness‚Äù should be understood as ‚Äúhappiness‚Äù in the sense of proclaiming fearlessness in regard to those who are afflicted by the wounds of the world.

original: sel ba dang 'phel bar spyod pa dang ldan pas brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: sel ba dang 'phel bar spyod pa dang ldan pas brtson 'grus te /
translated: Vigor is the practice of removal and increase.

original: de la sems pa'i phyir spyod pa ni yang dag par spong ba gnyis mi dge ba'i chos dang bral bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems pa'i phyir spyod pa ni yang dag par spong ba gnyis mi dge ba'i chos dang bral bar byed pa'o //
translated: The practice of removal is the practice of the first two of the four right efforts, i.e., the abandonment of unwholesome factors that have already arisen and the prevention of the arising of unwholesome factors that have not yet arisen.

original: 'phel ba'i phyir spyod pa ni yang dag par spang ba gnyis kyis dge ba'i chos yang dag par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'phel ba'i phyir spyod pa ni yang dag par spang ba gnyis kyis dge ba'i chos yang dag par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The practice of increase is the practice of the last two of the four right efforts, i.e., the production of wholesome factors that have not yet arisen and the augmentation of wholesome factors that have already arisen.

original: 'dzin pa dang / sdom pa dang / 'dul ba dang / thob par byed pas bsam gtan ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang / sdom pa dang / 'dul ba dang / thob par byed pas bsam gtan ste /
translated: Meditation is the practice of retention, restraint, taming, and attainment.

original: de la 'dzin pa ni dmigs pa la sems 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dzin pa ni dmigs pa la sems 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Among them, retention is the retention of the mind on an object.

original: sdom pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba las sems yang dag par sdom pa'o //
analyzed: sdom pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba las sems yang dag par sdom pa'o //
translated: Restraint is the restraint of the mind from distraction.

original: 'dul ba ni kun nas dkris pa rnams rnam par gnon pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba ni kun nas dkris pa rnams rnam par gnon pa'o //
translated: Discipline is the suppression of the entanglements.

original: thob par byed pa ni dbang 'byor ba thob par byed par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thob par byed pa ni dbang 'byor ba thob par byed par rig par bya'o //
translated: The cause of attainment should be understood as the attainment of mastery.

original: gzhan gyis smra ba shes pa dang / so so rang gis shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang / rab tu zhi ba thob pa'i shes pa dang / yon tan mchog tu 'byin pa shes pas shes rab tu rig par bya ste /üîΩde la gzhan gyis smras ba shes pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smra ba shes pa dang / so so rang gis shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang / rab tu zhi ba thob pa'i shes pa dang / yon tan mchog tu 'byin pa shes pas shes rab tu rig par bya ste / de la gzhan gyis smras ba shes pa ni /
translated: Understanding should be understood as the understanding of what is spoken by others, personal understanding, knowledge, the attainment of peace, and the manifestation of supreme qualities.

original: gzhan gyi sgra'i rgyu las byung ba'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra'i rgyu las byung ba'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: The understanding of what is spoken by others is the understanding that arises from the cause of the words of others, and it is associated with proper attention.

original: so so rang gis shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: so so rang gis shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: Personal understanding is supramundane.

original: rnam par shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is the attainment subsequent to the supramundane.

original: zhi ba @243b thob par byed pa'i phyir shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam la nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhi ba @243b thob par byed pa'i phyir shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam la nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gyur ba'o //
translated: The attainment of peace is the understanding that is the antidote to the defilements on the path of meditation.üîΩThe manifestation of supreme qualities is the understanding that is the cause of the manifestation of the special qualities of the Buddha, such as the powers.

original: yon tan mchog tu phyin par bya ba'i phyir shes pa na yon tan khyad par can mngon par bsgrub pa'i shes rab tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan mchog tu phyin par bya ba'i phyir shes pa na yon tan khyad par can mngon par bsgrub pa'i shes rab tu rig par bya'o //
translated: and in order to perfect the supreme virtues, it is the wisdom which accomplishes the special virtues when they are known.

original: bsgom pa rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five kinds of meditation:

original: phung po la gnas pa dang / yid la byed pa la gnas pa dang ; bsam pa la gnas pa dang / thabs la gnas pa dang / dbang 'byor ba la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: phung po la gnas pa dang / yid la byed pa la gnas pa dang ; bsam pa la gnas pa dang / thabs la gnas pa dang / dbang 'byor ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: meditation based on the aggregates, based on mental attention, based on aspiration, based on means, and based on mastery.

original: de la phung po la gnas pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la phung po la gnas pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Meditation based on the aggregates is fourfold:

original: de la rgyu la gnas pa ni gang rigs kyi stobs kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la nan tan gyis goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu la gnas pa ni gang rigs kyi stobs kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la nan tan gyis goms par byed pa'o //
translated: Meditation based on the cause is that which is cultivated by the power of lineage through the practice of the perfections.

original: rnam par smin pa la gnas pa ni gang lus phun sum tshogs pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la gnas pa ni gang lus phun sum tshogs pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: Meditation based on maturation is that which is cultivated by the power of a perfect body.

original: smon lam la gnas pa ni gang sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis so //
analyzed: smon lam la gnas pa ni gang sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis so //
translated: Meditation based on aspiration is that which is cultivated by the power of former vows.

original: so sor brtags pa'i stobs la gnas pa ni shes rab kyi stobs kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la nan tan gyis goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i stobs la gnas pa ni shes rab kyi stobs kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la nan tan gyis goms par byed pa'o //
translated: Abiding in the power of discernment is the repeated practice of the perfections through the power of wisdom.

original: yid la byed pa la gnas pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa la gnas pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Abiding in attention is the fourfold cultivation of the perfections.

original: mos pa yid la byed pa bsgom pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa na pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i mdo sde la mos pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa yid la byed pa bsgom pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa na pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i mdo sde la mos pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: Cultivation of attention to faith is the cultivation of faith in the sutra collection of all the perfections when one cultivates the perfections.

original: ro myong ba'i yid la byed pa la bsgom pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa rnams la phan yon ma mthong ba'i tshul gyis ro myong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ro myong ba'i yid la byed pa la bsgom pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa rnams la phan yon ma mthong ba'i tshul gyis ro myong bar byed pa'o //
translated: Cultivation of attention to relish is the relishing of the perfections already attained through the method of not seeing their benefits.

original: rjes su yi rang ba'i yid la byed pa bsgom pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'i yid la byed pa bsgom pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang ba'o //
translated: Cultivation of attention to rejoicing is rejoicing in all the world systems in generosity and so on.

original: mngon par dga' ba'i yid la byed pa bsgom pa ni bdag dang sems can rnams kyi bsgom pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par la mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba'i yid la byed pa bsgom pa ni bdag dang sems can rnams kyi bsgom pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par la mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: The meditation of mental attention that is full of joy is the joy in the distinction of the perfection of meditation for oneself and for all beings.

original: bsam ba gnas pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: bsam ba gnas pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The thought of stability is the sixfold meditation on the perfections.

original: mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa dang / yangs pa'i bsam pa dang / dga' ba'i bsam pa dang / phan 'dogs pa'i bsam pa dang / ma gos pa'i bsam pa dang / dge ba'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa dang / yangs pa'i bsam pa dang / dga' ba'i bsam pa dang / phan 'dogs pa'i bsam pa dang / ma gos pa'i bsam pa dang / dge ba'i bsam pa'o //
translated: It is the thought of inexhaustibility, the thought of vastness, the thought of joy, the thought of service, the thought of non-defilement, and the thought of virtue.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa ni /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa ni /
translated: The bodhisattva's thought of inexhaustibility in generosity isüîΩthat a bodhisattva gives to each being, for an eon, the gifts of the trichiliocosm filled with the seven jewels, and his own body, as many times as there are grains of sand and dust in the Ganges river.üîΩThe thought of vastness is

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' skad cig la gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang ba dang / lus gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed sems can gcig la gcig sbyin par byed ce'o //
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' skad cig la gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang ba dang / lus gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed sems can gcig la gcig sbyin par byed ce'o //
translated: that a bodhisattva gives to each being, for an eon, the gifts of the trichiliocosm filled with the seven jewels, and his own body, as many times as there are grains of sand and dust in the Ganges river.

original: de bzhin du skad cig re re la gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi bskal par sbyin par byed @244a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du skad cig re re la gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi bskal par sbyin par byed @244a * //
translated: In the same way, they give for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river in every single instant,

original: cing sems can gcig la ji lta ba de bzhin du sems can gyi khams ji snyad pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yongs su smin par byed la /
analyzed: cing sems can gcig la ji lta ba de bzhin du sems can gyi khams ji snyad pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yongs su smin par byed la /
translated: and just as they do for one being, they do the same for the entire realm of beings, bringing them to complete maturity in unsurpassed, supreme enlightenment.

original: rnam grangs 'dis de la byin yang mi ngoms pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs 'dis de la byin yang mi ngoms pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa ste /
translated: In this way, even though they give to them, they are never satisfied. This is the bodhisattvas' insatiable attitude with regard to generosity.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni sbyin pa la byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa mi ngoms pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni sbyin pa la byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa mi ngoms pa yin no //
translated: This kind of attitude is the bodhisattvas' insatiable attitude with regard to generosity.

original: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa'i bar du byang chub sems dpa' rnams de lta bur sbyin pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa skad cig tsam yang nyams par mi byed cing rgyun mi gcod do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa'i bar du byang chub sems dpa' rnams de lta bur sbyin pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa skad cig tsam yang nyams par mi byed cing rgyun mi gcod do //
translated: Until they are seated at the site of awakening, the bodhisattvas never fail to give in this way, one after another, not even for a single instant, and they never interrupt this process.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa 'di ni sbyin pa la byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa 'di ni sbyin pa la byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: This kind of thought is the bodhisattva's thought of generosity.

original: de ltar sbyin pas sems can de dag rjes su 'dzin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni shin tu dga' ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pas sems can de dag rjes su 'dzin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni shin tu dga' ba yin gyi /
translated: The bodhisattva who cares for sentient beings in this way through generosity is very happy.

original: sbyin pa des rjes su bzung ba'i sems can de dag ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa des rjes su bzung ba'i sems can de dag ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But those sentient beings who are cared for by that generosity are not like that.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pas de ni sbyin pa la byang chub sems dpa'i dga' ba'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pas de ni sbyin pa la byang chub sems dpa'i dga' ba'i bsam pa'o //
translated: This kind of thought is the bodhisattva's thought of joy in generosity.

original: gang dag la de ltar sbyin pas phan 'dogs pa'i sems can de dag ni bdag la shin tu phan 'dogs par byang chub sems dpa' mthong gi bdag gis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dag la de ltar sbyin pas phan 'dogs pa'i sems can de dag ni bdag la shin tu phan 'dogs par byang chub sems dpa' mthong gi bdag gis ni ma yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva sees those sentient beings whom he benefits through generosity as providing a great benefit to him, not the other way around.

original: de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they show him unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni sbyin pa la byang chub sems dpa'i phan 'dogs pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni sbyin pa la byang chub sems dpa'i phan 'dogs pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: Whatever this kind of thought is, it is the bodhisattva's helpful thought in regard to generosity.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams de ltar sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams spangs pa mngon par 'du byas kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams de ltar sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams spangs pa mngon par 'du byas kyang /
translated: The bodhisattva, although he has thus created the merit that arises from generosity for the sake of sentient beings,

original: lan du phan 'dogs pa'am rnam par smin pa'i phan 'dogs pa med de /
analyzed: lan du phan 'dogs pa'am rnam par smin pa'i phan 'dogs pa med de /
translated: does not expect any help in return or any helpful karmic maturation.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa 'ba' zhig yin pa de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la byang chub sems dpa'i gos pa med pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa 'ba' zhig yin pa de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la byang chub sems dpa'i gos pa med pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: Whatever this kind of thought is, it is the bodhisattva's unattached thought in regard to the cultivation of the perfection of generosity.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i phung po spangs pa'i rnam par smin pa de lta bu yang sems can rnams kyi yin par dga' bar byed cing bdag la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i phung po spangs pa'i rnam par smin pa de lta bu yang sems can rnams kyi yin par dga' bar byed cing bdag la ni ma yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva dedicates the karmic maturation of the mass of generosity to sentient beings, and not to himself.

original: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te bla na med pa yang dag bar rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bo'i //üîΩrnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsgom pa la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te bla na med pa yang dag bar rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bo'i // rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsgom pa la /
translated: Having made it common to all sentient beings, he dedicates it to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The thought that is of this kind is the virtuous thought of a bodhisattva in the cultivation of the perfection of generosity.

original: nge la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab @244b kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsgom pa'i bar la byang chub sems dpa'i mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa ni /
analyzed: nge la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab @244b kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsgom pa'i bar la byang chub sems dpa'i mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa ni /
translated: The insatiable thought of a bodhisattva in the cultivation of the perfection of morality up to the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is as follows:

original: gang byang chub sems dpa'i lus gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du gyur cing /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa'i lus gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du gyur cing /
translated: A bodhisattva may have a body equal to the number of grains of sand in the Ganges river,

original: tshe'i tshad bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du gyur la /
analyzed: tshe'i tshad bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du gyur la /
translated: and may have a lifespan equal to the number of grains of sand in the Ganges river,

original: rgyun du yo byad thams cad kyis phongs par gyur cing stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mes rab tu gang ba na /
analyzed: rgyun du yo byad thams cad kyis phongs par gyur cing stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mes rab tu gang ba na /
translated: and may always lack all requisites, and may be in the great trichiliocosm world system filled with fire,

original: spyod lam bzhi byed kyang skad cig gcig la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas /
analyzed: spyod lam bzhi byed kyang skad cig gcig la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas /
translated: Even though they engage in the four types of activity, in a single instant they cultivate the transcendent perfection of discipline,

original: skad cig gcig la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom zhing /
analyzed: skad cig gcig la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom zhing /
translated: and in a single instant they cultivate the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam grangs 'dis tshul khrims kyi phung po ji snyed pa dang / shes rab kyi phung po ji snyed pa gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung pos bsdus pa dang /
analyzed: rnam grangs 'dis tshul khrims kyi phung po ji snyed pa dang / shes rab kyi phung po ji snyed pa gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung pos bsdus pa dang /
translated: By this enumeration, they cultivate the entire aggregate of discipline and the entire aggregate of wisdom, which are included in the aggregate of discipline and the aggregate of wisdom of those who fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: shes rab kyi phung po de bsgom yang byang chub sems dpa'i mi ngoms pa nyid ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa yin pa nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi phung po de bsgom yang byang chub sems dpa'i mi ngoms pa nyid ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa yin pa nas /
translated: The bodhisattvas' dissatisfaction with that is the attitude of dissatisfaction with the cultivation of the transcendent perfection of discipline,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pa la mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pa la mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa ste /
translated: and so on up to the attitude of dissatisfaction with the cultivation of the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bar yin pa 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pa la mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa'oüîΩ/ byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa nyams
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bar yin pa 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pa la mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa'o / byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa nyams
translated: The bodhisattvas' attitude of never being satisfied with their cultivation of the transcendent perfections from generosity to wisdom is the vast attitude.üîΩThe bodhisattvas' attitude of never letting the continuity of their cultivation of the transcendent perfections from generosity to wisdom be interrupted until they are seated at the site of enlightenment is the attitude of never weakening the continuity of their cultivation of the transcendent perfections from generosity to wisdom.

original: par mi byed cing rgyun mi gcod pa'i bsam pa rnam pa 'di lta bu gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pa byang chub sems dpa'i yangs pa'i bsam pa'o
analyzed: par mi byed cing rgyun mi gcod pa'i bsam pa rnam pa 'di lta bu gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pa byang chub sems dpa'i yangs pa'i bsam pa'o
translated: This kind of attitude is the bodhisattvas' vast attitude in their cultivation of the transcendent perfections from generosity to wisdom.

original: // tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
analyzed: // tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
translated: The perfection of moralityüîΩ

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pa des sems can rjes su 'dzin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la rab tu dga' ba yin gyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pa des sems can rjes su 'dzin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la rab tu dga' ba yin gyi /
translated: The bodhisattva who cares for sentient beings through the practice of the perfection of generosity up to the perfection of wisdom is delighted.

original: rjes su bzung ba'i sems can de dag ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su bzung ba'i sems can de dag ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But the sentient beings who are cared for are not like that.

original: rnam pa de ltar bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pa la byang chub sems dpa'i dga' ba'i bsam pa'o//üîΩ@245a * // tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
analyzed: rnam pa de ltar bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pa la byang chub sems dpa'i dga' ba'i bsam pa'o// @245a * // tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
translated: The thought that is such a thought is the bodhisattva's thought of delight in the practice of the perfection of generosity up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pas gang bdag la phan 'dogs pa'i sems can de ni bdag la shin tu phan 'dogs par byang chub sems dpas mthong gi bdag gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pas gang bdag la phan 'dogs pa'i sems can de ni bdag la shin tu phan 'dogs par byang chub sems dpas mthong gi bdag gis ni ma yin no //
translated: Through the practice of the perfection of generosity up to the perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattva sees that sentient being who benefits him or herself as benefiting him or her greatly, but not the bodhisattva who benefits others.

original: de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ston pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
analyzed: de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ston pa'i phyir ro // rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
translated: Because they teach unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyir pa'i bar tu bsgom pa la byang chub sems dpa'i phan 'dogs pa'i bsam pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyir pa'i bar tu bsgom pa la byang chub sems dpa'i phan 'dogs pa'i bsam pa'o /
translated: This kind of thought is the bodhisattva‚Äôs helpful thought in cultivating the perfection of morality,üîΩand in cultivating the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ni de ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu dpa'i ni de ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du byung ba'i bsod nams yangs pa mngon par 'du byas kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ni de ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu dpa'i ni de ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du byung ba'i bsod nams yangs pa mngon par 'du byas kyang /
translated: The bodhisattva, having thus created vast merit from the perfection of morality up to the perfection of wisdom,

original: de la lan du phan 'dogs pa'am rnam par smin pa 'dod pa med de /
analyzed: de la lan du phan 'dogs pa'am rnam par smin pa 'dod pa med de /
translated: does not want to be repaid or to have a karmic reward.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
translated: This kind of thought is the bodhisattva‚Äôs helpful thought in cultivating the perfection of morality,üîΩand in cultivating the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pa la byang chub sems dpa'i gos pa med pa'i bsam pa'o //üîΩde la byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa las byung ba nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pa la byang chub sems dpa'i gos pa med pa'i bsam pa'o // de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa las byung ba nas /
translated: The bodhisattva's unattached intention is to meditate on the perfections from generosity up to wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams kyi phung po rnam par smin pa de lta bu yang sems can rnams kyi yin par mngon par dga' bar byed kyi bdag la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams kyi phung po rnam par smin pa de lta bu yang sems can rnams kyi yin par mngon par dga' bar byed kyi bdag la ni ma yin no //
translated: Therein, the bodhisattva's merit-aggregate that arises from cultivating the perfection of morality up to the perfection of wisdom, and the maturation of that merit-aggregate, he delights in that for sentient beings, not for himself.

original: sems can thams cad dang / thun mong du byas nas /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang / thun mong du byas nas /
translated: Having made it common to all sentient beings,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //üîΩrnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o // rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
translated: he dedicates it to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pas /
translated: This kind of intention is the bodhisattva's unattached intention in cultivating the perfection of morality up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bsam pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva's virtuous intention.

original: thabs la gnas pa'i pha rol phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: thabs la gnas pa'i pha rol phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the perfection of the abode of means?

original: rnam par gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam par gsum ste /
translated: It is threefold:üîΩThe perfection of the abode of means is threefold: the perfection of the abode of means in regard to the three spheres, the perfection of the abode of means in regard to the accomplishment of all kinds of attention, and the perfection of the abode of means in regard to the accomplishment of the two aims.

original: so sor rtog pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The perfection of the abode of means in regard to the three spheres is the purity of the three spheres through the nondiscriminating intuition, because of the thorough analysis.üîΩThat means is the accomplishment of all kinds of attention.

original: thabs de ni yid la byed pa thams cad mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdbang 'byor ba la gnas te /
analyzed: thabs de ni yid la byed pa thams cad mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro // dbang 'byor ba la gnas te /
translated: The perfection of the abode of means in regard to the accomplishment of the two aims is the accomplishment of the aims of both oneself and others through the four epitomes of the Dharma.üîΩThe perfection of the abode of means in regard to the accomplishment of the two aims is the accomplishment of the aims of both oneself and others through the four epitomes of the Dharma.üîΩThe perfection of the abode of means in regard to the accomplishment of all kinds of attention is the accomplishment of all kinds of attention through the four kinds of thorough understanding.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni rnams pa gsum ste /üîΩlus la dbang 'byor pa dang / spyod pa la dbang 'byor ba dang / bshad pa la dbang 'byor ba'o /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni rnams pa gsum ste / lus la dbang 'byor pa dang / spyod pa la dbang 'byor ba dang / bshad pa la dbang 'byor ba'o /
translated: The perfection of the abode of means in regard to the three spheres is the purity of the three spheres through the nondiscriminating intuition, because of the thorough analysis.

original: lus la dbang 'byor ba ni /üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: lus la dbang 'byor ba ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
translated: That means is the accomplishment of all kinds of attention.

original: @245b rang bzhin dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: @245b rang bzhin dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the abode of means in regard to the accomplishment of the two aims is the accomplishment of the aims of both oneself and others through the four epitomes of the Dharma.üîΩThe perfection of the abode of means in regard to the accomplishment of all kinds of attention is the accomplishment of all kinds of attention through the four kinds of thorough understanding.üîΩThe perfection of the abode of means in regard to the three spheres is the purity of the three spheres through the nondiscriminating intuition, because of the thorough analysis.

original: de la spyod pa la dbang 'byor pa ni /
analyzed: de la spyod pa la dbang 'byor pa ni /
translated: That means is the accomplishment of all kinds of attention.üîΩThe perfection of the abode of means in regard to the accomplishment of the two aims is the accomplishment of the aims of both oneself and others through the four epitomes of the Dharma.

original: sprul pa'i skur blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i skur blta bar bya'o //
translated: The perfection of the abode of means in regard to the accomplishment of all kinds of attention is the accomplishment of all kinds of attention through the four kinds of thorough understanding.

original: des sems can thams cad la 'byor ba dang / mthun par rnam pa thams cad kun du chos ston to //
analyzed: des sems can thams cad la 'byor ba dang / mthun par rnam pa thams cad kun du chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma in all ways to all sentient beings, in a manner that is appropriate and effective.

original: bshad pa la dbang 'byor ba ni /
analyzed: bshad pa la dbang 'byor ba ni /
translated: Mastery of explanation is

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnam pa thams cad du bshad pa la thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnam pa thams cad du bshad pa la thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: the absence of any impediment to explaining the six perfections in all their aspects.

original: rab tu dbye ba ni rten pa bcom brgyad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug rab tu dbye bar blta'o //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba ni rten pa bcom brgyad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug rab tu dbye bar blta'o //
translated: The classification of the perfections should be understood as the classification of the six perfections in terms of the eighteen foundations.

original: rton pa bco brgyad ni /
analyzed: rton pa bco brgyad ni /
translated: The eighteen foundations are

original: lus rton pa dang / sems rton pa dang / dge ba rton pa dang / bde 'gro la rton pa dang / byang chub rton pa dang / snying rje rton pa dang / sems can yongs su mi gtong ba rton pa dang / dman pa'i sems yongs su 'dor ba rton pa dang /
analyzed: lus rton pa dang / sems rton pa dang / dge ba rton pa dang / bde 'gro la rton pa dang / byang chub rton pa dang / snying rje rton pa dang / sems can yongs su mi gtong ba rton pa dang / dman pa'i sems yongs su 'dor ba rton pa dang /
translated: the body, the mind, virtue, happy rebirth, enlightenment, compassion, not abandoning sentient beings, rejecting the attitude of inferiority, not abandoning the determination to be free, the Great Vehicle, the perfections, the aids to liberation, the aids to the penetrations, the aids to enlightenment, the path of junction, the uninterrupted path, the path of liberation, and the path of distinctive progress.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rton pa dang / dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba rton pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par bsgrub pa rton pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa rton pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su mi skyo ba rton pa dang /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rton pa dang / dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba rton pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par bsgrub pa rton pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa rton pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su mi skyo ba rton pa dang /
translated: roots of virtue that are not discouraged,üîΩthe attainment of all intended goals,üîΩgathering the assemblies,üîΩentering the stages,üîΩaccomplishing the Buddha dharmas,

original: bsam pa'i don thams cad 'byor ba rton pa dang / tshogs sdud pa rton pa dang / sa la 'jug pa rton pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par bsgrub pa rton pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bsgrub pa rton pa dang /
analyzed: bsam pa'i don thams cad 'byor ba rton pa dang / tshogs sdud pa rton pa dang / sa la 'jug pa rton pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par bsgrub pa rton pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bsgrub pa rton pa dang /
translated: accomplishing the deeds of a Buddha,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum gsum tha dad pas gsum gsum gyis go rims bzhin du bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum gsum tha dad pas gsum gsum gyis go rims bzhin du bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: and the three types of generosity, such as generosity, are to be understood as being included in the three each, respectively.

original: de la sbyin pa gsum ni zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa dang chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa gsum ni zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa dang chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
translated: The three types of generosity are: the generosity of material things, the generosity of fearlessness, and the generosity of the Dharma.

original: tshul khrims rnam pa gsum ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam pa gsum ni /
translated: The three types of morality are:

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of restraint, the morality of acquiring virtuous factors, and the morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: bzod pa rnam pa gsum ni gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'o //
