analyzed: bzod pa rnam pa gsum ni gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of patience are: the patience of accepting suffering, the patience of certainty with regard to ultimate reality, and the patience of not being upset by offenses.

original: brtson 'grus rnam pa gsum ni go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rnam pa gsum ni go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: The three kinds of effort are: the armor-like effort, the effort of applying antidotes, and the effort of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: bsam gtan rnam pa gsum ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnam pa gsum ni /
translated: The three kinds of meditation are:

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan no //
translated: the meditation of attaining happiness in this world, the meditation of attaining supernormal powers, and the meditation of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: shes rab rnam pa gsum ni /
analyzed: shes rab rnam pa gsum ni /
translated: The three kinds of wisdom are:

original: kun rdzob la dmigs pa dang / don dam pa la dmigs @246a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob la dmigs pa dang / don dam pa la dmigs @246a * //
translated: the wisdom that focuses on the conventional, the wisdom that focuses on the ultimate, and the wisdom that focuses on both.

original: pa dang ; sems can gyi don la dmigs pa'o //üîΩde la zang zing gi sbyin pa ni /
analyzed: pa dang ; sems can gyi don la dmigs pa'o // de la zang zing gi sbyin pa ni /
translated: and the aim of beings.

original: lus rton pa ste /
analyzed: lus rton pa ste /
translated: Of these, the giving of material things is for the sake of the body.üîΩThe giving of fearlessness is for the sake of the mind.üîΩThe giving of the teaching is for the sake of both.

original: bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i yo byad kyis ni lan pa'i lus la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni sems rton pa ste /
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i yo byad kyis ni lan pa'i lus la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro // mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni sems rton pa ste /
translated: The giving of material things is for the sake of the body, because it benefits the body by providing food, drink, etc.

original: yid mi bde ba'i bye brag dang bral bar bya bar sems kyi dbugs 'byin pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i bye brag dang bral bar bya bar sems kyi dbugs 'byin pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The giving of fearlessness is for the sake of the mind, because it provides relief for the mind by removing the particular forms of mental unhappiness.

original: gzhan la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The giving of the teaching is for the sake of both, because it benefits both the body and the mind.

original: dman pa'i sems ni byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis yongs su skyo bas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems te de yongs su 'dor ba rton pa ste /
analyzed: dman pa'i sems ni byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis yongs su skyo bas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems te de yongs su 'dor ba rton pa ste /
translated: The inferior attitude is the thought of the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha, which is the bodhisattva‚Äôs fear of the suffering of the life cycle.

original: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod par rig par bya'o //
translated: The patience of accepting suffering should be understood as the rejection of that.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don bya bar lhag par byed pas 'khor ba ji srid pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mi gtong ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don bya bar lhag par byed pas 'khor ba ji srid pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mi gtong ba ste /
translated: The inexhaustible root of virtue is the non-abandonment of samsara for as long as it lasts, and the non-abandonment of the realm of nirvana without remainder.

original: de rton pa sems can gyi don bya ba'i brtson 'grus su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de rton pa sems can gyi don bya ba'i brtson 'grus su rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the reliance is the effort to benefit sentient beings.

original: tshogs sdud pa ni thob pa la brten nas gdul bya rnams sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa sems mnyam par gzhag par bya ba dang sems mnyam par bzhag pa rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa rab tu sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: tshogs sdud pa ni thob pa la brten nas gdul bya rnams sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa sems mnyam par gzhag par bya ba dang sems mnyam par bzhag pa rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa rab tu sbyin pa ste /
translated: The gathering of the equipment is the giving of instruction and counsel in order to establish the disciples in meditative concentration who are not yet in meditative concentration, and in order to liberate those who are in meditative concentration.

original: de rton pa ni sems can gyi don byed pa'i bsam gtan no //üîΩsa la 'jug pa ni chos la mos pa sngon du btang ba'i bshad pa gang gis tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: de rton pa ni sems can gyi don byed pa'i bsam gtan no // sa la 'jug pa ni chos la mos pa sngon du btang ba'i bshad pa gang gis tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: It should be understood that the reliance is the meditative concentration that benefits sentient beings.

original: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba la 'jug pa ste /
translated: The entry into the stages is the entry into the first stage, the Joyous, by one who has completed the equipment by means of the explanation preceded by the conviction about the Dharma.

original: de rton pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de rton pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: The reliance on that is the object of the conventional truth.

original: lhag ma ni legs par sbyar ba'i phyir sbyar ba ma byas so //
analyzed: lhag ma ni legs par sbyar ba'i phyir sbyar ba ma byas so //
translated: The rest is not applied because it is well known.

original: yang rab tu dbye ba ni sbyin pa rnam pa bdun te ;
analyzed: yang rab tu dbye ba ni sbyin pa rnam pa bdun te ;
translated: Moreover, the classification of generosity is sevenfold:

original: rtsa ba'i sbyin pa ni /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sbyin pa ni /
translated: 1. Generosity of the root

original: rigs kyi gnas skabs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi gnas skabs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: is the perfection of generosity of the bodhisattva in the stage of lineage,

original: rigs tsam la brten nas sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs tsam la brten nas sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because generosity is based on the mere lineage.üîΩ2. Generosity of taking up

original: blangs pa'i sbyin pa ni sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs pa ste /
analyzed: blangs pa'i sbyin pa ni sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs pa ste /
translated: is in the stage of generating the thought of enlightenment,

original: smon lam yang dag par brten nas sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon lam yang dag par brten nas sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because generosity is based on the perfect aspiration.üîΩ3. Generosity of maintenance

original: rjes su 'dzin pa'i sbyin pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: rjes su 'dzin pa'i sbyin pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: is in the stage of accomplishing the aims of self and other.

original: 'dzin ba ngan pa med pa'i sbyin pa ni /
analyzed: 'dzin ba ngan pa med pa'i sbyin pa ni /
translated: 4. Generosity of the absence of bad grasping

original: de kho na'i don la yongs su rtog pa'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: de kho na'i don la yongs su rtog pa'i gnas skabs te /
translated: is in the stage of thorough investigation of the meaning of reality,üîΩbecause generosity is free from the grasping of the three spheres.

original: sbyin bdag la sogs par rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa'i 'dzin pa ngan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin bdag la sogs par rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa'i 'dzin pa ngan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no bad grasping at the notion of a master, etc.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i sbyin pa ni mthu'i gnas @246b skabs pa'i ste /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i sbyin pa ni mthu'i gnas @246b skabs pa'i ste /
translated: Generosity without possessiveness is for the stage of power,

original: phyi rol gyi yo byad yongs su 'dzin pa med par yang nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyis nam mkha' la lag pa ba rkyang nas ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du rin po che la sogs pa'i char 'bebs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yo byad yongs su 'dzin pa med par yang nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyis nam mkha' la lag pa ba rkyang nas ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du rin po che la sogs pa'i char 'bebs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, without possessiveness for external objects, one rains down whatever jewels, etc., are desired from the sky, by means of the meditative concentration of the sky-treasury, etc.

original: so sor rig pa'i sbyin pa ni yongs su smin pa'i gnas skabs pa'i ste /
analyzed: so sor rig pa'i sbyin pa ni yongs su smin pa'i gnas skabs pa'i ste /
translated: Generosity of awareness is for the stage of evolutionary development,

original: 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du mthun pa'i sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du mthun pa'i sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one gives in accordance with the discipline of the disciples.

original: sbyin pa chen po ni byang chub mchog gi gnas skabs pa'i ste bla na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa chen po ni byang chub mchog gi gnas skabs pa'i ste bla na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great generosity is for the stage of supreme enlightenment, because it is unsurpassed.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du ci rigs su sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du ci rigs su sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the other perfections should be understood in the same way, up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: bsdus pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bsdus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsdus pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bsdus pa'i phyir te /
translated: The concise is included in the giving, etc. of the bodhisattva.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis rigs bsdus pa 'di ni dpe tsam mo //
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis rigs bsdus pa 'di ni dpe tsam mo //
translated: The inclusion of the family by the perfections is merely an example.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa ni rigs kyi rtags kyis bsdus par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa ni rigs kyi rtags kyis bsdus par shes par bya'o //
translated: The family should be understood as included in the signs of the family, by the perfections of giving, etc.

original: sems bskyed pas bsdus pa ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i sems bskyed pas bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pas bsdus pa ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i sems bskyed pas bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: The inclusion by the generation of the thought is to be understood as the inclusion by the generation of the special thought.

original: sems bskyed pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The generation of the thought is twofold:

original: khyad par can ma yin pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par can ma yin pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: non-special and special.

original: de la khyad par can ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: de la khyad par can ma yin pa ni /
translated: The non-special is the thought:

original: kye ma'o // bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par shog shig snyam pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: kye ma'o // bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par shog shig snyam pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOh, may I become a perfect Buddha, unsurpassed and fully enlightened, up to the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i sems bskyed pa 'dis ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bsdus par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i sems bskyed pa 'dis ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bsdus par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that the perfections are included in this especially exalted spirit of enlightenment,

original: de dag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is their cause.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don bsdus pa la /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don bsdus pa la /
translated: The summary of benefit for oneself and others:

original: gang sbyin pas phyug po yongs su 'dzin pa 'di ni bdag gi don te /
analyzed: gang sbyin pas phyug po yongs su 'dzin pa 'di ni bdag gi don te /
translated: The benefit for oneself is that one becomes rich through generosity.

original: gang gzhan la yo byad nye bar bsgrub pas rjes su 'dzin pa 'di ni gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: gang gzhan la yo byad nye bar bsgrub pas rjes su 'dzin pa 'di ni gzhan gyi don to //
translated: The benefit for others is that one helps others by providing them with the necessities of life.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis bsdus pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis bsdus pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The inclusion by the remaining perfections should be understood in the same way.

original: don dam pa bsdus pa chos kyi dbyings las brtsams pa ni /üîΩde bzhin nyid sbyin pa la sogs pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa bsdus pa chos kyi dbyings las brtsams pa ni / de bzhin nyid sbyin pa la sogs pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The summary of the ultimate:üîΩThe ultimate is included in the perfection of wisdom, because the perfection of wisdom is the method for realizing the ultimate.üîΩThe summary of the collection of wisdom:

original: ye shes kyi tshogs las brtsams pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi snod du gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs las brtsams pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi snod du gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The collection of wisdom is included in the perfection of wisdom, because the perfection of wisdom is the method for realizing the ultimate.üîΩThe summary of the beginning, middle, and end of the perfection of wisdom:üîΩThe beginning of the perfection of wisdom is the perfection of generosity, because it is the method for attaining the state of a bodhisattva.

original: ye shes yongs su 'dzin pa las brtsams pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes yongs su 'dzin pa las brtsams pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The chapter on the retention of intuition is the chapter on the retention of intuition, beginning with the retention of intuition, because it is the cause of the retention of intuition.

original: ye shes kyi rjes su 'jug pa las brtsams pa ni lnga po dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //üîΩye shes kyi mtshan nyid las brtsams pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid @247a * //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su 'jug pa las brtsams pa ni lnga po dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro // ye shes kyi mtshan nyid las brtsams pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid @247a * //
translated: The chapter on the practice of intuition is the chapter on the practice of the five, beginning with the practice of intuition, because the five are in accord with the perfection of wisdom.

original: yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The chapter on the characteristics of intuition is the chapter on the characteristics of intuition, beginning with the characteristics of intuition, because the perfection of wisdom is the essence of correct intuition.

original: de ltar na de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid don dam pa ni sbyin pa la sogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid don dam pa ni sbyin pa la sogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the ultimate, which is the essence of reality and correct intuitive wisdom, should be known as generosity and so on.

original: dpe brjod pa 'dis bsdus pa lhag ma rnams kyang brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: dpe brjod pa 'dis bsdus pa lhag ma rnams kyang brtag par bya'o //
translated: The remaining summaries should be understood by way of this example.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ser sna dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / khro ba dang ; li lo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / 'chal pa'i shes rab ste sbyin pa la sogs pa dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ser sna dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / khro ba dang ; li lo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / 'chal pa'i shes rab ste sbyin pa la sogs pa dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: The adverse factors are stinginess, immorality, anger, laziness, distraction, and stupidity, in order, in relation to generosity, etc.

original: yang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis bsdus pa'i dge ba'i chos ji snyed pa de dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang yin pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa gang yin pa de yang de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis bsdus pa'i dge ba'i chos ji snyed pa de dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang yin pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa gang yin pa de yang de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, all the virtuous factors included in the perfections are adverse factors in relation to the obscurations of the knowable.

original: phan yon ni 'bras bu rnam pa lnga'i rjes su 'brangs pas dpag tu med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phan yon ni 'bras bu rnam pa lnga'i rjes su 'brangs pas dpag tu med par rig par bya'o //
translated: The benefits should be known as immeasurable, in accordance with the five kinds of results.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: ji ltar 'di dag gi rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba bral ba'i 'bras bu dang mthong ba'i chos la bdag dang gzhan rjes su 'dzin pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di dag gi rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba bral ba'i 'bras bu dang mthong ba'i chos la bdag dang gzhan rjes su 'dzin pa /
translated: The result of freedom is the abandonment of their adverse qualities. The result in the present life is the support of self and others.

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / phyi ma la gong nas gong du khyad par du 'phags pa mchog dam pa 'byung ba'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / byang chub chen po dbang gi 'bras bu dang / longs spyod chen po dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / phyi ma la gong nas gong du khyad par du 'phags pa mchog dam pa 'byung ba'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / byang chub chen po dbang gi 'bras bu dang / longs spyod chen po dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba dang /
translated: The dominant result is the arising of the special, excellent, superior result in the future, which is the result that resembles the cause. The result of human effort is the great enlightenment. The result of separation is the great enjoyment and the going to good destinies.

original: 'khon med pa dang / dbye ba med pa dang / bde ba dang yid bde ba mang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang / lus la gnod pa med pa dang / dbang che bar grags pa ni go rims bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khon med pa dang / dbye ba med pa dang / bde ba dang yid bde ba mang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang / lus la gnod pa med pa dang / dbang che bar grags pa ni go rims bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bur rig par bya'o //
translated: The result of natural outcome is the absence of enemies, the absence of disharmony, the abundance of happiness and joy, the mastery of mind, the absence of physical harm, and the great fame. These should be known respectively as the results of maturation of generosity and so on.

original: gcig la gcig rnam par nges pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gcig la gcig rnam par nges pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The certainty of the order of the perfections is threefold.

original: sbyor ba las gyur ba dang / rab tu dbye ba las gyur pa dang / rab tu phye nas bstan pa las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba las gyur ba dang / rab tu dbye ba las gyur pa dang / rab tu phye nas bstan pa las gyur pa'o //
translated: It is based on preparation, based on classification, and based on teaching the classifications.

original: de la sbyor ba las gyur pa ni sbyin pa la sbyor bas thams cad 'dus par dmigs te /üîΩ'di lta ste /üîΩnang dang phyi'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba las gyur pa ni sbyin pa la sbyor bas thams cad 'dus par dmigs te / 'di lta ste / nang dang phyi'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application aspect is the observation of the inclusion of all in the application to generosity.üîΩIt is as follows.üîΩThe application to generosity in giving up inner and outer things.üîΩ

original: de la gang yongs su btang ba de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang yongs su btang ba de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of generosity is the giving of everything that is internal and external.

original: de la byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i gang gzhan la kun nas mnar sems dang ; gnod pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba sdom pa de ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //üîΩde nyid la gang nye bar bskor ba dang / 'phongs pa dang / skyo ba la ji mi snyam pa ste /üîΩde ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i gang gzhan la kun nas mnar sems dang ; gnod pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba sdom pa de ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o // de nyid la gang nye bar bskor ba dang / 'phongs pa dang / skyo ba la ji mi snyam pa ste / de ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of morality is the restraint of malice, harmfulness, and violence toward others.

original: de nyid la gang phyir zhing phyir sems spro ba de ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la gang phyir zhing phyir sems spro ba de ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of patience is the forbearance of the fatigue of giving away everything.üîΩThe perfection of effort is the delight in giving again and again.

original: de @247b nyid la gang sems rtse gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: de @247b nyid la gang sems rtse gcig pa nyid de /
translated: The perfection of meditation is the one-pointedness of mind.

original: dge ba las phyi rol tu mi 'phro ba de ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba las phyi rol tu mi 'phro ba de ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of meditative concentration is the non-diffusion of the mind externally from virtue.

original: de nyid la rgyu dang 'bras bu ji lta ba bzhin du legs par gzung ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa de ni zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la yang ci rigs su sbyar bar ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu dang 'bras bu ji lta ba bzhin du legs par gzung ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa de ni zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la yang ci rigs su sbyar bar ba ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the correct apprehension of cause and effect in just that virtue, and the absence of the overesteeming of (such things as) morality and spiritual practices.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni thams cad du yang sbyin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni thams cad du yang sbyin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The giving of fearlessness is giving in all cases.

original: de la rab tu dbye ba las gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de la rab tu dbye ba las gyur pa ni /
translated: In this regard, the analysis is as follows:

original: ngo bo nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / rjes su byed pas rab tu dbye ba dang / rjes su sbyor bas rab tu dbye ba dang / skyed pas rab tu dbye ba'o /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / rjes su byed pas rab tu dbye ba dang / rjes su sbyor bas rab tu dbye ba dang / skyed pas rab tu dbye ba'o /
translated: The analysis of the nature, the analysis of the conformity, the analysis of the application, and the analysis of the generation.

original: skyed pas rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: skyed pas rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: The analysis of the generation.

original: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni /
translated: The nature of giving, etc. is as follows:

original: rnam par gtong ba dang / sngom pa dang ; ji mi snyam pa dang / bsod par spro ba dang / sems gnas pa dang rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par gtong ba dang / sngom pa dang ; ji mi snyam pa dang / bsod par spro ba dang / sems gnas pa dang rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: 1) giving, 2) vow, 3) indifference, 4) delight in the good, 5) mental stability, and 6) full discernment, respectively.

original: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rjes su byed pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba ni de las gzhan ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la rjes su 'jug pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rjes su byed pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba ni de las gzhan ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la rjes su 'jug pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Therein, the performance of giving, etc. is the application of giving, etc. to the other perfections, as before.

original: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rjes su sbyor ba ni 'dzin du bcug pa dang bsngags pa brjod pa dang rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rjes su sbyor ba ni 'dzin du bcug pa dang bsngags pa brjod pa dang rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: Therein, the performance of giving, etc. is the encouragement to take up, the expression of praise, and the delight in giving, etc.

original: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa skyes pa ni gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa skyes pa ni gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la 'jog pa'o //
translated: Therein, the generation of giving, etc. is the establishment of giving, etc. in the mental continuum of another.

original: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni zang zing gi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni zang zing gi sbyin pa'o //
translated: Therein, the perfection of giving is the giving of material things.

original: de ma yin pa gzhan lnga ni mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de ma yin pa gzhan lnga ni mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: The other five are the giving of fearlessness.

original: thams cad ni dam pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad ni dam pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa ste /
translated: All are the giving of the holy Dharma.

original: gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is generated in the mental continuum of another.

original: de la rab tu phye nas bstan pa las gyur pa ni gcig nas rtogs pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la rab tu phye nas bstan pa las gyur pa ni gcig nas rtogs pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The first is the one that is taught in a detailed analysis:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'ang de yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'ang de yin nam zhe na /
translated: is the perfection of generosity the same as the perfection of generosity?

original: tshig 'og ma dang sbyang pa ste /
analyzed: tshig 'og ma dang sbyang pa ste /
translated: The answer is:

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phrin pa gang yin pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phrin pa 'ang de'o /üîΩspyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa'ang yong de /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phrin pa gang yin pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phrin pa 'ang de'o / spyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa'ang yong de /
translated: The perfection of morality is the perfection of generosity.üîΩThe perfection of generosity is not the perfection of morality.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phrin bsam zin pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phrin bsam zin pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of generosity is the perfection of morality that is not the perfection of generosity.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ma zin bar du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhes pa ltar tshig 'og ma rnam dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ma zin bar du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhes pa ltar tshig 'og ma rnam dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the perfection of generosity is not the perfection of wisdom up to the perfection of generosity is the perfection of wisdom that is not the perfection of generosity.üîΩThe second is the one that is taught in a brief analysis:

original: sbyin pa gang yin pa de thams cad sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin nam /üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de thams cad @248a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa gang yin pa de thams cad sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin nam / pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de thams cad @248a * //
translated: Is every generosity a perfection of generosity?

original: sbyin pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sbyin pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Or is every perfection a generosity?

original: mu gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: mu gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: There are three possibilities:

original: sbyin pa yin pa pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa ni gang byang chub chen por yongs su ma bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa yin pa pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa ni gang byang chub chen por yongs su ma bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: Generosity that is not a perfection is generosity not dedicated to great enlightenment.

original: sbyin pa yang yin la pha rol tu phyin pa yang yin pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: sbyin pa yang yin la pha rol tu phyin pa yang yin pa'ang yod de /
translated: There is generosity that is a perfection,

original: byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: generosity dedicated to great enlightenment.üîΩThere is that which is neither generosity nor a perfection,

original: sbyin pa yang ma yin la pha rol tu phyin pa yang ma yin pa yang yod de bshad pa ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: sbyin pa yang ma yin la pha rol tu phyin pa yang ma yin pa yang yod de bshad pa ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: all phenomena except those mentioned above.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar las brtsams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar las brtsams te /
translated: Similarly, beginning with the perfection of wisdom,

original: re re la yang mu gsum du sbyar bar ba'o //
analyzed: re re la yang mu gsum du sbyar bar ba'o //
translated: each is to be applied in three possibilities.

original: sbyin pa la kun du spod pa gang yin pa de thams cad sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i bsod nams bskyed dam zhe na /
analyzed: sbyin pa la kun du spod pa gang yin pa de thams cad sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i bsod nams bskyed dam zhe na /
translated: Is all that is a relish for generosity generated as merit that arises from the cause of the perfection of generosity?

original: mu bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: mu bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: There are four possibilities.

original: mu dang po ni byang chub chen por yongs su ma bsngos pa'i sbyin pa sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: mu dang po ni byang chub chen por yongs su ma bsngos pa'i sbyin pa sbyor ba'o //
translated: The first possibility is the practice of generosity not dedicated to great enlightenment.

original: mu gnyis pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du bcug nas bsngags pa brjod pa dang yid rab tu dga' bas so //
analyzed: mu gnyis pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du bcug nas bsngags pa brjod pa dang yid rab tu dga' bas so //
translated: The second is the praise of generosity after having caused the perfection of generosity to be taken up, with a delighted mind.

original: mu gsum pa ni byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pas so //
analyzed: mu gsum pa ni byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pas so //
translated: The third is the practice of generosity dedicated to great enlightenment.

original: mu bzhi ba ni 'di dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mu bzhi ba ni 'di dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the exclusion of these.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The same is true of the other perfections up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: ci'i phyir shin tu rgyas pa la rgya che ba dang zab par yang bstan ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir shin tu rgyas pa la rgya che ba dang zab par yang bstan ce na /
translated: Why is the extensive taught as both extensive and profound in the Vaipulya?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rgya che ba dang zab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rgya che ba dang zab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the knowledge of all aspects is extensive and profound.

original: khyad par du shin tu rgyas pa la rgya che ba dang zab par yang bstan pa ni de'i 'bras bu thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mchog tu rgya che ba dang zab pa'i phyir 'bras bu dang mthun pa'i rgyur blta bar bya'o //üîΩci'i phyir shin tu rgyas pa la /
analyzed: khyad par du shin tu rgyas pa la rgya che ba dang zab par yang bstan pa ni de'i 'bras bu thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mchog tu rgya che ba dang zab pa'i phyir 'bras bu dang mthun pa'i rgyur blta bar bya'o // ci'i phyir shin tu rgyas pa la /
translated: In particular, the teaching of the extensive and the profound in the extensive class should be seen as a cause consistent with its result, because its result, omniscience, is supremely extensive and profound.üîΩWhy is it that some beings,

original: sems can kha cig rgya che ba dang / zab pa la mi mos shing skrag par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can kha cig rgya che ba dang / zab pa la mi mos shing skrag par 'gyur /
translated: lacking faith in the extensive and profound, are frightened by them?

original: chos nyid dang bral ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid dang bral ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: don la sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen par 'gyur te /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

translated: the view that eliminates the practice, the view that does not lead to deliverance, the view that obscures, the view that increases demerit, the view that is fruitless, the view that is cut off,

original: de la theg pa chen po la chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa la sogs pa'i sgra dmigs nas dgongs pa de la mi mkhas pa dag 'di'i don @249a * //

translated: the view of contempt and the view of complete hostility.üîΩFollowing their own views, they think, ‚Äúemptiness, signlessness, and

translated: The intended meaning of this verse is as follows:

original: rnam par mi g-yeng ba la ga dag snying por blo 'byung ba dang / mchog tu blo 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi g-yeng ba la ga dag snying por blo 'byung ba dang / mchog tu blo 'byung ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattva's mind is absorbed in and devoted to nondistraction, and it is absorbed in and devoted to the highest.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba ni sems rnam par 'phyo ba'o //üîΩphyin ci log la shin tu gnas //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba ni sems rnam par 'phyo ba'o // phyin ci log la shin tu gnas //
translated: Distraction is the scattering of the mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba dang / bdag las bzlog ste mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i phyir phyin ci log la shin tu gnas pa yongs su mi nyams pa'i phyir ro //üîΩnyon mongs kun nas rab nyon mongs //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba dang / bdag las bzlog ste mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i phyir phyin ci log la shin tu gnas pa yongs su mi nyams pa'i phyir ro // nyon mongs kun nas rab nyon mongs //
translated: He is well established in error because he is well established in the opposite of permanence, happiness, purity, and self, that is, in impermanence, etc. He is not subject to loss because he is not subject to loss of his superior attitude.

original: zhes bya ba ni yun ring por dka' ba byed pa'i rtsol bas shin tu yongs su nyon mongs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yun ring por dka' ba byed pa'i rtsol bas shin tu yongs su nyon mongs par gyur pa'o //
translated: He is thoroughly afflicted by the afflictions because he is thoroughly afflicted by the long-term effort of his austerities.

original: shin tu rgyas pa la byang chub sems dpa' chos la ting nge 'dzin du mkhas par ji ltar khong du chud par bya /
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa la byang chub sems dpa' chos la ting nge 'dzin du mkhas par ji ltar khong du chud par bya /
translated: How should the bodhisattva understand the Dharma as meditative absorption in the extensive version of the perfection of wisdom?

original: rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: In five ways:

original: skad cig re re la gnas ngan len gyi gnas thams cad 'jig par byed pa dang / sna tshogs kyi 'du shes dang bral te chos kyi dga' ba la dga' ba thob pa dang / chos kyi snang ba rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa thams cad du tshad med pa yang dag par shes pa dang /
analyzed: skad cig re re la gnas ngan len gyi gnas thams cad 'jig par byed pa dang / sna tshogs kyi 'du shes dang bral te chos kyi dga' ba la dga' ba thob pa dang / chos kyi snang ba rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa thams cad du tshad med pa yang dag par shes pa dang /
translated: In each instant, it destroys all the bases of the negative tendencies. It is free from the perception of multiplicity and attains the joy of Dharma. It is the perfect knowledge of the boundless, uninterrupted light of Dharma in all ways.

original: de la rnam par dag pa'i chi dang mthun pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan ma rnams kun tu 'byung ba dang / chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / yongs su sgrub pa'i phyir gong ma bas kyang ches gong ma'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par dag pa'i chi dang mthun pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan ma rnams kun tu 'byung ba dang / chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / yongs su sgrub pa'i phyir gong ma bas kyang ches gong ma'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: The signs of the absence of discrimination that are in harmony with purity arise in it. It takes up causes that are higher and higher in order to complete and accomplish the Dharma body.

original: phan yon rnam pa lnga po de rnams kyi phan yon ni zhi gnas kyi phan yon dang / lhag mthong gi phan yon dang / de gnyi ga'i phan yon gyi dbang du byas bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phan yon rnam pa lnga po de rnams kyi phan yon ni zhi gnas kyi phan yon dang / lhag mthong gi phan yon dang / de gnyi ga'i phan yon gyi dbang du byas bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The benefits of these five benefits should be understood as the benefits of serenity, the benefits of insight, and the benefits of both of them.

original: de la zhi gnas kyi phan yon ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la zhi gnas kyi phan yon ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The benefits of serenity are also of two kinds.

original: skad cig skad cig la khyad par du 'gro ba'i shin tu sbyangs pa rgyun mi 'chad par lus la khyab pa'i phyir //
analyzed: skad cig skad cig la khyad par du 'gro ba'i shin tu sbyangs pa rgyun mi 'chad par lus la khyab pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the body is pervaded by a steady stream of pliancy that improves moment by moment,

original: skad cig re re la gnas ngan len gyi gnas thams cad 'jig par byed pa dang / bstan pa'i chos thams cad @252a * //
analyzed: skad cig re re la gnas ngan len gyi gnas thams cad 'jig par byed pa dang / bstan pa'i chos thams cad @252a * //
translated: you destroy all the latent tendencies for the misapprehension of reality in each instant.

original: khyad par med par ro gcig par mos pa de mnyam par 'jog pas phung po la sogs pa don gyi rnam pa tha dad pa'i 'du shes dang bral bas mdo la sogs pa'i chos kyi dga' ba la chos la dga' ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par med par ro gcig par mos pa de mnyam par 'jog pas phung po la sogs pa don gyi rnam pa tha dad pa'i 'du shes dang bral bas mdo la sogs pa'i chos kyi dga' ba la chos la dga' ba thob pa'o //
translated: You attain the joy of Dharma, which is to be interested in the Dharma of the sutras and so forth, because you are free of the discriminations of the different aspects of objects such as the aggregates, since you are equipoised in the conviction that all the teachings of the Buddha are of one taste, without any differences.

original: lhag mthong gi phan yon yang gnyis te /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi phan yon yang gnyis te /
translated: The benefits of insight are also of two kinds.

original: 'di ltar rab tu rnam par phye ba'i chos rgyun mi 'chad par mi brjod pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar rab tu rnam par phye ba'i chos rgyun mi 'chad par mi brjod pas /
translated: Because you are not constantly talking about the Dharma that you have analyzed in this way,

original: so sor dran pa tsam gyi sgo nas mdo la sogs pa'i chos rnams la shes rab kyi snang ba rnam par yongs su ma chad pa tshad med pa dang / gnas gyur pa'i snga rtags su gyur pa rnam par mi rtog pa mngon par 'du ma byas pa'i mtshan ma rnams kun du 'byung ba'o //üîΩde gnyi ga'i phan yon ni chos kyi sku shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa gnas gyur pas bsdus pa /
analyzed: so sor dran pa tsam gyi sgo nas mdo la sogs pa'i chos rnams la shes rab kyi snang ba rnam par yongs su ma chad pa tshad med pa dang / gnas gyur pa'i snga rtags su gyur pa rnam par mi rtog pa mngon par 'du ma byas pa'i mtshan ma rnams kun du 'byung ba'o // de gnyi ga'i phan yon ni chos kyi sku shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa gnas gyur pas bsdus pa /
translated: The sign of the transformation is the arising of the sign of the nonconceptual, unconditioned, immeasurable, and uninterrupted illumination of wisdom with regard to the Dharmas of the sutras and so forth, through the mere recollection of each.üîΩThe benefit of both is the transformation of the dharmakaya, which is included in the elimination of the obscurations to omniscience.

original: sa bcu pa la yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la yongs su sgrub pa'i phyir gong ma bas kyang gong ma'i rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags bskyed pa'i tshul gyis rgyu yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sa bcu pa la yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la yongs su sgrub pa'i phyir gong ma bas kyang gong ma'i rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags bskyed pa'i tshul gyis rgyu yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: The benefit of both is that the cause is fully appropriated, because the Dharma Body, which is the transformation of the basis, is perfected on the tenth spiritual level and is fully accomplished on the level of the Tathagata, by way of the generation of the superior, homogeneous cause in comparison with the former.

original: de dang de dag gang gis rnam par bsgoms pa na 'bras bu rnam pa lnga 'grub par 'gyur zhes yang dag par bstan to //
analyzed: de dang de dag gang gis rnam par bsgoms pa na 'bras bu rnam pa lnga 'grub par 'gyur zhes yang dag par bstan to //
translated: It is taught that when these are cultivated, the fivefold result is achieved.

original: bsgom pa rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgom pa rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five kinds of meditation?

original: shin tu sbyangs pa'i mtshan ma bsgom pa dang / tha mi dad pa bsgom pa dang / mtshan ma med pa bsgom pa dang / spyod pa med pa bsgom pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa bsgom pa'o //üîΩci'i phyir chos kyi sku'i rgyu mthun pa nyid du 'dra ba la /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa'i mtshan ma bsgom pa dang / tha mi dad pa bsgom pa dang / mtshan ma med pa bsgom pa dang / spyod pa med pa bsgom pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa bsgom pa'o // ci'i phyir chos kyi sku'i rgyu mthun pa nyid du 'dra ba la /
translated: Meditation on the sign of complete purification, meditation on the absence of differentiation, meditation on the absence of signs, meditation on the absence of activity, and meditation on complete nirvana.

original: shin tu rgyas pa'i chos la bdug pa dang phye ma la sogs pas mchod par 'os kyi /üîΩnyan thos kyi chos la de lta ma yin zhen /
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa'i chos la bdug pa dang phye ma la sogs pas mchod par 'os kyi / nyan thos kyi chos la de lta ma yin zhen /
translated: Why is the extensive Dharma alone worthy of worship with incense, perfume, and so on, since it is similar to the Listeners' Dharma as the outflow of the Dharma Body?

original: shin tu rgyas pa'i chos ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa'i chos ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the extensive Dharma is the basis for the benefit and happiness of all sentient beings.

original: don che bas bsod nams bla na med pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don che bas bsod nams bla na med pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is of great benefit, it is the basis for the highest merit.

original: chos rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba ste kun nas btus pa gsum pa'o /
analyzed: chos rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba ste kun nas btus pa gsum pa'o /
translated: This concludes the third chapter on the ascertainment of phenomena in The Ornament of the Discourses: The Complete Consolidation of the Realizations.

original: // / thob pa rnam nges gang /
analyzed: // / thob pa rnam nges gang /
translated: Ascertainment of Attainment

original: de gang zag rnams gzhag dang / mngon rtogs rnam gzhag tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de gang zag rnams gzhag dang / mngon rtogs rnam gzhag tu rig par bya'o //
translated: The latter should be understood as the presentation of the persons and the presentation of the clear realizations.

original: thob pa rnam par nges pa ni /
analyzed: thob pa rnam par nges pa ni /
translated: Ascertainment of attainment

original: thob par byed pa'i gang zag rnam par gzhag pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: thob par byed pa'i gang zag rnam par gzhag pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
translated: should be understood as the presentation of the persons who attain and the presentation of clear realization.

original: re zhig gang zag gi 'gro ba'i dbye ba ni /
analyzed: re zhig gang zag gi 'gro ba'i dbye ba ni /
translated: The classification of the migrations of personsüîΩis fourfold.

original: gang zag rdzas su med kyang rnam pa bzhis gang zag rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: gang zag rdzas su med kyang rnam pa bzhis gang zag rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Although the person does not substantially exist, the person is presented in four ways:üîΩbecause it is easy to impute conventions, because it follows worldly convention, because it does not frighten worldly beings and because it is easy to impute the self.

original: sla bar tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa mi @252b skrag pa'i phyir dang / bdag go sla bar tha snyad gdags pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sla bar tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa mi @252b skrag pa'i phyir dang / bdag go sla bar tha snyad gdags pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it easy to impute the self?

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa mang po'i mtshan nyid dang ming bdag nyid gcig tu bsdus te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa mang po'i mtshan nyid dang ming bdag nyid gcig tu bsdus te /
translated: It is easy to impute the self to the many aspects of form and so on, subsuming them under the name sentient being.

original: sems can zhes brtags nas song zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshegs med pa nyid du tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can zhes brtags nas song zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshegs med pa nyid du tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is easy to impute the convention of going and so on without difficulty.

original: 'jig rten gyi rjes su 'jug pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi rjes su 'jug pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How does it conform to the world?

original: 'jig rten na chos tsam gyi ming rnams kyis tha snyad thams cad la ma grags kyi 'on kyang phal cher sems can gyi ming gis so //
analyzed: 'jig rten na chos tsam gyi ming rnams kyis tha snyad thams cad la ma grags kyi 'on kyang phal cher sems can gyi ming gis so //
translated: In the world, all conventional expressions are not known by means of the mere names of things; rather, they are known by means of the names of sentient beings.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten pas tha snyad phal cher gdon mi za bar 'jig rten dang mthun par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten pas tha snyad phal cher gdon mi za bar 'jig rten dang mthun par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should not doubt that conventional expressions in the world are generally in conformity with the world.

original: 'jig rten pa mi skrag pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa mi skrag pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How does it not frighten the world?

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid la mi mkhas pa glo bur du thog mar rnam pa thams cad du sems can med par thos na skrag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid la mi mkhas pa glo bur du thog mar rnam pa thams cad du sems can med par thos na skrag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the ignorant, who are unskilled in the principle of dependent origination, would be frightened if they first heard that all things are absolutely devoid of sentient beings.

original: bdag ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bdag ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How does it not contradict itself?

original: gzhan dag nyes pa dang ldan pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa brjod pa'i phyir ni gal te gang zag rnam par gzhag par bya'i //
analyzed: gzhan dag nyes pa dang ldan pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa brjod pa'i phyir ni gal te gang zag rnam par gzhag par bya'i //
translated: Because it is not the case that the person is not mentioned at all, since it is mentioned in the scriptures in order to indicate that it possesses faults and virtues.

original: gzhan du na sems can gdags pa med par kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid tsam bstan na /üîΩche ge mo zhig gis sems can gyi rgyud la nyes pa 'di rnams spangs so //
analyzed: gzhan du na sems can gdags pa med par kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid tsam bstan na / che ge mo zhig gis sems can gyi rgyud la nyes pa 'di rnams spangs so //
translated: Otherwise, if the characteristics of defilement and purification were taught in terms of mere reality, without reference to a sentient being,üîΩthen it would not be possible to know that such and such a person has abandoned these faults in his stream of consciousness,

original: yon tan 'di rnams skyes so zhes shes par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang zag rnam gzhag gang /
analyzed: yon tan 'di rnams skyes so zhes shes par mi nus pa'i phyir ro // gang zag rnam gzhag gang /
translated: or that he has produced these virtues.üîΩThe classification of persons should be understood in terms of:

original: spyod pas rab dbye dang / nges 'byung gi rab dbye dang / nyer brten gyi rab dbye dang / sbyor bas rab dbye dang / 'bras bus rab dbye dang / rtogs pas rab dbyes kyang gang zag rnam gzhag tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: spyod pas rab dbye dang / nges 'byung gi rab dbye dang / nyer brten gyi rab dbye dang / sbyor bas rab dbye dang / 'bras bus rab dbye dang / rtogs pas rab dbyes kyang gang zag rnam gzhag tu rig par bya'o //
translated: the classification of their practice, the classification of their renunciation, the classification of their support, the classification of their application, the classification of their result, and the classification of their realization.

original: spyod pa'i rab dbye la sogs pa 'di rnams rnam pa bdun du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: spyod pa'i rab dbye la sogs pa 'di rnams rnam pa bdun du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: These classifications of practice, etc. are established as sevenfold.

original: spyod pas rab dbye gang /
analyzed: spyod pas rab dbye gang /
translated: What is the classification according to practice?

original: 'dod chags spyod pa dang / zhe sdang spyod pa dang / gti mug spyod pa dang / nga rgyal spyod pa dang / cha mnyam la spyod pa dang / nyon mongs zhen pa'i gang zag go //
analyzed: 'dod chags spyod pa dang / zhe sdang spyod pa dang / gti mug spyod pa dang / nga rgyal spyod pa dang / cha mnyam la spyod pa dang / nyon mongs zhen pa'i gang zag go //
translated: Those who engage in desire, those who engage in hatred, those who engage in delusion, those who engage in pride, those who engage in a balance of all, and those who engage in afflictions and clinging.

original: nges 'byung gi rab dbye gang /
analyzed: nges 'byung gi rab dbye gang /
translated: What is the classification of definite deliverance?

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa dang / rkyen gcig gis rtogs pa'i theg pa dang / theg pa chen po'i gang zag go //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa dang / rkyen gcig gis rtogs pa'i theg pa dang / theg pa chen po'i gang zag go //
translated: Those who are followers of the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle, those who are followers of the Vehicle of One who Attains Peace, and those who are followers of the Great Vehicle.

original: nyer brtan gyi rab dbye gang /
analyzed: nyer brtan gyi rab dbye gang /
translated: What is the classification of those who are steadfast?

original: tshogs ma bsags pa dang / tshogs bsags pa'ang yin la ma bsags pa dang / tshogs bsags pa'i gang zag go //
analyzed: tshogs ma bsags pa dang / tshogs bsags pa'ang yin la ma bsags pa dang / tshogs bsags pa'i gang zag go //
translated: Those who have not accumulated the collections, those who have and have not accumulated the collections, and those who have accumulated the collections.

original: sbyor bas rab dbye gang /
analyzed: sbyor bas rab dbye gang /
translated: What is the classification by means of application?

original: dad pas rjes 'brang dang / chos kyi rjes 'brang gi gang zag go //
analyzed: dad pas rjes 'brang dang / chos kyi rjes 'brang gi gang zag go //
translated: Those who are followers by means of faith and those who are followers by means of the doctrine.

original: 'bras bus rab dbye gang /
analyzed: 'bras bus rab dbye gang /
translated: What is the classification by means of result?

original: dad pas mos pa dang / mthong @253a * //
analyzed: dad pas mos pa dang / mthong @253a * //
translated: Those who are devoted through faith, those who have attained through seeing, those who have attained through acquisition, those who have attained through the stage of direct encounter, those who have attained through the stage of the result, those who have attained through the stage of the summit, those who have attained through the stage of patient acceptance, those who have attained through the stage of the eighth, those who have attained through the stage of the pratyekabuddha, and those who have attained through the stage of the bodhisattva.

original: pas thob pa dang / lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa dang / shes rab kyi cha la rnam grol dang / gnyi ga'i cha la rnam par grol ba dang / rgyun zhugs kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / rgyun zhugs dang /üîΩlan cig phyir 'ong gi 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: pas thob pa dang / lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa dang / shes rab kyi cha la rnam grol dang / gnyi ga'i cha la rnam par grol ba dang / rgyun zhugs kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / rgyun zhugs dang / lan cig phyir 'ong gi 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang /
translated: those who enter the result of stream enterer, stream enterers,üîΩthose who enter the result of once returner, once returners, those who enter the result of nonreturner,üîΩnonreturners, those who enter the result of arhat,üîΩarhats, those who are at most seven times reborn, those who pass from one family to another, those who have one interruption, those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state, those who attain nirvana after birth,
