original: mngon par 'du byed pa med pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / gong du zhugs pa dang / dgra bcom pa yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / gong du zhugs pa dang / dgra bcom pa yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang /
translated: 1. those who attain nirvana without application; 2. those who attain nirvana with application; 3. those who advance to higher levels; 4. those who are arhats subject to retrogressing;

original: bdag gsod pa'i chos can dang / rjes su srung ba'i chos can dang / gnas las mi g-yo ba dang / rtag tu rtogs pa'i skal bar gyur pa dang / mi 'khrugs pa'i chos kyi gang zag go //
analyzed: bdag gsod pa'i chos can dang / rjes su srung ba'i chos can dang / gnas las mi g-yo ba dang / rtag tu rtogs pa'i skal bar gyur pa dang / mi 'khrugs pa'i chos kyi gang zag go //
translated: 5. those who are arhats capable of regressing; 6. those who are arhats capable of protecting; 7. those who are arhats capable of abiding; 8. those who are arhats capable of penetrating; 9. those who are arhats capable of unwavering; 10. those who are arhats capable of realizing.

original: khams kyi rab tu dbye ba gang /
analyzed: khams kyi rab tu dbye ba gang /
translated: What is the classification according to the elements?

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa'o //
translated: 1. ordinary men in the realm of desire; 2. those in training; 3. those beyond training.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa ji lta bar gzugs na spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa ji lta bar gzugs na spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'ang de bzhin no //
translated: As in the realm of desire, so also in the realm of form and in the formless realm.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rkyen gcig gis rtogs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gang zag go //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rkyen gcig gis rtogs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gang zag go //
translated: The person who is a bodhisattva in the realm of desire, the person who is a bodhisattva in the realm of form, the person who is a bodhisattva in the realm of desire and who has attained the first stage, and the person who is a tathagata, inconceivable.

original: rtogs pas rab dbye gang /
analyzed: rtogs pas rab dbye gang /
translated: What is the classification according to realization?

original: mos pas spyod pa can dang / lhag pa'i bsam pas spyod pa can dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pas spyod pa can dang / mtshan ma med par spyod pa can dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par spyod pa can gyi byang chub sems dpa'i gang zag go //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa can dang / lhag pa'i bsam pas spyod pa can dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pas spyod pa can dang / mtshan ma med par spyod pa can dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par spyod pa can gyi byang chub sems dpa'i gang zag go //
translated: The person who is a bodhisattva who practices with devoted interest, the person who is a bodhisattva who practices with superior intention, the person who is a bodhisattva who practices with signs, the person who is a bodhisattva who practices without signs, and the person who is a bodhisattva who practices without purposeful motivation.

original: 'dod chags kyi spyod pa gang /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi spyod pa gang /
translated: What is the person who practices with passion?

original: gang chags pa rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: gang chags pa rgyas pa'o //
translated: It is the person in whom passion increases.

original: rnam rtog la spyod pa'i bar du yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: rnam rtog la spyod pa'i bar du yang de bzhin te /
translated: In the same way, up to the person who practices with discursive thought,

original: rnam rtog rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam rtog rgyas pa'o //
translated: in whom discursive thought increases.

original: chags par gyur pas dngos po ngan pa la yang 'dod chags cher 'byung ba dang / byung nas kyang ring du rjes su 'brel ba'i @253b phyir ro //
analyzed: chags par gyur pas dngos po ngan pa la yang 'dod chags cher 'byung ba dang / byung nas kyang ring du rjes su 'brel ba'i @253b phyir ro //
translated: Because of attachment, there is a great increase of passion for bad objects, and even when it has arisen, it is connected with it for a long time.

original: rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa'i bar du yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa'i bar du yang de bzhin te /
translated: The same is true up to the practice of discursive thought.

original: rang gi dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It should be applied according to its own nature.

original: cha mnyam spyod pa gang /
analyzed: cha mnyam spyod pa gang /
translated: What is the practice of equilibrium?

original: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin gnas pa'o //
translated: It is the state of being in which the passions are in equilibrium.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin gnas pa'o //
translated: It is the state of being in which the passions are in equilibrium.

original: nyon mongs pa shas chung ba rnam par spangs nas mnyam pa'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa shas chung ba rnam par spangs nas mnyam pa'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the state of being in which the passions are in equilibrium after having abandoned the excess of the passions.

original: dngos po ji lta ba dang mthun par nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ji lta ba dang mthun par nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the passions arise in accordance with the object.

original: nyon mongs zhen pa gang /
analyzed: nyon mongs zhen pa gang /
translated: What is the practice of attachment to the passions?

original: gang nyon mongs pa shin tu srab pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gang nyon mongs pa shin tu srab pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'o //
translated: It is the state of being in which the passions are very subtle.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las nyon mongs pa ches srab pa yod pa de ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las nyon mongs pa ches srab pa yod pa de ni /
translated: The nature of the defilements is taught as being the characteristic of the defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa bas kyang srab pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa bas kyang srab pa ste /
translated: The defilements are more subtle than the nature of the defilements.

original: sngon gnyen po goms par byas pa'i dbang gis dngos po shas che ba la yang rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa chud du kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gnyen po goms par byas pa'i dbang gis dngos po shas che ba la yang rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa chud du kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, by the power of the previous practice of the counteractives, even in the case of a strong object, the defilements do not arise in their natural state.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'i gang zag gang /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'i gang zag gang /
translated: The person of the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle

original: nyan thos kyi chos nyid nges pa'am ma nges pa la gnas pa dang / rang bzhin gyis dbang po rtul ba dang ; bdag rnam par thar bar bya ba'i phyir smon pa dang / yid 'byung ba dang / chags pa dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol bar bya ba'i bsam pa can dang /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos nyid nges pa'am ma nges pa la gnas pa dang / rang bzhin gyis dbang po rtul ba dang ; bdag rnam par thar bar bya ba'i phyir smon pa dang / yid 'byung ba dang / chags pa dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol bar bya ba'i bsam pa can dang /
translated: is either established in the certainty or uncertainty of the ≈örƒÅvaka Dharma, has dull faculties by nature, aspires to liberation for himself, is disgusted, free from attachment, and has the intention to be liberated.

original: nyan thos kyi sde snod la dmigs nas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub cing sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sde snod la dmigs nas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub cing sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin pa thob pa'o //
translated: and, having focused on the scriptural collection of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, they practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma and attain the culmination of the state of peace.

original: de ltar nyan thos kyi theg pa ni rigs dang / dbang po dang / smon lam dang / bsam pa dang / dmigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bras bu'i rab tu dbye ba rnams kyis bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyan thos kyi theg pa ni rigs dang / dbang po dang / smon lam dang / bsam pa dang / dmigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bras bu'i rab tu dbye ba rnams kyis bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the vehicle of the ≈õrƒÅvakas should be understood as being taught through the distinctions of lineage, faculties, aspiration, attitude, focal object, practice, and result.

original: 'di'i dbang po rtul po nyid ni rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i dbang po rtul po nyid ni rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po la ltos pa'o //
translated: Here, the fact that their faculties are dull is in comparison to the faculties of the pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: gzhan du na chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba la sogs pa dbang po rnon po yin no zhes bya ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba la sogs pa dbang po rnon po yin no zhes bya ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would contradict the statement that those who are followers of reality and so on have sharp faculties.

original: rkyen gcig gis rtogs pa'i gang zag gang /üîΩrkyen gcig gis rtogs pa'i chos nyid nges pa'am /
analyzed: rkyen gcig gis rtogs pa'i gang zag gang /üîΩrkyen gcig gis rtogs pa'i chos nyid nges pa'am /
translated: What is an individual who realizes through conditions?üîΩIt is the ascertainment of the reality that is realized through conditions.

original: ma nges pa la gnas pa dang / rang bzhin gyis dbang po 'bring dang / bdag rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir smon pa dang / yid 'byung ba dang / chags pa dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir bsam pa can dang /
analyzed: ma nges pa la gnas pa dang / rang bzhin gyis dbang po 'bring dang / bdag rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir smon pa dang / yid 'byung ba dang / chags pa dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir bsam pa can dang /
translated: Those abiding in indefinite lineage, those with medium naturally sharp intellectual faculty, those aspiring to purify their being, those aspiring to renunciation, those aspiring to freedom from attachment and those aspiring to liberation,

original: bdag nyid mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par bya ba'i bsam pa can dang / nyan thos kyi sde snod la dmigs nas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa dang / nges 'byed cha mthun @254a * //üîΩsngon ma bskyed pa'am /üîΩsngon 'bras bu ma thob pa'am /
analyzed: bdag nyid mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par bya ba'i bsam pa can dang / nyan thos kyi sde snod la dmigs nas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa dang / nges 'byed cha mthun @254a * // sngon ma bskyed pa'am / sngon 'bras bu ma thob pa'am /
translated: those aspiring to manifest perfect realization themselves, those who focus on the sravaka scriptural collection and practice Dharma in accordance with Dharma, those who previously generated the factors conducive to penetrative insight,üîΩthose who previously did not obtain their result,

original: sngon 'bras bu thob pa'am /
analyzed: sngon 'bras bu thob pa'am /
translated: those who previously obtained their result andüîΩthose who manifest the path by themselves in the absence of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba med par bdag nyid kyis lam mngon sum du byas na bse ru'i rtog pa ltar 'gyur te /üîΩgcig pur gnas pa'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba med par bdag nyid kyis lam mngon sum du byas na bse ru'i rtog pa ltar 'gyur te / gcig pur gnas pa'am /
translated: The first is like the rhinoceros,

original: rkyen gcig gis rgyal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rkyen gcig gis rgyal bar 'gyur te /
translated: for they abide alone and attain enlightenment through a single condition.

original: mthong bar spyod pa gang sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: mthong bar spyod pa gang sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin pa thob pa'o //
translated: Those who practice seeing are those who have attained the end of suffering.

original: de la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa sngon ma bskyed pa dang / sngon 'bras bu ma thob pa ni bse ru lta bur gyur te /
analyzed: de la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa sngon ma bskyed pa dang / sngon 'bras bu ma thob pa ni bse ru lta bur gyur te /
translated: Those who have not previously generated the factors conducive to penetrative insight and have not previously attained the result are rhinoceros like pratyekabuddhas.

original: gcig pu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gcig pu gnas pa'o //
translated: They live alone.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rang rgyal ba ni tshogs dang spyod pa blta'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rang rgyal ba ni tshogs dang spyod pa blta'o //
translated: Others are pratyekabuddhas who live in groups and their conduct is to be observed.

original: theg pa chen po pa'i gang zag gang /
analyzed: theg pa chen po pa'i gang zag gang /
translated: What is a person of the Mahayana?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid nges pa'am ma nges pa la gnas pa dang / rang bzhin gyis dbang po rno ba dang / sems can thams cad rnam par thar bar bya ba'i phyir smon pa dang / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pa can dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid nges pa'am ma nges pa la gnas pa dang / rang bzhin gyis dbang po rno ba dang / sems can thams cad rnam par thar bar bya ba'i phyir smon pa dang / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pa can dang /
translated: They are those who abide in the nature of a bodhisattva, either definitely or not definitely, who are naturally sharp, who aspire to liberate all sentient beings, who have the intention to attain nonabiding nirvana,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la dmigs nas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub cing sems can thams cad kyang yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la dmigs nas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub cing sems can thams cad kyang yongs su smin par byed /
translated: who focus on the bodhisattva canon, who practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma and who bring all sentient beings to full maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong la lung bstan pa yang thob cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong la lung bstan pa yang thob cing /
translated: They purify the buddha-field and also obtain the prophecy.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: And they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: lung bstan yang 'thob ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: lung bstan yang 'thob ces bya ba ni /
translated: They also obtain the prophecy.

original: sa brgyad pa la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that on the eighth level they obtain the acceptance that phenomena are unborn.

original: tshogs ma bsags pa gang /
analyzed: tshogs ma bsags pa gang /
translated: What is the accumulation of the equipment that is not complete?

original: gang bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos la dmigs nas mos pa dang / dad pa chung ba'i gang zag ste /
analyzed: gang bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos la dmigs nas mos pa dang / dad pa chung ba'i gang zag ste /
translated: It is the person who, having taken the truths as his object, has a small amount of faith and devotion.

original: der yang thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa chung zhing tshe rabs kyi dus nges pa med pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: der yang thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa chung zhing tshe rabs kyi dus nges pa med pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: And there, the factors conducive to liberation are small, and there is no certainty as to the time of rebirth.

original: tshogs bsags pa dang / ma bsags pa yin pa gang /
analyzed: tshogs bsags pa dang / ma bsags pa yin pa gang /
translated: What is the accumulation of the equipment that is complete?

original: gang bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos la dmigs nas mos pa dang / dad par ma'i gang zag ste /
analyzed: gang bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos la dmigs nas mos pa dang / dad par ma'i gang zag ste /
translated: It is the person who, having taken the truths as his object, has faith and devotion.

original: de yang thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'bring gi tshe rabs nges pa'i dus dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'bring gi tshe rabs nges pa'i dus dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the person who has accumulated the equipment and who has the medium stage of the factor conducive to penetrativeness possesses the time of a definite life.

original: tshogs bsags pa'i gang zag gang /
analyzed: tshogs bsags pa'i gang zag gang /
translated: What is the person who has not accumulated the equipment?

original: gang bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos la dmigs nas mos pa dang / dad pa chen po'i gang zag ste /
analyzed: gang bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos la dmigs nas mos pa dang / dad pa chen po'i gang zag ste /
translated: It is the person who, having taken as object the teaching concerning the truth, has great faith and great aspiration.

original: de yang thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa chen po tshe rabs de nyid dus can dang ldan pa'o //üîΩyang tshogs ma bsags pa ni bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos la dmigs nas /
analyzed: de yang thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa chen po tshe rabs de nyid dus can dang ldan pa'o // yang tshogs ma bsags pa ni bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos la dmigs nas /
translated: Moreover, the person who has not accumulated the equipment and who has the great stage of the factor conducive to penetrativeness possesses the time of a definite life.üîΩWhat is the person who has accumulated the equipment and who has not accumulated the equipment?

original: bden pa rnams la chos nges par sems @254b pa'i bzod ba chung du dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa rnams la chos nges par sems @254b pa'i bzod ba chung du dang ldan pa ste /
translated: It is the person who, having taken as object the teaching concerning the truth, possesses the small receptivity of the stage of the investigation of the teaching concerning the truth.

original: de yang nges 'byed cha mthun chung du tshe rabs kyi dus nges pa med pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang nges 'byed cha mthun chung du tshe rabs kyi dus nges pa med pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the person who has accumulated the equipment and who has not accumulated the equipment possesses the time of an indefinite life.

original: tshogs bsags pa yang yin la ma bsags pa'i 'di yin pa gang /
analyzed: tshogs bsags pa yang yin la ma bsags pa'i 'di yin pa gang /
translated: What is the person who has accumulated the equipment and who has not accumulated the equipment?

original: gang bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos la dmigs nas /
analyzed: gang bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos la dmigs nas /
translated: It is the person who, having taken as object the teaching concerning the truth,

original: bden ba rnams la chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa 'bring dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: bden ba rnams la chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa 'bring dang ldan pa ste /
translated: They possess medium patience that is definite in terms of Dharma with regard to the four truths.

original: de yang nges 'byed cha mthun 'bring po tshe rabs kyi dus nges pa dang ldan pa'o //üîΩtshogs bsags pa ni gang bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos la dmigs nas /
analyzed: de yang nges 'byed cha mthun 'bring po tshe rabs kyi dus nges pa dang ldan pa'o // tshogs bsags pa ni gang bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos la dmigs nas /
translated: They possess medium definite discernment that is definite in terms of lifetime.

original: bden pa rnams la chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa chen po dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa rnams la chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa chen po dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Those who have accumulated the collection possess great patience that is definite in terms of Dharma with regard to the four truths, focusing on Dharma that is governed by the four truths.

original: tshogs ma bsags pa la sogs pa de rnams dang ldan pa ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa chung du dang 'bring dang chen pos nges par 'byed pa'i phyogs gang bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs ma bsags pa la sogs pa de rnams dang ldan pa ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa chung du dang 'bring dang chen pos nges par 'byed pa'i phyogs gang bskyed pa'o //
translated: Those who have not accumulated the collection and so on possess the factors conducive to liberation and they generate the factors conducive to penetrative insight that are small, medium and great.

original: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa yang ma nges pa dang / nges pa dang / tshe rabs de nyid kyi dang ldan pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa yang ma nges pa dang / nges pa dang / tshe rabs de nyid kyi dang ldan pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Also, the realization of the four truths should be understood as definite or indefinite and as possessing the factors conducive to liberation in that very lifetime.

original: de la bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos ni mos pa dang dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams te /
analyzed: de la bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos ni mos pa dang dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams te /
translated: Dharma in terms of the truth is the factors conducive to merit that are characterized by aspiration and faith.

original: de nyid la chos nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nges par 'byed pa dang / mthun pa rnams ni dad pa mchog yin pa dang / shes rab mchog yin pa'i phyir te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid la chos nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nges par 'byed pa dang / mthun pa rnams ni dad pa mchog yin pa dang / shes rab mchog yin pa'i phyir te go rims bzhin no //
translated: The factors conducive to penetrative insight that are characterized by the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truths are supreme faith and supreme wisdom, respectively.

original: de yang 'jig rten chos mchog ma gtogs par nges 'byed cha mthun chen po tshe rabs de nyid kyi dus can dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten chos mchog ma gtogs par nges 'byed cha mthun chen po tshe rabs de nyid kyi dus can dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Moreover, one possesses the great factors conducive to penetrative insight that are concomitant with that life alone, except for the supreme mundane state.

original: 'jig rten chos mchog ni rang bzhin gyis skad cig ma ste tshe rabs de nyid kyi dus can kho na'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten chos mchog ni rang bzhin gyis skad cig ma ste tshe rabs de nyid kyi dus can kho na'o //
translated: The supreme mundane state is momentary by nature and is concomitant with that life alone.

original: rang bzhin gyis skad cig ma zhes pa ni rgyun ma yin zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis skad cig ma zhes pa ni rgyun ma yin zhes pa'i don te /
translated: Momentary by nature means not continuous.

original: tshe rabs de nyid kyi dus can kho na yin no //
analyzed: tshe rabs de nyid kyi dus can kho na yin no //
translated: It is concomitant with that life alone.

original: thar pa cha mthun dang / nges 'byed cha mthun chung du dang / 'bring rnams las yongs su nyams pa de ni kun du 'byung ba yongs su nyams par zad kyi /
analyzed: thar pa cha mthun dang / nges 'byed cha mthun chung du dang / 'bring rnams las yongs su nyams pa de ni kun du 'byung ba yongs su nyams par zad kyi /
translated: One who regresses from the small and medium stages conducive to penetrative insight and the stages conducive to liberation is said to completely regress from the arising of the factors conducive to penetrative insight.üîΩBut one does not completely regress from the latent states of those factors.

original: bag chags su nyams pas yongs su nyams pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sngar ma bskyed pa yang bskyed mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags su nyams pas yongs su nyams pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sngar ma bskyed pa yang bskyed mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is not necessary to generate again the roots of virtue that lead to nirvana that were not previously generated.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa chung ngu'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa chung ngu'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the small stage conducive to penetrative insight,üîΩthe Bhagavan said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Those who possess

original: 'jig rten pa yi yang dag lta //üîΩchen po su la yod gyur pa //üîΩde ni tshe rabs stong du yang /üîΩngan 'gror @255a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi yang dag lta // chen po su la yod gyur pa // de ni tshe rabs stong du yang / ngan 'gror @255a * //
translated: the great correct view of the world

original: 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: will not go to the lower realmsüîΩfor a thousand lives.

original: zhe'o // yang thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: zhe'o // yang thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are also four stages conducive to penetrative insight.

original: skabs su gtogs pa dang / mos pa las gyur pa dang / lhag par 'dod pa las gyur ba dang / thob pa las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: skabs su gtogs pa dang / mos pa las gyur pa dang / lhag par 'dod pa las gyur ba dang / thob pa las gyur pa'o //
translated: 1. that which is included in the occasion, 2. that which is derived from faith, 3. that which is derived from superior aspiration, and 4. that which is derived from attainment.

original: dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: The will to virtue is the first of the aids to liberation.

original: thar pa'i don du bya ba ji snyed pa de ni skabs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa'i don du bya ba ji snyed pa de ni skabs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: That which is included in the occasion is the entire process of liberation.

original: de dang rab tu ldan pa'i bstan pa la mos pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni mos pa las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de dang rab tu ldan pa'i bstan pa la mos pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni mos pa las gyur pa'o //
translated: That which is derived from faith is the faith of one who is endowed with the teaching.

original: dga' ba dang / dad pa dang ldan par thar pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa mang ba gang yin pa de ni lhag par 'dod pa las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang / dad pa dang ldan par thar pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa mang ba gang yin pa de ni lhag par 'dod pa las gyur pa'o //
translated: That which is derived from superior aspiration is the superior aspiration of one who is endowed with faith and who is intent on liberation.

original: de nyid las nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bskyed par nges pa gang yin pa de ni thob pa las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid las nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bskyed par nges pa gang yin pa de ni thob pa las gyur pa'o //
translated: That which is derived from attainment is the attainment of the aids to insight in one who is endowed with superior aspiration.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The aids to insight are of six kinds:

original: rjes su mthun pa dang / khyad par ba dang / rab tu rtogs pa dang / gzhan du yongs su bsgyur ba pa dang / skye ba gcig pa dang / stan gcig pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa dang / khyad par ba dang / rab tu rtogs pa dang / gzhan du yongs su bsgyur ba pa dang / skye ba gcig pa dang / stan gcig pa'o //
translated: The first is the concordant, the second is the distinctive, the third is the penetrating, the fourth is the transformation, the fifth is the single birth, and the sixth is the single sitting.

original: de la gang bden pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par dge ba'i rtsa ba dang po nyid chung du 'byung ba ni rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang bden pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par dge ba'i rtsa ba dang po nyid chung du 'byung ba ni rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: The first root of virtue that is virtuous in the sense of being directed toward the truths is the concordant.

original: gang 'bring du gyur pa de ni khyad par ba ste /
analyzed: gang 'bring du gyur pa de ni khyad par ba ste /
translated: The second is the distinctive, because it is superior to the first.

original: de bas ches mchog tu gyur pa'o //üîΩgang tshe de nyid la bden pa rtogs pa shas chen por gyur pa de rab tu rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas ches mchog tu gyur pa'o // gang tshe de nyid la bden pa rtogs pa shas chen por gyur pa de rab tu rtogs pa'o //
translated: The third is the penetrating, because it is superior to the second.

original: de yang gang ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams byang chub sems dpar 'gyur bar yongs su bsgyur ba dang / gang yang rang sangs rgyas rnams tshe gzhan la slob dpon med par mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par yongs su bsgyur ba de ni gzhan du yongs su bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: de yang gang ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams byang chub sems dpar 'gyur bar yongs su bsgyur ba dang / gang yang rang sangs rgyas rnams tshe gzhan la slob dpon med par mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par yongs su bsgyur ba de ni gzhan du yongs su bsgyur ba'o //
translated: The fourth is the transformation, because it is the transformation of the lineage of those of unfixed potential into the lineage of the bodhisattva, and it is the transformation of the pratyekabuddhas into the lineage of the buddhas, since they attain complete enlightenment without a teacher in another life.

original: gang tshe de nyid la rab tu rtogs par gyur pa de ni tshe gcig pa'o //
analyzed: gang tshe de nyid la rab tu rtogs par gyur pa de ni tshe gcig pa'o //
translated: The one who realizes the truth in that very lifetime is the one who is liberated in the present life.

original: gang stan de nyid la rab tu rtogs par gyur pa de ni stan gcig pa'o //
analyzed: gang stan de nyid la rab tu rtogs par gyur pa de ni stan gcig pa'o //
translated: The one who realizes the truth in that very session is the one who is liberated after one session.

original: dad pas rjes 'brang gi gang zag gang /
analyzed: dad pas rjes 'brang gi gang zag gang /
translated: What is the person who is a follower by faith?

original: gang tshogs bsags pa dbang po rtul po pha rol gyis bstan pa'i rjes su su 'brang nas bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gang tshogs bsags pa dbang po rtul po pha rol gyis bstan pa'i rjes su su 'brang nas bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is the person who has accumulated the provisions, who is of weak faculties, who follows the teaching of another, and who applies himself in order to realize the truth by himself.

original: chos kyi rjes 'brang gang /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes 'brang gang /
translated: What is the person who is a follower by faith in the teachings?

original: gang tshogs bsags pa dbang po rnon po /
analyzed: gang tshogs bsags pa dbang po rnon po /
translated: It is the person who has accumulated the provisions, who is of sharp faculties,

original: bdag nyid kyis bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'brangs nas bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'brangs nas bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba'o //
translated: who follows the teaching himself, and who applies himself in order to realize the truth by himself.

original: dad pas mos pa gang /
analyzed: dad pas mos pa gang /
translated: What is the person who is convinced through faith?üîΩIt is the person who is a follower by faith at the time of the result.üîΩWhat is the person who is liberated through predominance of faith?

original: dad pa'i rjes 'brang gi gang zag gang 'bras bu'i dus na'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i rjes 'brang gi gang zag gang 'bras bu'i dus na'o //
translated: It is the person who is a follower by faith at the time of the result.

original: mthong bas thob pa gang /
analyzed: mthong bas thob pa gang /
translated: What is the person who is a view-possessor?

original: chos kyi rjes 'brang @255b gi gang zag gang 'bras bu'i dus na'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes 'brang @255b gi gang zag gang 'bras bu'i dus na'o //
translated: It is the person who is a follower by the teaching at the time of the result.

original: lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa gang /
analyzed: lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa gang /
translated: What is made manifest by the body?üîΩ

original: gang slob pa rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan pa'i gang zag go //
analyzed: gang slob pa rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan pa'i gang zag go //
translated: One who is liberated by the body is a person who is a learner and meditates on the eight liberations.

original: lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa ni phyir mi 'ong bar brjod de /
analyzed: lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa ni phyir mi 'ong bar brjod de /
translated: One who is liberated by the body is said to be a nonreturner.

original: rnam par thar pa thob pa rnams lus kyis mngon sum du rdzogs par byas nas gnas pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rnam par thar pa thob pa rnams lus kyis mngon sum du rdzogs par byas nas gnas pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because those who have attained the liberations abide by perfecting them with the body.

original: rnam thar brgyad ni gzugs can gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam thar brgyad ni gzugs can gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The eight liberations are the liberation of the form realm seeing forms and so on.

original: phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //üîΩshes rab kyi cha las rnam grol gang /
analyzed: phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro // shes rab kyi cha las rnam grol gang /
translated: They will be explained later.

original: gang zag pa zad pa de rnam par thar ba brgyad la bsam gtan pa ma yin pa'i gang zag go //
analyzed: gang zag pa zad pa de rnam par thar ba brgyad la bsam gtan pa ma yin pa'i gang zag go //
translated: One who is liberated by wisdom is a person who has eliminated contaminants and does not meditate on the eight liberations.

original: shes rab kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa can ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgnyi ga'i cha las rnam grol gang /
analyzed: shes rab kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa can ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro // gnyi ga'i cha las rnam grol gang /
translated: Because he has completely abandoned the obscurations of affliction, which are the antithesis of wisdom, by means of wisdom.

original: gang zag pa zad pa rnam par thar pa brgyad la'ang bsam gtan pa'i gang zag go //
analyzed: gang zag pa zad pa rnam par thar pa brgyad la'ang bsam gtan pa'i gang zag go //
translated: One who is liberated by both is a person who has eliminated contaminants and meditates on the eight liberations.

original: gnyi ga'i cha la rnam par grol ba ni /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i cha la rnam par grol ba ni /
translated: Those who are liberated from both aspects

original: nyon mongs pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa thams cad las gang rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa thams cad las gang rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: are those who are liberated from all the obstacles of the defilements and of meditative concentration.

original: rgyun du zhugs kyi 'bras bu gang //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs kyi 'bras bu gang //
translated: What is the result of the stream-enterer?

original: gang nges 'byed cha mthun rnams dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig bco lnga rnams la gnas pa'i gang zag go //üîΩnges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa stan gcig pa nas brtsams te dang po'i 'bras bu ma thob kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: gang nges 'byed cha mthun rnams dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig bco lnga rnams la gnas pa'i gang zag go // nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa stan gcig pa nas brtsams te dang po'i 'bras bu ma thob kyi bar du'o //
translated: It is the person who is in the fifteen thought-moments of the path of vision, beginning with the path of preparation.üîΩThe path of preparation is the path of application.

original: rgyun zhugs gang /
analyzed: rgyun zhugs gang /
translated: What is the stream-enterer?üîΩIt is the person who is in the sixteenth thought-moment of the path of vision.

original: gang mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig bcu drug rnams la gnas pa'i gang zag go / mthong ba'i lam ni yang dag pa nyid du nges par gyur pa la zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: gang mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig bcu drug rnams la gnas pa'i gang zag go / mthong ba'i lam ni yang dag pa nyid du nges par gyur pa la zhugs pa ste /
translated: The path of vision is the entry into the certainty of perfection.

original: chos mngon par rtogs pa yang de yin no //
analyzed: chos mngon par rtogs pa yang de yin no //
translated: It is also the clear understanding of the Truth.

original: mthong pa'i lam gyi tha ma la dang po'i 'bras bu ma thob pa su zhe na /
analyzed: mthong pa'i lam gyi tha ma la dang po'i 'bras bu ma thob pa su zhe na /
translated: Who is the person who has not obtained the first result, although he is in the last thought-moment of the path of vision?

original: 'dod pa rnams la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i gang zag ni yang dag pa nyid du nges par gyur pa la zhugs nas rgyun zhugs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i gang zag ni yang dag pa nyid du nges par gyur pa la zhugs nas rgyun zhugs su 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is not free from attachment to the desire realm enters the ascertainment of reality and becomes a stream-enterer.

original: gang rim pa bzhin du phyogs las 'dod chags dang bral ba yang 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang ma bral zhing yang dag pa nyid du nges par gyur pa la 'jug par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang rim pa bzhin du phyogs las 'dod chags dang bral ba yang 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang ma bral zhing yang dag pa nyid du nges par gyur pa la 'jug par brjod pa yin no //
translated: One who is free from attachment to the desire realm through the stages is said to enter the ascertainment of reality without being free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: phal cher la 'dod chags dang bral ba ni yang dag pa nyid du nges par gyur pa la lan cig phyir 'ong du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phal cher la 'dod chags dang bral ba ni yang dag pa nyid du nges par gyur pa la lan cig phyir 'ong du 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is free from attachment to most of the desire realm enters the ascertainment of reality and becomes a once-returner.

original: gang sngar 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pa'i spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa drug po spangs nas /
analyzed: gang sngar 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pa'i spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa drug po spangs nas /
translated: One who previously, by the mundane path, abandons the six types of afflictions to be abandoned by the path of cultivation in the desire realm,

original: phal chen las 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur te /
analyzed: phal chen las 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur te /
translated: and becomes free from attachment to most of the desire realm,

original: phyis yang dag pa nyid la nges par 'jug pa @256a * //
analyzed: phyis yang dag pa nyid la nges par 'jug pa @256a * //
translated: later enters the ascertainment of reality and becomes a non-returner.

original: de ni sems kyi skad cig bcu drug la lan cig phyir 'ong ba nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ni sems kyi skad cig bcu drug la lan cig phyir 'ong ba nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: In sixteen thought-moments, one becomes a Once-Returner.

original: 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba ni /
translated: One becomes a Non-Returner by being detached from the realm of desire.

original: yang dag pa nyid du nges par gyur ba la zhugs nas phyir mi 'ong du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du nges par gyur ba la zhugs nas phyir mi 'ong du 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes a Non-Returner by entering into the certainty of perfection.

original: gang rnam pa dgu char spangs nas 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te nges par gyur pa la 'jug pa de ni phyir mi 'ong ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang rnam pa dgu char spangs nas 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te nges par gyur pa la 'jug pa de ni phyir mi 'ong ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes a Non-Returner by being detached from the realm of desire after having abandoned the nine categories of defilements.

original: gang mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas rgyun du zhugs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas rgyun du zhugs par 'gyur na /
translated: If one becomes a Stream-Winner by abandoning all the defilements which should be abandoned by means of vision,

original: ci'i phyir kun sbyor gsum spangs nas rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir kun sbyor gsum spangs nas rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bshad ce na /
translated: why is it said that one becomes a Stream-Winner by abandoning the three fetters?

original: gtso bor bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bor bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the inclusion of the principal elements.

original: thar pa thob pa'i gag sa su gyur ba gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: thar pa thob pa'i gag sa su gyur ba gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of the inclusion of the principal elements of the acquisition of liberation.

original: ci'i phyir gtso bo zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gtso bo zhe na /
translated: Why are they principal?

original: mi 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa dang / phyin kyang log par nges 'byung gi rgyu yin pa dang / yang dag pas nges 'byung ma yin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa dang / phyin kyang log par nges 'byung gi rgyu yin pa dang / yang dag pas nges 'byung ma yin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of not going, because even if one goes, it is the cause of false renunciation, and because it is the cause of not being truly delivered.

original: de la 'jig tshogs su lta bas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen nas /
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs su lta bas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen nas /
translated: Therein, through the false view of individuality, one becomes attached to the five aggregates as the basis of appropriation as an ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: gnas la dga' bas sdug bsngal las mi 'phag go //üîΩji ste 'phags kyang thar par bya ba'i phyir tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang the tshom gyi lam ngan pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / lam bzang po la the tshom za ba'i phyir log par mi 'byung gi /
analyzed: gnas la dga' bas sdug bsngal las mi 'phag go // ji ste 'phags kyang thar par bya ba'i phyir tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang the tshom gyi lam ngan pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / lam bzang po la the tshom za ba'i phyir log par mi 'byung gi /
translated: One does not transcend suffering because of the delight in the basis.

original: yang dag par nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag par nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one does transcend, one does not become truly delivered because of the false view of individuality, because one is attached to the bad path of the overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices as paramount, and because one doubts the good path.

original: yang shes bya la log par rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / 'jig tshogs su lta bas shes bya la log par rtogs te /
analyzed: yang shes bya la log par rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / 'jig tshogs su lta bas shes bya la log par rtogs te /
translated: It is the cause of false understanding of the knowable, because the false view of individuality is the cause of false understanding of the knowable.

original: sdug bsngal tsam la bdag dang bdag gi ba'i mtshan nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal tsam la bdag dang bdag gi ba'i mtshan nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it superimposes the characteristics of self and mine onto mere suffering.

original: lta ba la log par rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas lta ba la log par rtogs te de dag par yid ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba la log par rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas lta ba la log par rtogs te de dag par yid ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of error regarding view, because it is the cause of error regarding view through the overesteeming of morality and asceticism, since one is convinced that they are pure.

original: gnyen po la log par rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen po la log par rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of error regarding the antidote, because it is the cause of error regarding the antidote through doubt.

original: the tshom gyis ni gnyen po la log par rtogs te dkon mchog gsum la nges par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom gyis ni gnyen po la log par rtogs te dkon mchog gsum la nges par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Doubt is the cause of error regarding the antidote, because one does not ascertain the Three Jewels.

original: len cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bul 'jug pa gang /
analyzed: len cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bul 'jug pa gang /
translated: What is the person who enters the result of once-returner?

original: gang bsgom pa'i lam la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rnam pa lnga spangs pa'i lam gyi gang zag go //
analyzed: gang bsgom pa'i lam la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rnam pa lnga spangs pa'i lam gyi gang zag go //
translated: It is the person on the path of meditation who has abandoned five types of defilements of the desire realm.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi sa gang du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa 'bring po'i bar du spangs pa'i lam la rnam par @256b gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi sa gang du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa 'bring po'i bar du spangs pa'i lam la rnam par @256b gnas pa'o //
translated: He is situated on the path of abandonment of the middling of the great of the defilements of the realm of desire, in the path of insight.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong gi gang zag gang /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong gi gang zag gang /
translated: What is the person who is a Once-Returner?

original: bsgom pa'i lam la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa drug spong ba'i lam gyi gang zag go //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa drug spong ba'i lam gyi gang zag go //
translated: He is the person who is on the path of abandonment of the sixth and seventh categories of defilements of the realm of desire, in the path of mental cultivation.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa 'bring po'i chung du spong ba'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa la rnam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa 'bring po'i chung du spong ba'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa la rnam par gnas pa'o //
translated: He is situated on the path of abandonment of the weak-weak of the middling of the defilements of the realm of desire.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa gang /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa gang /
translated: What is the person who is in the attainment of the fruit of Non-Returner?

original: gang bsgom pa'i lam la 'dod pan spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa bdun pa dang / brgyad pa spong ba'i lam gyi gang zag go //
analyzed: gang bsgom pa'i lam la 'dod pan spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa bdun pa dang / brgyad pa spong ba'i lam gyi gang zag go //
translated: He is the person who is on the path of abandonment of the seventh and eighth categories of defilements of the realm of desire, in the path of mental cultivation.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i gong du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring po spong ba'i lam la rnam par gnas pa'o //üîΩphyir mi 'ong ba'i gang zag gang /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i gong du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring po spong ba'i lam la rnam par gnas pa'o // phyir mi 'ong ba'i gang zag gang /
translated: The once-returner is the person who is situated on the path of abandoning the ninth category of defilements of the realm of desire, that is, the weak-weak category.üîΩThe non-returner is the person who is situated on the path of abandoning the ninth category of defilements of the realm of desire.üîΩThe perfected being is the person who is situated on the path of abandoning the ninth category of defilements of the summit of cyclic existence.

original: gang bsgom pa'i lam la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu pa spong ba'i lam gyi gang zag go //
analyzed: gang bsgom pa'i lam la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu pa spong ba'i lam gyi gang zag go //
translated: The once-returner is the person who is situated on the path of abandoning the weak-strong category of defilements of the realm of desire, that is, on the path of abandoning the ninth category of defilements of the realm of desire.

original: dgu pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu'i chung du spong ba'i lam la yongs su rdzogs pa la rnam par gnas pa'o //üîΩgang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas slang bar bya ba thams cad spangs pa'i phyir mi 'ong bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: dgu pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu'i chung du spong ba'i lam la yongs su rdzogs pa la rnam par gnas pa'o // gang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas slang bar bya ba thams cad spangs pa'i phyir mi 'ong bar 'gyur na /
translated: The non-returner is the person who is situated on the path of abandoning the weak-weak category of defilements of the summit of cyclic existence.

original: ci'i phyir tha ma'i cha mthun gyi kun sbyor lnga spangs bas phyir mi 'ong zhes bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tha ma'i cha mthun gyi kun sbyor lnga spangs bas phyir mi 'ong zhes bshad ce na /
translated: If the non-returner is the person who has abandoned all the defilements of the realm of desire that should be abandoned by the path of cultivation, why is it said that he is a non-returner because he has abandoned the five lower fetters?

original: gtso bos bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bos bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the principal ones are mentioned.

original: ci'i phyir gtso bo zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gtso bo zhe na /
translated: Why are they principal?

original: 'gro ba dang / khams tha ma'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang / khams tha ma'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the cause of the last life and the last realm.

original: 'gro ba dang khams tha ma'i rgyu nyid kyis gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang khams tha ma'i rgyu nyid kyis gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are the principal ones because they are the cause of the last life and the last realm.

original: 'gro ba tha ma ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags kyi 'gro ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'gro ba tha ma ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags kyi 'gro ba rnams so //
translated: The last life is the destinies of hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: khams tha ma ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: khams tha ma ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: The last realm is the desire realm.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom rnams kyis ni 'gro ba tha ma las mi 'da' bas de'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom rnams kyis ni 'gro ba tha ma las mi 'da' bas de'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: Among them, the afflicted view of the self, clinging to rules and ritual as supreme, and doubt do not transcend the last life, so they are its cause.

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems gnyis kyis ni thams tha ma las mi 'da' bas de'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems gnyis kyis ni thams tha ma las mi 'da' bas de'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: Both sensual desire and malice do not transcend the last realm, so they are its cause.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu la 'jug pa'i gang zag gang /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu la 'jug pa'i gang zag gang /
translated: What is the person who enters the result of arhatship?

original: gang srid pa'i rtse'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rnam pa brgyad kyi bar spong ba'i lam gyi gang zag go //
analyzed: gang srid pa'i rtse'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rnam pa brgyad kyi bar spong ba'i lam gyi gang zag go //
translated: It is the person who abandons up to eight types of afflictions of the peak of existence on the path of abandoning.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi gang zag gang /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi gang zag gang /
translated: What is a person who is an arhat?

original: gang srid rtse'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu pa spong ba'i lam gyi gang zag go //
analyzed: gang srid rtse'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu pa spong ba'i lam gyi gang zag go //
translated: It is a person who is on the path abandoning the ninth stage of the afflictions of the summit of existence.

original: gang khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom par 'gyur na /
translated: If one becomes an arhat by abandoning all the afflictions that are to be abandoned in the three realms,

original: ci'i phyir gong ma'i cha mthun gyi kun sbyor lnga spangs pas dgra bcom pa zhes bshad ce na /üîΩgtso @257a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir gong ma'i cha mthun gyi kun sbyor lnga spangs pas dgra bcom pa zhes bshad ce na / gtso @257a * //
translated: why is it said that one becomes an arhat by abandoning the five bonds associated with higher states?

original: bos bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bos bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the principal ones.

original: ci'i phyir gtso bo zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gtso bo zhe na /
translated: Why are they principal?

original: gong ma nye bar len pa'i rgyu dang / gong ma yongs su mi gtong ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gong ma nye bar len pa'i rgyu dang / gong ma yongs su mi gtong ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the cause of appropriating higher rebirth and the cause of not relinquishing higher rebirth.

original: gong ma nye bar len pa dang yongs su mi gtong ba'i rgyu nyid kyis gtso bo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gong ma nye bar len pa dang yongs su mi gtong ba'i rgyu nyid kyis gtso bo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of principal is the cause of appropriating higher rebirth and the cause of not relinquishing higher rebirth.

original: de la gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags gnyis kyis ni 'dod pa'i khams nas gong ma nye bar len te /
analyzed: de la gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags gnyis kyis ni 'dod pa'i khams nas gong ma nye bar len te /
translated: The two attachments to the form and formless realms appropriate higher rebirth from the desire realm.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su skye zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su skye zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he is reborn in the realm of form or the formless realm.

original: rgod pa dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa rnams kyis ni gong ma yongs su mi gtong ste /
analyzed: rgod pa dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa rnams kyis ni gong ma yongs su mi gtong ste /
translated: By the three, excitation, pride, and ignorance, one does not abandon the higher realms.

original: sred pa dang / nga rgyal dang / the tshom gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan de nyid du der kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sred pa dang / nga rgyal dang / the tshom gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan de nyid du der kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is defiled in the very meditative concentration in which craving, pride, and doubt predominate.

original: mchog tu thogs na srid pa bdun pa gang /
analyzed: mchog tu thogs na srid pa bdun pa gang /
translated: What is the person who attains the highest by the seven times at most?

original: rgyun zhugs kyi gang zag nyid lha dang mi'i rnams su lan bdun 'dres par srid pa 'khor bar byas nas gang sdug bsngal gyi mtha' ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun zhugs kyi gang zag nyid lha dang mi'i rnams su lan bdun 'dres par srid pa 'khor bar byas nas gang sdug bsngal gyi mtha' ma thob pa'o //
translated: It is the stream-enterer who, having transmigrated among gods and humans for seven existences at most, puts an end to suffering.

original: rigs nas rigs su gang /
analyzed: rigs nas rigs su gang /
translated: What is the person who goes from family to family?

original: lha 'am mi rnams su rigs nas rigs su song nas sdug bsngal gyi mtha' ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: lha 'am mi rnams su rigs nas rigs su song nas sdug bsngal gyi mtha' ma thob pa'o //
translated: It is the person who, having transmigrated from family to family among gods and humans, puts an end to suffering.

original: de rgyun du zhugs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de rgyun du zhugs pa nyid do //
translated: This is the stream-enterer.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa lha 'am mi rnams kyi nang du nges par srid pa gnyis 'khor bar byas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa lha 'am mi rnams kyi nang du nges par srid pa gnyis 'khor bar byas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The once-returner enters into the fruit of the once-returner, having transmigrated twice among the gods or humans, and then attains Nirvana.

original: bar chad gcig pa gang /
analyzed: bar chad gcig pa gang /
translated: What is the once-returner with one interval?

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba lha rnams su sdug bsngal gyi mtha' ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba lha rnams su sdug bsngal gyi mtha' ma thob pa'o //
translated: The once-returner who, among the gods, attains the end of suffering.

original: de ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba nyid do //
analyzed: de ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba nyid do //
translated: This is the once-returner.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa lha nyid kyi nang du srid pa gcig 'khor bar byas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa lha nyid kyi nang du srid pa gcig 'khor bar byas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: The non-returner enters into the fruit of the non-returner, having transmigrated once among the gods, and then attains Nirvana.

original: bar chad gcig pa ni bar skabs te /
analyzed: bar chad gcig pa ni bar skabs te /
translated: With one interval means with one interval.

original: skye ba'i skabs yod pa de'i de ni bar chad gcig pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i skabs yod pa de'i de ni bar chad gcig pa'o //
translated: With one birth remaining, that is the one with one interval.

original: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang /
analyzed: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang /
translated: What is the non-returner who attains Nirvana in the intermediate state?

original: de rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds:

original: skye ba'i kun sbyor ni spangs la mngon par 'grub pa'i kun sbyor ma spangs pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i kun sbyor ni spangs la mngon par 'grub pa'i kun sbyor ma spangs pa ste /
translated: The one who has abandoned the fetter of rebirth, but not the fetter of full becoming.

original: bar do'i srid pa mngon par 'grub pa na gang la mngon du byas nas sdug bsngal gyi mtha' ma thob pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gang gis skye ba'i yul du song nas nying mtshams sbyar te /

translated: When the intermediate existence is actualized, it is the path that is actualized in order to attain the end of suffering, and it is the aspect of the affliction by which one goes to the place of rebirth and links up with it.

original: de zad nas bag la nyal tsam gyi sa shi ba'i 'og tu phung po mngon par 'grub pa de'i lhag ma lus pas bar ma do'i srid pa mngon par 'grub ste /
analyzed: de zad nas bag la nyal tsam gyi sa shi ba'i 'og tu phung po mngon par 'grub pa de'i lhag ma lus pas bar ma do'i srid pa mngon par 'grub ste /

original: mngon par goms par byas pa'i lam mngon du gyur nas /
analyzed: mngon par goms par byas pa'i lam mngon du gyur nas /
translated: It is the path that is actualized through thorough cultivation.

original: bag la nyal lhag ma spangs te /
analyzed: bag la nyal lhag ma spangs te /
translated: The remainder of the latent state is abandoned.

original: de nyid du yongs su mya @257b ngan las 'da' ba dang / de'i 'og tu yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar gang gsungs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid du yongs su mya @257b ngan las 'da' ba dang / de'i 'og tu yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar gang gsungs par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is what is referred to as ‚Äúattaining complete nirvana in that very life‚Äù and ‚Äúattaining complete nirvana in the next life.‚Äù

original: bar ma do'i srid pa mngon par grub pa na skye ba'i srid par 'gro bar mi sems pa nyid ni lam gang mngon du byas nas sdug bsngal gyi mtha' ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: bar ma do'i srid pa mngon par grub pa na skye ba'i srid par 'gro bar mi sems pa nyid ni lam gang mngon du byas nas sdug bsngal gyi mtha' ma thob pa'o //
translated: When the intermediate existence is actualized, it is the path that is actualized in order to go to the rebirth existence, but not in order to attain the end of suffering.

original: mngon par bsams nas skye ba'i srid pa la mngon par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par bsams nas skye ba'i srid pa la mngon par gnas pa ste /
translated: Having manifested it, he is situated in the birth existence.

original: skye ba'i srid pa ni ma thob pa na /
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa ni ma thob pa na /
translated: When he has not yet attained the birth existence,

original: gang lam mngon du byas nas sdug bsngal gyi mtha' ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: gang lam mngon du byas nas sdug bsngal gyi mtha' ma thob pa'o //
translated: he manifests the path and attains the end of suffering.

analyzed: de yang skye ba'i yul la mi 'phags pa dang / 'phags pa tsam dang / ring du song ba'i gnas skabs kyis rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, this should be understood as threefold, according to the stages of the non-noble, the mere noble, and the one who has gone far, in the realm of birth.

analyzed: skyes bu dam pa 'gro ba'i mdo'i tshul gyis so //

translated: One who attains nirvana after birth is one who,

analyzed: gnyis kyi kun sbyor ma spangs pa gzugs khams su skyes pa tsam nyid kyi gang lam mngon du byas nas sdug bsngal gyi mtha' ma thob pa'o //

analyzed: mngon par 'du byed med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang /
translated: One who attains nirvana without application is one who,

analyzed: gang skyes nas mngon par 'du byed med par lam mngon du byas nas sdug bsngal gyi mtha' ma thob pa'o //
translated: after being born, manifests the path without application and attains the end of suffering.üîΩOne who attains nirvana through application is one who,üîΩafter being born, manifests the path through application and attains the end of suffering.

analyzed: bsgrim mi dgos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de las bzlog pa ni mngon par 'du byed dang bcas pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //

original: mngon par skye ba'i khyad par dang / skye ba'i khyad par dang / 'bras bu'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: mngon par skye ba'i khyad par dang / skye ba'i khyad par dang / 'bras bu'i khyad par ro //
translated: the difference in manifestation, the difference in birth, and the difference in result.

original: de la dmigs pa'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i khyad par ni /
translated: The difference in object is

original: shin tu rgyas pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the extensive as its object.

original: nye bar rton pa'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar rton pa'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference in reliance?

original: bskal pa chen po grangs med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskal pa chen po grangs med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it perfects the accumulations of merit and knowledge during three periods of countless great aeons.

original: rab tu rtogs pa'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu rtogs pa'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference in realization?

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i dbang du bya ba'i chos la sbyor ba'i 'phen pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis de gnyi gar rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i dbang du bya ba'i chos la sbyor ba'i 'phen pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis de gnyi gar rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it realizes both the personal and phenomenal selves to be nonexistent by means of supramundane knowledge, by the impetus of the application to the Dharma which is based on the nondiscriminative knowledge of the reality of the personal and phenomenal selves.

original: khas len pa'i khyad par ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khas len pa'i khyad par ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference in acceptance?

original: bdag dang sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it accepts the equality of self and all beings.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference in emancipation?

original: sa bcu dag gi nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bcu dag gi nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it is emancipated from the ten stages.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference in possession?

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the realm of nonabiding nirvana.

original: gnas dang 'khor g-yog gi khyad par ji lta bu zhen /
analyzed: gnas dang 'khor g-yog gi khyad par ji lta bu zhen /
translated: What is the difference in their abode and retinue?

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba dang / 'dul ba'i skye bo nye bar sdud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba dang / 'dul ba'i skye bo nye bar sdud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they purify the buddhaverse and attract disciples.

original: mngon par skye ba'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par skye ba'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference in their birth?

original: pha bzhin du rang gi rigs yang dag par 'dzin pa'i gtso bo'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha bzhin du rang gi rigs yang dag par 'dzin pa'i gtso bo'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the principal ones who hold the family of the buddhas.

original: skye ba'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference in their rebirth?

original: 'khor gyi dkyil @261b 'khor rnams su skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil @261b 'khor rnams su skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are reborn in the midst of the retinue.

original: 'bras bu'i khyad par ni gnas 'gyur ba'i khyad par dang / yon tan mang po'i khyad par dang / rnam pa lnga'i khyad par dang / sku gsum gyi khyad par dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i khyad par dang / 'dres shing nyer 'dres kyi ye shes kyi nus pa thob pa'i khyad par dang /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i khyad par ni gnas 'gyur ba'i khyad par dang / yon tan mang po'i khyad par dang / rnam pa lnga'i khyad par dang / sku gsum gyi khyad par dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i khyad par dang / 'dres shing nyer 'dres kyi ye shes kyi nus pa thob pa'i khyad par dang /
translated: The differences in result should be understood in terms of the difference in the transformation of the basis, the difference in the many qualities, the difference in the five aspects, the difference in the three bodies, the difference in nirvana, the difference in attaining the power of the intermingled and closely placed mindfulness of wisdom,

original: sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par dang / 'dres pa dang nyer 'dres kyi las byed pa'i khyad par dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i ston pa'i thabs kyi khyad par dang / yongs su skyob pa rnam pa lnga'i khyad par gyis kyang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par dang / 'dres pa dang nyer 'dres kyi las byed pa'i khyad par dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i ston pa'i thabs kyi khyad par dang / yongs su skyob pa rnam pa lnga'i khyad par gyis kyang rig par bya'o //
translated: the difference in the purification of obscurations, the difference in the performance of intermingled and closely placed actions, the difference in the means of teaching perfect enlightenment and nirvana, and the difference in the five kinds of complete protection.

original: de la gnas gyur pa'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la gnas gyur pa'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference in the transformation of the basis?

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi gnas ngan len gyi rnam pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi gnas ngan len gyi rnam pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all aspects of afflicted negative tendencies are eliminated.

original: yon tan bla na med pa thams cad kyi gnas nyid du gyur pas gnas gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan bla na med pa thams cad kyi gnas nyid du gyur pas gnas gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a basis because it is the basis of all unsurpassed qualities.

original: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the distinction of the excellence of its qualities?

original: stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa yon tan dpag tu med pa bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa yon tan dpag tu med pa bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the accomplishment of immeasurable qualities such as the powers, the fearlessnesses, and the special qualities of the Buddha.

original: rnam pa lnga'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the distinction of its five aspects?

original: rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i khyad par te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i khyad par te /
translated: The distinction of its purity, etc.

original: de la rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: de la rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ni /
translated: The distinction of its purity is

analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa spong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the abandonment of the afflictions together with their traces.

original: yongs su dag pa'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i khyad par ni /
translated: The distinction of its purification is

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the purification of the Buddha land.

original: lus kyi khyad par ni /
analyzed: lus kyi khyad par ni /
translated: The distinction of its body is

original: chos kyi sku yongs su bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sku yongs su bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the accomplishment of the Dharma body.

original: longs spyod kyi khyad par ni /
analyzed: longs spyod kyi khyad par ni /
translated: The distinction of its enjoyment is
