analyzed: rtag tu byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang lhan cig 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams su chos sna tshogs la rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he always enjoys the various teachings in the circles of assemblies together with the bodhisattvas.

original: las kyi khyad par ni /
analyzed: las kyi khyad par ni /
translated: The difference in action:

original: ci rigs par sprul pa rnams kyis kun du 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa rnams su sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci rigs par sprul pa rnams kyis kun du 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa rnams su sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the emanations accomplish the deeds of the buddhas in the infinite world systems, as is appropriate.

original: sku gsum gyi khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sku gsum gyi khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference in the three bodies?

original: rang bzhin dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku yongs su 'grub pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku yongs su 'grub pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he attains the accomplishment of the essential body, the beatific body, and the emanation body.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference in nirvana?

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su sems can thams cad la phan pa kun rgyun mi gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su sems can thams cad la phan pa kun rgyun mi gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not interrupt the continuity of all benefits for all beings in the realm of nirvana without remainder.

original: 'dres shing nyer 'dres kyi ye shes kyi nus pa thob pa'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'dres shing nyer 'dres kyi ye shes kyi nus pa thob pa'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference in the attainment of the power of the intuition that is mixed and thoroughly mixed?

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings ro gcig pa nyid dang / de la brten pa rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog shes pa @262a * //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings ro gcig pa nyid dang / de la brten pa rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog shes pa @262a * //
translated: The utterly pure dharmadhatu is of one taste and the knowledge of the supreme of all aspects is based on that.üîΩ

original: nyid rnams la sangs rgyas thams cad sems so sor mthu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid rnams la sangs rgyas thams cad sems so sor mthu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The buddhas are the mind because of the power of individual realization in the single taste of the extremely pure realm of reality and in the knowledge of the supreme aspects.

original: sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference in the purification of obscurations?

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because all afflictive and knowledge obscurations are eliminated.

original: 'dres shing nyer 'dres kyi las byed pa'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'dres shing nyer 'dres kyi las byed pa'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference in the performance of mixed and closely mixed activities?

original: sems can re re 'dul ba'i phyir yang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dbang gis byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can re re 'dul ba'i phyir yang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dbang gis byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because all buddhas perform activities by the power of all buddhas in order to guide each sentient being.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das par ston pa'i thabs kyi khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das par ston pa'i thabs kyi khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference in the method of demonstrating complete enlightenment and nirvana?

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du ci rigs par phye ma'i mtha'i bar du yang dang yang sangs rgyas 'byung ba la sogs pa ston pas ;
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du ci rigs par phye ma'i mtha'i bar du yang dang yang sangs rgyas 'byung ba la sogs pa ston pas ;
translated: He shows the repeated appearance of Buddhas, etc., in all the world systems of the ten directions, down to the ultimate atom, in whatever way is necessary.

original: 'dul ba thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa dang / rnam par thar par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dul ba thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa dang / rnam par thar par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He brings all those to be trained to full maturity and liberates them.

original: yongs su skyob pa rnam pa lnga'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su skyob pa rnam pa lnga'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the five kinds of protection?

original: nye bar 'tshe ba la sogs pa la yongs su skyob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar 'tshe ba la sogs pa la yongs su skyob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He protects from harm, etc.

original: de la nye bar 'tshe ba la yongs su skyob pa ni /
analyzed: de la nye bar 'tshe ba la yongs su skyob pa ni /
translated: He protects from harm,

original: grong khyer du 'jug pa la sogs pa rnams kyis 'ong ba la sogs pa'i mig la sogs pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grong khyer du 'jug pa la sogs pa rnams kyis 'ong ba la sogs pa'i mig la sogs pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he protects from harm by entering the city, etc., and by giving eyes, etc.

original: thabs ma yin pa las yongs su skyob pa ni /
analyzed: thabs ma yin pa las yongs su skyob pa ni /
translated: He protects from what is not the means,

original: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba thob pas lta ba ngan pa thams cad dang bral bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba thob pas lta ba ngan pa thams cad dang bral bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he protects from what is not the means by causing the attainment of mundane right view, and by freeing from all bad views.

original: ngan song las yongs su skyob pa ni /
analyzed: ngan song las yongs su skyob pa ni /
translated: He protects from the miserable destinies,üîΩbecause he protects from the miserable destinies by causing the attainment of the supramundane path.

original: mthong ba'i lam bskyed pas ngan 'gro las shin tu bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam bskyed pas ngan 'gro las shin tu bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the path of insight is generated, one is completely turned away from miserable realms.

original: 'jig tshogs las yongs su skyob pa ni dgra bcom pa nyed mngon du byed pas khams gsum pa la rnam par thar par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs las yongs su skyob pa ni dgra bcom pa nyed mngon du byed pas khams gsum pa la rnam par thar par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One is completely protected from the perishable collection because one is liberated from the three realms by manifesting the state of an arhat.

original: theg pa las yongs su skyob pa ni /
analyzed: theg pa las yongs su skyob pa ni /
translated: One is completely protected from the spiritual levels because

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams theg pa dman pa las 'dun pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams theg pa dman pa las 'dun pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: one is completely protected from the lower spiritual levels by the bodhisattvas.

original: tshad med pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can 'di rnams mngon rtogs gang gis bsdus she na /üîΩrjes la mngon rtogs gang /
analyzed: tshad med pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can 'di rnams mngon rtogs gang gis bsdus she na / rjes la mngon rtogs gang /
translated: By what realizations are these special qualities such as the immeasurables subsumed?

original: mthar thug mngon rtogs kyis bsdus par rig par bya'o //üîΩyon tan khyad par can rnams ni /
analyzed: mthar thug mngon rtogs kyis bsdus par rig par bya'o // yon tan khyad par can rnams ni /
translated: One should understand that they are subsumed by the subsequent realization.üîΩThe special qualities are subsumed by the final realization.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyis bsgom pa'i lam dang mi slob pa'i lam mngon par bsgrub ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyis bsgom pa'i lam dang mi slob pa'i lam mngon par bsgrub ste /
translated: The special qualities are subsumed by the path of cultivation and the path of no training of the noble disciples.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag rjes la mngon par rtogs pa dang / mthar thug mngon par rtogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag rjes la mngon par rtogs pa dang / mthar thug mngon par rtogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they should be known as subsequent clear realization and ultimate clear realization.

original: de rnams kyang gang /üîΩtshad med rnams dang / rnam thar rnams dang / zil gyis non gyi skye mched rnams dang / ma lus pa'i skye mched rnams dang / nyon mongs med pa dang / smon nas @262b shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang /
analyzed: de rnams kyang gang / tshad med rnams dang / rnam thar rnams dang / zil gyis non gyi skye mched rnams dang / ma lus pa'i skye mched rnams dang / nyon mongs med pa dang / smon nas @262b shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang /
translated: What are they?üîΩThe immeasurables, liberations, subjugations, totalities, analytical knowledges,üîΩsuperknowledges, marks and minor marks, purities, powers, fearlessnesses, establishments of mindfulness,

original: mngon shes rnams dang / mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnams dang / yongs su dag pa rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang dran pa nye bar gnas dang / bsrung med rnams dang / bsnyel ba med pa'i chos nyid dang /
analyzed: mngon shes rnams dang / mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnams dang / yongs su dag pa rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang dran pa nye bar gnas dang / bsrung med rnams dang / bsnyel ba med pa'i chos nyid dang /
translated: unforgettings, and spontaneous activities.

original: bag chags legs par bcom pa dang / thugs rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thun mong ma yin pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
analyzed: bag chags legs par bcom pa dang / thugs rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thun mong ma yin pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
translated: the complete destruction of the residues, the great compassion, the eighteen dharmas exclusive to a Buddha, and the knowledge of all the modes.

analyzed: mdo sde las ji ltar 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: These are as they are found in the Sutras.

analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa mdo sde gzhan dag las ji skad bstan pa de dag ni nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen por yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //

analyzed: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na /
translated: And these, in brief,

analyzed: rnam pa lngas ci rigs su mtshan nyid bshad par blta bar bya ste /
translated: are to be understood as the characteristics of the five aspects, respectively.

analyzed: gnas dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / rang bzhin dang / grogs kyis so //

translated: The aspect is thinking, ‚ÄúMay they be endowed with happiness.‚Äù

translated: The nature is concentration and wisdom.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is included in serenity and insight.

analyzed: yon tan thams cad kyi grogs ni /
translated: The support of all good qualities is

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
translated: the mind and mental factors.

original: snying rje la sogs pa rnams la yang ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje la sogs pa rnams la yang ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Love, compassion, and so forth should be applied in whatever way is suitable.

original: snying rje gang /
analyzed: snying rje gang /
translated: What is compassion?

original: sems can rnams sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i bsam pa'i gnas yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i bsam pa'i gnas yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The basis of the thought of sentient beings being free from suffering is the correct attainment of the concentration and wisdom that are concomitant with the mind and mental factors.

original: byams pa ji lta bar ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos zhes pa'i yon tan kun rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa ji lta bar ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos zhes pa'i yon tan kun rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that loving kindness is the same as meditative stabilization, wisdom, and the mind and mental factors associated with them.

original: dga' ba gang /
analyzed: dga' ba gang /
translated: What is joy?

original: sems can rnams la bde ba dang mi 'bral ba'i gnas yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams la bde ba dang mi 'bral ba'i gnas yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: It is the meditative stabilization that is the attainment of the state of never being separated from the happiness of sentient beings.

original: btang snyoms gang /üîΩbsam gtan la brten te /
analyzed: btang snyoms gang / bsam gtan la brten te /
translated: What is equanimity?

original: sems can rnams la phan pa'i bsam pa'i gnas yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin @263a * //üîΩno ; / phan pa'i gnas yang dag par 'byor ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan pa'i bsam pa'i gnas yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin @263a * // no ; / phan pa'i gnas yang dag par 'byor ba zhes pa ni /
translated: It is the meditative stabilization that is the attainment of the state of the intention to benefit sentient beings.

original: sems can bde bar gyur pa la sogs pa la rjes su chags pa la sogs pa btang snyoms su byed cing /
analyzed: sems can bde bar gyur pa la sogs pa la rjes su chags pa la sogs pa btang snyoms su byed cing /
translated: The attainment of the state of the intention to benefit is the equanimity that is the abandonment of attachment to the happiness of sentient beings and so forth.

original: kye ma nyon mongs pa rnam par grol bar gyur cig snyom pa ni btang snyoms kyi rnam par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: kye ma nyon mongs pa rnam par grol bar gyur cig snyom pa ni btang snyoms kyi rnam par rig par bya ste /
translated: The equanimity of the absence of afflictions is the thought, ‚ÄúOh, may they be free from afflictions!‚Äù

original: de yang phan pa'i bsam pa'i gnas zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de yang phan pa'i bsam pa'i gnas zhes brjod do //
translated: This is called the basis of the thought of benefit.

original: gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba ji lta bu //
analyzed: gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba ji lta bu //
translated: What is the internal sense field?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: sprul pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan la brten te /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan la brten te /
translated: In order to be liberated from the obscurations of emanation, one relies on the absorptions.

original: lta ba po bdag la gzugs su 'du shes pa dang ma bral ba'am /üîΩbzhag pas kyang rung ste /üîΩsnang ba'i gzugs rnams la lta ba'i gnas yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / de dag dang mtshungs ldan gyi sems sems byung gi chos rnams so //
analyzed: lta ba po bdag la gzugs su 'du shes pa dang ma bral ba'am / bzhag pas kyang rung ste / snang ba'i gzugs rnams la lta ba'i gnas yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / de dag dang mtshungs ldan gyi sems sems byung gi chos rnams so //
translated: The seer is not free from the notion of form with regard to oneself,üîΩor else one is placed in the concentration and insight that are the mastery of the basis of the view of forms that appear.

original: ji srid du mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgrib pa las rnam rnams so //
analyzed: ji srid du mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgrib pa las rnam rnams so //
translated: This is the Dharma of mind and mental factors that are associated with that.üîΩAs long as one is not liberated from the obscurations of nirvana,

original: ji srid du mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par thar pa dang po'o zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ji srid du mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par thar pa dang po'o zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: this is the first liberation.

original: de la ji ltar na gzugs can zhes brjod pa ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la brten nas /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na gzugs can zhes brjod pa ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la brten nas /
translated: Here, what is called form is the formless absorptions.

original: bdag la gzugs kyi 'du shes rnam par mi 'jig pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: bdag la gzugs kyi 'du shes rnam par mi 'jig pa'i phyir ram /
translated: because the perception of form has not yet been destroyed in him,

original: gzugs kyi 'du shes 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'du shes 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or because he is able to place the perception of form.

original: lta ba po la gzugs kyi 'du shes mngon par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lta ba po la gzugs kyi 'du shes mngon par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he manifests the perception of form.

original: ji ltar na gzugs rnams la lta ba zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzugs rnams la lta ba zhes brjod ce na /
translated: How is it that he sees forms?

original: kha dog mdzes pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i gzugs rnams su mos nas lta ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog mdzes pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i gzugs rnams su mos nas lta ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he sees forms that are beautiful or ugly, etc.

original: ji ltar na rnam par thar pa zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam par thar pa zhes brjod ce na /
translated: How is it that he is liberated?

original: 'dis sprul pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis sprul pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is liberated from the obscuration of emanation.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi'i gzugs la ji lta bu /
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi'i gzugs la ji lta bu /
translated: He does not perceive forms internally, but he sees forms externally, small or large, beautiful or ugly.

original: lta ba po bdag la gzugs su 'du shes pa dang bral ba dang / gzugs med kyi 'du shes bzhag pas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: lta ba po bdag la gzugs su 'du shes pa dang bral ba dang / gzugs med kyi 'du shes bzhag pas kyang rung ste /
translated: Because he is free from the perception of form in regard to himself, the seer, and because he places the perception of the absence of form.üîΩHe sees forms that are beautiful or ugly, etc.

original: snang ba'i gzugs rnams la blta ba'i gnas yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snang ba'i gzugs rnams la blta ba'i gnas yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as above.

original: nang gzugs med pa'i 'du shes pa zhes brjod pa ni /üîΩgzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la brten nas gzugs kyi 'du shes rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: nang gzugs med pa'i 'du shes pa zhes brjod pa ni / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la brten nas gzugs kyi 'du shes rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving the notion of the internal as formless‚Äù means

original: gzugs med pa'i 'du shes 'jog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i 'du shes 'jog pa'i phyir te /
translated: that, on the basis of the formless meditative absorption, the notion of form is destroyed or the notion of the formless is established.

original: lta ba po la ming du 'du shes pa mngon du byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lta ba po la ming du 'du shes pa mngon du byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is because the term ‚Äúone who sees‚Äù means ‚Äúone who actualizes the notion of name.‚Äù

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: sdug pa'i rnam thar lus kyi mngon sum du byas te rdzogs par byas nas gnas pa ji lta bu /
analyzed: sdug pa'i rnam thar lus kyi mngon sum du byas te rdzogs par byas nas gnas pa ji lta bu /
translated: How does one ‚Äúdwell having directly realized the liberation of beauty and having brought it to perfection?‚Äù

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩ@263b ji srid sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i sgrib pa las rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir rang gi sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i gzugs rnams la phan tshun ltos pa'i 'du shes dang / phan tshun rjes su 'brel ba'i 'du shes dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / @263b ji srid sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i sgrib pa las rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir rang gi sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i gzugs rnams la phan tshun ltos pa'i 'du shes dang / phan tshun rjes su 'brel ba'i 'du shes dang /
translated: It is as follows.üîΩAs long as one has not attained the notion of mutual dependence, the notion of mutual connection, and the notion of mutual singularity with regard to one‚Äôs own beautiful and ugly forms in order to be liberated from the obscurations that arise from the afflictions of beauty and ugliness,

original: phan tshun ro gcig pa'i 'du shes thob nas /
analyzed: phan tshun ro gcig pa'i 'du shes thob nas /
translated: one has not attained the liberation of beauty.

original: de'i gnas yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i gnas yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Its basis is the same as before.

original: ji srid sdug pa dang mi sdug par sprul ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji srid sdug pa dang mi sdug par sprul ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is in order to be liberated from the affliction of the emanation of the pleasant and unpleasant.

original: de la phan tshun ltos pa'i 'du shes zhes pa rgya cher gang gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de la phan tshun ltos pa'i 'du shes zhes pa rgya cher gang gsungs pa ni /
translated: As for the perception of mutual dependence, it is as stated in the sutra:

original: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i gzugs rnams la phan tshun ltos pa'i 'du shes dang / phan tshun rjes su 'brel ba'i 'du shes la brten nas /
analyzed: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i gzugs rnams la phan tshun ltos pa'i 'du shes dang / phan tshun rjes su 'brel ba'i 'du shes la brten nas /
translated: ‚ÄúBased on the perception of mutual dependence and the perception of mutual connection with regard to pleasant and unpleasant forms,

original: phan tshun ro gcig pa'i 'du shes thob par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: phan tshun ro gcig pa'i 'du shes thob par 'gyur ro /
translated: one attains the perception of a single taste with regard to their mutual dependence.

original: 'di ltar sdug pa'i gzugs kyi 'du shes la ltos nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug pa'i gzugs kyi 'du shes la ltos nas /
translated: Thus, in dependence on the perception of pleasant forms,

original: de las gzhan pa rnams la mi sdug go zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rnams la mi sdug go zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: those that are different from them are called unpleasant.

original: mi sdug pa la ltos nas sdug ces bya bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mi sdug pa la ltos nas sdug ces bya bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: In dependence on the unpleasant, the pleasant is conceived,

original: ma ltos par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma ltos par ni ma yin te /
translated: but not without dependence.

original: rigs gcig pa rnams nyid mthong na sdug pa dang mi sdug pa nyid kyi blo mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs gcig pa rnams nyid mthong na sdug pa dang mi sdug pa nyid kyi blo mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because when one sees only one type, the idea of beauty or ugliness does not arise.

original: de bzhin du sdug pa rnams la yang mi sdug pa nyid rjes su 'brel te mi sdug pa rnams la yang sdug pa nyid rjes su 'brel to //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug pa rnams la yang mi sdug pa nyid rjes su 'brel te mi sdug pa rnams la yang sdug pa nyid rjes su 'brel to //
translated: In the same way, the idea of ugliness is related to the beautiful, and the idea of beauty is related to the ugly.

original: sdug par grags pa la yang dpags pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: sdug par grags pa la yang dpags pa tsam du zad de /
translated: The idea of beauty is merely a convention.

original: skra la sogs pa mi gtsang ba'i rdzas sum cu rtsa drug gi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skra la sogs pa mi gtsang ba'i rdzas sum cu rtsa drug gi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the body is included in the thirty-six impure substances, such as hair, etc.

original: de ltar gzugs thams cad phan tshun bsres te /
analyzed: de ltar gzugs thams cad phan tshun bsres te /
translated: Thus, all forms are mixed together.

original: sdug pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i rnam pa'i 'du shes kyis mos par byed do //
analyzed: sdug pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i rnam pa'i 'du shes kyis mos par byed do //
translated: One should imagine them with the perception of the aspect of the single taste of beauty.

original: de ltar ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du gzugs la mos pa la dbang 'byor ba thob pa de sdug pa dang mi sdug par sprul pa la sgrib pa spong ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du gzugs la mos pa la dbang 'byor ba thob pa de sdug pa dang mi sdug par sprul pa la sgrib pa spong ba ste /
translated: In this way, one who has attained mastery over the imagination of forms as one wishes, abandons the obscurations to the emanation of beauty and ugliness.

original: der ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i sgrib pa spong ngo //
analyzed: der ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i sgrib pa spong ngo //
translated: There, one abandons the obscurations to the arising of affliction.

original: sprul pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa gang zhe na /üîΩsdug pa'i gzugs sprul pa la ni chags pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa gang zhe na / sdug pa'i gzugs sprul pa la ni chags pa'o //
translated: What is the defilement of emanation?üîΩIt is attachment to the emanation of a beautiful form.

original: mi sdug pa'i gzugs sprul pa la ni mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i gzugs sprul pa la ni mi mthun pa'o //
translated: It is aversion to the emanation of an ugly form.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam thar gang /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam thar gang /
translated: What is the liberation of the sphere of infinite space?

original: thar pa'i rjes mthun nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la gnas pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: thar pa'i rjes mthun nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la gnas pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: It is the attainment of the sphere of infinite space which is favorable to liberation.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam thar gyi lta bar rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi rnam thar kyang de bzhin @264a * //üîΩdu blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam thar gyi lta bar rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi rnam thar kyang de bzhin @264a * // du blta bar bya ste /
translated: The liberation of the sphere of infinite consciousness, the liberation of the sphere of nothingness and the liberation of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception should be understood in the same way.

original: 'di ltar ji srid zhi ba'i rnam thar la gnas pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ji srid zhi ba'i rnam thar la gnas pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In fact, it is in order to be delivered from the obscurations to the attainment of the liberation of the sphere of infinite space, etc.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa bzhi po de rnams ni 'phags pa nyan thos kyi zag pa med pa'i rjas su mthun pa'i dag pa gang yin pa de dag rnam par thar pa zhes bya ba thob ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa bzhi po de rnams ni 'phags pa nyan thos kyi zag pa med pa'i rjas su mthun pa'i dag pa gang yin pa de dag rnam par thar pa zhes bya ba thob ste /
translated: The four formless states, beginning with infinite space, are called liberations because they are the pure states that are concordant with the uncontaminated states of the noble listeners.

original: de'i ro myong ba las rnam par thar par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ro myong ba las rnam par thar par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They liberate from the taste of the meditative concentrations.

original: zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa ni /
analyzed: zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa ni /
translated: The liberation of peace is

original: gzugs rnams las shin tu 'das nas gzugs med pa gang yin pa dag ste de dag la mi chags pa las yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs rnams las shin tu 'das nas gzugs med pa gang yin pa dag ste de dag la mi chags pa las yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: the formless states, which are beyond form. They are pure because one is not attached to them.

original: de'i sgrib pa ni gzugs med pa'i ro myong ba'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrib pa ni gzugs med pa'i ro myong ba'o //
translated: Their obscuration is the taste of the formless states.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i rnam thar gang /
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i rnam thar gang /
translated: The liberation that is the cessation of discriminations and feelings

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: is as follows.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to liberate from the obscurations that are the cessation of discriminations and feelings,üîΩthe bodhisattvas

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa la brten te zhi ba'i rnam thar la gnas pa las yang dag par 'das nas thar pa dang mthun par gnas pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i gang sems dang sems byung gi chos rnams 'gog
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa la brten te zhi ba'i rnam thar la gnas pa las yang dag par 'das nas thar pa dang mthun par gnas pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i gang sems dang sems byung gi chos rnams 'gog
translated: The liberation of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception is the attainment of the cessation of all mental and material things, which is the state of perfect ease that transcends the state of perfect ease of the liberation of peace.

original: pa'o // 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i gnas ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched do //
analyzed: pa'o // 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i gnas ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched do //
translated: The sphere of neither perception nor non-perception is the state of the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang med pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang grogs ni med do //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang med pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang grogs ni med do //
translated: It has no object, aspect, or companion, because there is no mind or mental factors.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams 'gog pa'o //
translated: Its nature is the cessation of mind and mental factors.

original: de yang thar pa dang mthun pa'i gnas te /
analyzed: de yang thar pa dang mthun pa'i gnas te /
translated: It is the state that is in accord with liberation.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi gnas gyur pa'i gnas thob kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang mi 'byung ba'i gnas skabs na mchog tu zhi ba dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyang kun du mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi gnas gyur pa'i gnas thob kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang mi 'byung ba'i gnas skabs na mchog tu zhi ba dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyang kun du mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind and mental factors that are the basis of the supramundane path and the attainment of the state of transformation do not occur in the state of supreme peace, and the afflicted mind does not occur.

original: 'phags pa rnams la ni 'di dag gis gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la ni 'di dag gis gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the noble ones abide in these.

original: 'di dag ni 'phags pa gnas pa'i rnam par thar pa brgyad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'phags pa gnas pa'i rnam par thar pa brgyad ces bya'o //
translated: These are called the eight liberations in which the noble ones abide.

original: de la 'phags pa dag ni gnas pa gnyis kyis lan mang du gnas te /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa dag ni gnas pa gnyis kyis lan mang du gnas te /
translated: The noble ones abide in two of these liberations frequently.

original: gsum pa dang brgyad pas de mchog tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum pa dang brgyad pas de mchog tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they abide in the third and eighth liberations in a supreme way.

original: de'i phyir de gnyis lus kyi mngon sum du byed de rdzogs par byas nas gnas so zhes gsungs te gzhan rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de gnyis lus kyi mngon sum du byed de rdzogs par byas nas gnas so zhes gsungs te gzhan rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that they manifest the first and last liberations physically, and abide having perfected them, but not the others.

original: gzugs can dang gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar ba la sgrib pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs can dang gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar ba la sgrib pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
translated: This is because they have completely abandoned the obscurations to the liberations of the form and formless realms, respectively.
